original: 'das @138b ma dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das @138b ma dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entity of the past and future states does not exist.

original: de bzhin du nus pa nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag tu 'gyur gyi rdzas ni ma yin pas 'gog pa bzhin rnam par 'gyur ba med pa gzhan nus pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nus pa nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag tu 'gyur gyi rdzas ni ma yin pas 'gog pa bzhin rnam par 'gyur ba med pa gzhan nus pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: In the same way, the potency itself becomes past and future, but not the substance. Therefore, like cessation, the other, which is not subject to change, is the cause of potency.

original: de la yang nus pa gzhan khas blang bar bya ba ni gnas skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang nus pa gzhan khas blang bar bya ba ni gnas skabs ma yin no //
translated: And in that case, it is not the state that is to be accepted as another potency.

original: ci ste rdzas bzhin rtag pa de lta na yang rdzas bzhin du bya ba rtag tu yod pas de'i phyir dus su rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste rdzas bzhin rtag pa de lta na yang rdzas bzhin du bya ba rtag tu yod pas de'i phyir dus su rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs so //
translated: But if it is permanent like substance, then, since the action would always exist like substance, it is not reasonable to posit it in terms of time.

original: mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa gcig nyid dus thams cad du bya ba byed pa la gegs mi srid do snyam ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa gcig nyid dus thams cad du bya ba byed pa la gegs mi srid do snyam ste /
translated: And it is impossible for a single entity, which is not different in characteristic, to be obstructed from performing its function at all times.

original: 'dri ba ni 'di yang brjod par bya dgos te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dri ba ni 'di yang brjod par bya dgos te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The question is this:

original: de'i bdag nyid kho nar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kho nar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It must be said that it is just the nature of that.

original: sa la sogs pa mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams kyang mig la sogs pas rnam pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir 'di mtha' gcig tu ma yin zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams kyang mig la sogs pas rnam pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir 'di mtha' gcig tu ma yin zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: Master Saṃghabhadra says that this is not so, because earth and so on, which have different characteristics, are seen to have different aspects by the eye and so on.

original: der ni rdzas tha dad pa rnam pa tha dad pa bshad do //
analyzed: der ni rdzas tha dad pa rnam pa tha dad pa bshad do //
translated: There it is said that different substances have different aspects.

original: sa la sogs pa rdzas kyi sgo nas tha dad pa rnams kyi 'brel pa gang las brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rdzas kyi sgo nas tha dad pa rnams kyi 'brel pa gang las brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: If earth and so on are different in substance, from what are they related?

original: sa la sogs pa mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa rnams kyang rnam pa tha dad pa mthong bas so //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa rnams kyang rnam pa tha dad pa mthong bas so //
translated: Earth and so on, which are not different in characteristics, are seen to have different aspects.

original: gal te rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you say that they are not assembled conditions,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu rkyen rnams ma tshogs par bya ba byed na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu rkyen rnams ma tshogs par bya ba byed na /
translated: then if they perform functions in the past and future when conditions are not assembled,

original: de la gegs med par res 'ga' bya ba byed la res 'ga' mi byed do zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: de la gegs med par res 'ga' bya ba byed la res 'ga' mi byed do zhes bya ba med do //
translated: then there would be no obstruction to their sometimes performing functions and sometimes not performing functions.

original: rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that they always exist.

original: rkyen rnams kyang rkyen can bzhin du khas blangs pa de dag gi yod pa rnams la ma tshogs pa mi rigs par bshad do //🔽yang pyukta ma pi tsi na ba gatstsha ma stasya yushma to bh'a bam kata ma sya pratyutpanna sya ae ta tte na ka ri tr'am gri h'i ta ya t'o n'a ga ta ta sya ta sya kasm'attanna bha ba t'i kalba ya ti /
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyang rkyen can bzhin du khas blangs pa de dag gi yod pa rnams la ma tshogs pa mi rigs par bshad do // yang pyukta ma pi tsi na ba gatstsha ma stasya yushma to bh'a bam kata ma sya pratyutpanna sya ae ta tte na ka ri tr'am gri h'i ta ya t'o n'a ga ta ta sya ta sya kasm'attanna bha ba t'i kalba ya ti /
translated: And it is not possible for the conditions to exist without the assemblage of those which are accepted as being like that which has conditions.

original: de ni ma 'ongs pa'i chos yod pa nyid khyad par gyis gnas pa'i khyad par de la da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o zhe na ma yin te /🔽rang bzhin (gang yang bshad /🔽ma rnyog pa /
analyzed: de ni ma 'ongs pa'i chos yod pa nyid khyad par gyis gnas pa'i khyad par de la da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o zhe na ma yin te / rang bzhin (gang yang bshad / ma rnyog pa /
translated: Moreover, if it is said that the future dharma, which is the existence itself, is the particular abiding of the particular, then that is the present, no.🔽For,

original: de'i tshe dang ldan pa /🔽dngos po / gang /
analyzed: de'i tshe dang ldan pa / dngos po / gang /
translated: the nature of that which is not yet arisen is explained as that which is not yet arisen.🔽The nature of that which is in the process of ceasing is explained as that which is in the process of ceasing.🔽The nature of that which is past is explained as that which is past.🔽The nature of that which is future is explained as that which is future.🔽The nature of that which is present is explained as that which is present.

original: da ltar byung ba 'di de yis byed pa bzung ba gang las ma 'ongs pa 'das pa ci las da med par rtog par byed/) de'i khyad par bral ba'i @139a * //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba 'di de yis byed pa bzung ba gang las ma 'ongs pa 'das pa ci las da med par rtog par byed/) de'i khyad par bral ba'i @139a * //
translated: What is the nature of that which is not yet arisen?🔽What is the nature of that which is in the process of ceasing?🔽What is the nature of that which is past?🔽What is the nature of that which is future?🔽What is the nature of that which is present?

original: phyir ro // 'das pa zhes bya'o zhe na ma yin te rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir ro // 'das pa zhes bya'o zhe na ma yin te rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that it is called past because it is past, no, because it is devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: don gyi sgo nas de nyid ni ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi bya ba 'jug ste /
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas de nyid ni ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi bya ba 'jug ste /
translated: It is the present because it is the basis of the activity of the present.

original: 'jug pa'i bya ba ni de'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i bya ba ni de'i bya ba'o //
translated: The activity of the present is its activity.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin te zhig pa'i phyir 'das pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin te zhig pa'i phyir 'das pa'o //
translated: The future is not the present because it is destroyed.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad brjod de /
translated: Therefore, this is said:

original: bya ba ni dus kyis rnam par gzhag pas de'i phyir shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di lan ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba ni dus kyis rnam par gzhag pas de'i phyir shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di lan ma yin no //
translated: Since activity is established by time, this is not an answer in order to understand.

original: rtag tu bya ba byed pa gegs med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtag tu bya ba byed pa gegs med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement, “It is always the activity of the agent without obstruction” means

original: 'dir mdo las rnam par shes pa bya'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mdo las rnam par shes pa bya'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: that the sutra intends to say, “consciousness is the agent.”

original: 'bras bu 'phangs pa de'i dngos po ni da ltar ba dang / de'i 'bras bu 'phen pa ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phangs pa de'i dngos po ni da ltar ba dang / de'i 'bras bu 'phen pa ni bya ba'o //
translated: The state of projecting its effect is the present, and the projection of its effect is its activity.

original: da ni snga ma dang phyi ma khyad par med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa yang 'das pa der 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ni snga ma dang phyi ma khyad par med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa yang 'das pa der 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Now, the future would become the past because there is no difference between the prior and subsequent.

original: gnas brtan rnams kyis ni dngos po shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas brtan rnams kyis ni dngos po shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The elders do not understand the nature of things.

original: da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di ci /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di ci /
translated: What is the difference between the present and the future?

original: khyad par bcas pa de rnam par dbye ba'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: khyad par bcas pa de rnam par dbye ba'i rang bzhin /
translated: The difference is the nature of the transformation of the thing.

original: pa ri ty'a gen bh'a ba tya th'a pa ri ty'a ga na pa ri ty'a ge na /
analyzed: pa ri ty'a gen bh'a ba tya th'a pa ri ty'a ga na pa ri ty'a ge na /
translated: When the thing is transformed, it is transformed, and it is not transformed.

original: de ltar yod na gzhan nyid ma 'ongs pa las skyes pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yod na gzhan nyid ma 'ongs pa las skyes pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, it would be born from the future, which is not yet born.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes pa kho nar 'jig pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin med pa'i dngos pos med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes pa kho nar 'jig pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin med pa'i dngos pos med pa ma yin no //
translated: The future is not born, and it is not destroyed, because it does not exist as a real entity, which is without intrinsic nature.

original: ji ltar yongs su btang ba de bzhin dngos po'i rang bzhin (dngos po yongs su gtong bas ci ste yongs su mi gtong min gal te yongs su gtong/) las khyad par gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su btang ba de bzhin dngos po'i rang bzhin (dngos po yongs su gtong bas ci ste yongs su mi gtong min gal te yongs su gtong/) las khyad par gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as it is given up, so the nature of the thing is transformed.

original: dus gsum du yang gang zhig 'khrul pa de'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin ni ma skyes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang dngos po gzhan yin pa'i dngos po gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang gang zhig 'khrul pa de'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin ni ma skyes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang dngos po gzhan yin pa'i dngos po gzhan bzhin no //
translated: Because the nature of that error is the nature of non-arising, like another thing that is another thing.

original: res 'ga' 'di dman pa de'i phyir dus gsum gyi dngos po //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'di dman pa de'i phyir dus gsum gyi dngos po //
translated: Sometimes it is inferior, therefore things of the three times are🔽inferior.

original: de bzhin du 'das pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'das pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the past.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid kyis dngos po thams cad yod pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid kyis dngos po thams cad yod pa smra ba'o //
translated: Because of being sometimes, all things are said to exist.

original: gal te khyad par yod pa las skyes pa de nyid khyad par zhes bya ba de lta na dngos po thams cad gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te khyad par yod pa las skyes pa de nyid khyad par zhes bya ba de lta na dngos po thams cad gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that which arises from the existence of a distinction is called a distinction, then all things would be the same,

original: khyad par yod pa las yang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par yod pa las yang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a distinction exists from the existence of a distinction.

original: bya ba 'das pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bya ba 'das pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The past of action, etc.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te bya ba la bya ba gzhan med par ma 'ongs pa la @139b sogs pa nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te bya ba la bya ba gzhan med par ma 'ongs pa la @139b sogs pa nyid du 'dod na /
translated: If the future, etc. are asserted to be without another action in the action,🔽then the past of action, etc. would not exist.

original: de lta na bya bas dus rnam par gzhag pa zhes brjod par mi bya ste 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na bya bas dus rnam par gzhag pa zhes brjod par mi bya ste 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, time should not be described as the arrangement of activity, because that is erroneous.

original: ji ltar bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rgyud la bltos nas rnam par 'jog pas dngos po rnams kyang de ltar ma 'ongs pa la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rgyud la bltos nas rnam par 'jog pas dngos po rnams kyang de ltar ma 'ongs pa la sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as activity is posited in dependence on the continuum of its own essential nature in the future and so on, so too would things become future and so on.

original: bya ba btags pas ci zhes bya ba ji ste 'khrul pa'i skyon du 'gyur du 'ong bas bya ba la yang bya ba gzhan 'dod na ni /
analyzed: bya ba btags pas ci zhes bya ba ji ste 'khrul pa'i skyon du 'gyur du 'ong bas bya ba la yang bya ba gzhan 'dod na ni /
translated: If you accept that activity is posited in dependence on another activity,

original: de lta na yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it is said that the past, future, and present

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re de yang bya ba gzhan gyis 'gyur ba yin na de yang gzhan gyis so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re de yang bya ba gzhan gyis 'gyur ba yin na de yang gzhan gyis so zhes zer ro //
translated: The master Samghabhadra says: If that is due to another activity, then that is due to another.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bya ba khyed cag gis brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bya ba khyed cag gis brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: You do not describe the activity of the past and future.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do you describe?

original: byung ba'i khyad par ma 'ongs pa'i chos ni da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byung ba'i khyad par ma 'ongs pa'i chos ni da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The specific state of the future dharma is called “present.”

original: khyad par grub zin pa ni 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par grub zin pa ni 'das pa yin no //
translated: The state of the dharma that has already arisen is called “past.”

original: ma skyes pa skyes pa grub zin pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba khas blangs pa'i phyir khyad par ni ci ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i bya ba ma bshad do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa skyes pa grub zin pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba khas blangs pa'i phyir khyad par ni ci ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i bya ba ma bshad do //
translated: Since the state of the future dharma that has not yet arisen is accepted as the state of the dharma that has already arisen, how can the specific state be explained as the activity of the past, future, and present?

original: de'i phyir phyogs su lhung ba'i mun pa zhes legs par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs su lhung ba'i mun pa zhes legs par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is rightly said that this is a darkness of biased views.

original: 'on te de ni 'das pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on te de ni 'das pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Or, if you say that it is neither past nor future, etc.

original: gang gi tshe bya ba mi byed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bya ba mi byed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: When it does not perform activity,

original: thams cad kyi tshe 'di bya ba mi byed pas de 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe 'di bya ba mi byed pas de 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: since it does not perform activity at all times, it follows that it exists at all times, because it is uncompounded.

original: skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni bya ba la yang bya ba yod par thal ba dang 'dus ma byas nyid do //
analyzed: skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni bya ba la yang bya ba yod par thal ba dang 'dus ma byas nyid do //
translated: This error would occur if activity also had activity, and if it were uncompounded.

original: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la /🔽chos las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir na ni bya ba chos bzhin du 'dus ma byas ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la / chos las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir na ni bya ba chos bzhin du 'dus ma byas ma yin la /
translated: If action were different from the entity,🔽then action would not be unconditioned like the entity, because it would not be nondifferent from the entity.

original: chos ltar de la bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin pas thug pa med pa yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: chos ltar de la bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin pas thug pa med pa yang ma yin no ;
translated: And since action does not exist separately from the entity, there is no infinite regress.

original: / de lta na ni 'o na dus su mi rung ba nyid du 'gyur te de nyid ni de nyid kyis dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyur mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de lta na ni 'o na dus su mi rung ba nyid du 'gyur te de nyid ni de nyid kyis dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyur mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then it would be impossible to establish time, because that entity itself cannot be the cause for establishing time.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te chos kho na bya ba yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te chos kho na bya ba yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, If action were the entity itself, etc.

original: mi 'grub pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi 'grub pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: What is not established?

original: dngos po'i @140a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i @140a * //
translated: The intrinsic reality

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: of an entity is not accepted as the cause for establishing time.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa zhig pa'i gnas skabs dag dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du khas len no //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa zhig pa'i gnas skabs dag dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du khas len no //
translated: The time of the arising, the non-arising, and the cessation of the effect are accepted as the cause for positing the three times.🔽

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /🔽ji ltar khyad par gyi rgyus 'phangs pa khyad par gyi 'bras bu bskyed pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa chos gzhan nyid kyi khyad par du 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re / ji ltar khyad par gyi rgyus 'phangs pa khyad par gyi 'bras bu bskyed pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa chos gzhan nyid kyi khyad par du 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: The master Pārśva says:

original: 'dir yang chos gzhan nyid bya ba'i khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang chos gzhan nyid bya ba'i khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Just as a specific cause is accepted as the reason for the production of a specific effect, in the same way, here too, another phenomenon is the reason for the specific activity.

original: 'di yang rang gi phyogs la dga' ba nyid kyis lhag par sgro btags te bshad kyi /
analyzed: 'di yang rang gi phyogs la dga' ba nyid kyis lhag par sgro btags te bshad kyi /
translated: This is a mere superimposition out of fondness for one’s own position.

original: nus pa'i khyad par gyi chos 'ga' zhig gzhan du bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par gyi chos 'ga' zhig gzhan du bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a proof of another phenomenon that has a specific capacity.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu bskyed pa btags par yod pa 'di yang kho bo cag gi sa mdzod kyi gnas gnyis pa nyid du bstan zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu bskyed pa btags par yod pa 'di yang kho bo cag gi sa mdzod kyi gnas gnyis pa nyid du bstan zin to //
translated: Therefore, this so-called production of an effect is taught in our Treasury of Abhidharma as the second topic.

original: yang de nyid la smras pa /
analyzed: yang de nyid la smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: bya ba chos las gzhan de las tha dad pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: bya ba chos las gzhan de las tha dad pa ma yin pa /
translated: That activity is not different from the phenomenon.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir chos tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir chos tsam ma yin no //
translated: Because it has no intrinsic reality, it is not mere dharma.

original: rang bzhin yod pa nyid la yang res 'ga' med pa'i phyir bya ba'i khyad par snga na med pa'i rgyud bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa nyid la yang res 'ga' med pa'i phyir bya ba'i khyad par snga na med pa'i rgyud bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Even if it had intrinsic reality, it would not be like the prior nonexistence of a specific action, because it sometimes does not exist.

original: dper na bar med par skye ba'i chos la rgyud ces brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bar med par skye ba'i chos la rgyud ces brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the expression “series” for a dharma that arises without interruption.

original: 'di ni de'i las de las tha dad pa ma yin te de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i las de las tha dad pa ma yin te de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not different from that action, because it has the same intrinsic reality.

original: chos tsam gyi skad cig ma gcig kyang rgyud du thal ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang de'i bya ba yod pa'i phyir med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos tsam gyi skad cig ma gcig kyang rgyud du thal ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang de'i bya ba yod pa'i phyir med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent, because a single moment of mere dharma is not a series, and because its action exists.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: rgyud kyi las dang tha snyad 'ga' zhig de ltar rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa rtogs pa ma yin pas rigs pa'i byed pas dus rnams grub po zhe na /
analyzed: rgyud kyi las dang tha snyad 'ga' zhig de ltar rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa rtogs pa ma yin pas rigs pa'i byed pas dus rnams grub po zhe na /
translated: Since a series is not understood to exist substantially in some way, the times are established by the activity of reasoning.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis 'das pa gzhan nyid kyi bdag nyid dang ma 'ongs pa gzhan dang da ltar byung ba gzhan nyid dus rnam par gzhag pas gang 'di cung zad rgyud las ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa rnams de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis 'das pa gzhan nyid kyi bdag nyid dang ma 'ongs pa gzhan dang da ltar byung ba gzhan nyid dus rnam par gzhag pas gang 'di cung zad rgyud las ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa rnams de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod
translated: Therefore, we posit the past as having the nature of another, the future as having the nature of another, and the present as having the nature of another.

original: par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin med de gang zag bzhin no //
analyzed: par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin med de gang zag bzhin no //
translated: Since these are not described as either the same or different, they are essenceless, like the person.

original: rang bzhin yod pa de nyid dang gzhan nyid du mthong ba ste 'byung bar 'gyur ba rang bzhin med pa'i lus su 'dod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa de nyid dang gzhan nyid du mthong ba ste 'byung bar 'gyur ba rang bzhin med pa'i lus su 'dod do //
translated: The body that is seen to have an essence as either the same or different is asserted to be essenceless.

original: bya ba yang btags par yod pa'i phyir sngon bzhin du phyis kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bya ba yang btags par yod pa'i phyir sngon bzhin du phyis kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Since action is also imputedly existent, it is the same before and after.

original: @140b gang med pa de ci ltar khyad par du 'gyur /
analyzed: @140b gang med pa de ci ltar khyad par du 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not exist become a specific thing?

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams bdag nyid tha dad par yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams bdag nyid tha dad par yod do //
translated: Therefore, the past, future, and present exist as different entities.

original: bdag nyid tha dad par med na dus rnams su rnam par gzhag pa mi grub po //
analyzed: bdag nyid tha dad par med na dus rnams su rnam par gzhag pa mi grub po //
translated: If there is no difference between them, the three times cannot be established.

original: gang gsungs pa yang sna tshogs sdug bsngal rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa yang sna tshogs sdug bsngal rnams kyis ni /
translated: And it is said:

original: sdug bsngal gzugs sogs ji lta bar //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzugs sogs ji lta bar //
translated: Just as suffering is in the form, etc.,

original: gang gi tha dad yod de bzhin //
analyzed: gang gi tha dad yod de bzhin //
translated: so too is the difference in the arising, etc.🔽of the form, etc.,

original: skyes sogs yod pa ma yin brjod //
analyzed: skyes sogs yod pa ma yin brjod //
translated: not real.

original: 'dir yang dpe dang dpe can mtshungs pa ma yin pas skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'jigs pa la bltos nas sdug bsngal nyid du rnam par gzhag go ;
analyzed: 'dir yang dpe dang dpe can mtshungs pa ma yin pas skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'jigs pa la bltos nas sdug bsngal nyid du rnam par gzhag go ;
translated: Here, the example and the exemplified are not similar, because the nature of the arising is established as suffering in dependence on the cessation.

original: / skye ba la sogs pa rnams la de'i khyad par yod pa ma yin yang de ming gtags pa la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: / skye ba la sogs pa rnams la de'i khyad par yod pa ma yin yang de ming gtags pa la 'gal ba med de /
translated: Although the difference of that does not exist in the arising, etc., there is no contradiction in designating it as such.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa la da ltar byung ba bzhin 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid mi grub po //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa la da ltar byung ba bzhin 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid mi grub po //
translated: But if the past and future exist substantially, then, like the present, the past and future cannot be established.

original: khyad par khas blangs pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa nyid da ltar byung ba dang da ltar byung ba yang 'das pa yin no zhes mi rung ste /
analyzed: khyad par khas blangs pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa nyid da ltar byung ba dang da ltar byung ba yang 'das pa yin no zhes mi rung ste /
translated: In particular, it is not possible to say that the future itself is the present, or that the present is the past, because of the very fact that they are accepted as being different.

original: de ltar 'di ni rgyas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: This has been extensively explained.

original: tshig gi tshul 'di ni sngon ma byung ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig gi tshul 'di ni sngon ma byung ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: This method of expression is unprecedented.

original: snga ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: snga ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Because it is contrary to the former,

original: sngon ma thos pa sngon med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon ma thos pa sngon med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: or because it is unheard of, it is unprecedented.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni dus thams cad na yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni dus thams cad na yod par 'dod do //
translated: The specific characteristics of form, etc., are accepted as existing at all times.

original: de lta na 'o na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that all things, such as form, etc., are permanent because they exist at all times.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dngos po yang mi rtag mi 'dod /
analyzed: dngos po yang mi rtag mi 'dod /
translated: We do not assert that things are impermanent.

original: de lta na yang rang bzhin las dngos po gzhan du thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang bzhin las dngos po gzhan du thal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that things are different from their intrinsic nature.🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / rang bzhin las kyang dngos mi gzhan //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang bzhin las kyang dngos mi gzhan //
translated: Things are not different from their intrinsic nature.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what he says.

original: dbang phyug tha snyad yin par gsal //
analyzed: dbang phyug tha snyad yin par gsal //
translated: It is clear that God is a convention.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what he says.

original: 'jig rten na rigs pa la mi bltos par 'dod rgyal tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rigs pa la mi bltos par 'dod rgyal tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the world, it is mere whim, not dependent on reason.

original: sngon byung ba gang yin pa ni 'das pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon byung ba gang yin pa ni 'das pa ma yin gyi /
translated: What has occurred previously is not past.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: It is not that it exists by its own intrinsic identity.

original: rkyen yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
translated: What will occur if conditions are present is future.

original: yod pa ma yin yang snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin yang snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is not that it exists.

original: de ltar byas nas yod do zhes bya'i @141a * //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas yod do zhes bya'i @141a * //
translated: Having done this, it is said to exist.🔽This is what he says.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The past has occurred and the future will occur.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: mdo sde pas da ltar byung ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yod pa nyid du smra bar blta ste /
analyzed: mdo sde pas da ltar byung ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yod pa nyid du smra bar blta ste /
translated: The Sautrantikas should be seen as proponents of the existence of the present,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ma yin zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ma yin zhes bya bas so //
translated: because they say it is not past or future.

original: 'dir da ltar byung ba'i snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir da ltar byung ba'i snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Here, the past and future are posited as prior nonexistence and subsequent nonexistence of the present.

original: de dag kyang da ltar byung ba la ma bltos par bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang da ltar byung ba la ma bltos par bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are taught as not existing without depending on the present.

original: da ltar byung ba la btags par yod pa nyid snga na med pa dang zhig nas med par shes par bya ba'i phyir 'das pa yod do ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la btags par yod pa nyid snga na med pa dang zhig nas med par shes par bya ba'i phyir 'das pa yod do ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes bshad do //
translated: The past exists and the future exists are stated in order to understand prior nonexistence and subsequent nonexistence that are imputed to exist in the present.

original: gal te de ma 'ongs pa'am 'das par ma gyur na rtag tu da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur bas de bye brag tu rtogs pa'i phyir yang brjod do //
analyzed: gal te de ma 'ongs pa'am 'das par ma gyur na rtag tu da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur bas de bye brag tu rtogs pa'i phyir yang brjod do //
translated: If they did not become future or past, they would always be present and thus they are stated in order to specifically understand them.

original: sngon byung ba gang yin pa ni 'das pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: sngon byung ba gang yin pa ni 'das pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Whatever occurred previously is the past.

original: yod pa de dang de sngon byung bar gyur pa dang phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba de yis te /
analyzed: yod pa de dang de sngon byung bar gyur pa dang phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba de yis te /
translated: That which exists as that and that occurred previously and will occur later exists.

original: de lta na ma yin na rtag par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de lta na ma yin na rtag par 'gyur bas so //
translated: If it were not so, it would be permanent.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid du yod mod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid du yod mod ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is said that the self exists in the past and future,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: in the sense of its intrinsic reality existing in the past and future.

original: yang de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dgag pa'i phyir de ltar yod par gsungs te /
analyzed: yang de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dgag pa'i phyir de ltar yod par gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the Lord said that the self exists in this way in order to refute the view that denies cause and effect.

original: 'das pa ni rgyu dang ma 'ongs pa ni 'bras bu ste /🔽de med par lta ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa ni rgyu dang ma 'ongs pa ni 'bras bu ste / de med par lta ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The past is the cause and the future is the effect.🔽The view that they do not exist is the denial of cause and effect.

original: med pa nyid de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la'o //
translated: The denial of cause and effect is the view that they do not exist.

original: gal te yang med pa nyid med pa'i sgo nas lta bar byed pa de la skur pa 'debs pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'das pa yod do ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang med pa nyid med pa'i sgo nas lta bar byed pa de la skur pa 'debs pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'das pa yod do ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ci zhe na /
translated: If the view that they do not exist is the denial of cause and effect, why did the Lord say, “The past exists, the future exists,” in order to refute the denial of the past and future?

original: gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ma nges pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pas de dag pa'i phyir 'das pa yod pa ni rgyu'i ngo bo sa des 'phangs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par las 'bras bu skyed
analyzed: gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ma nges pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pas de dag pa'i phyir 'das pa yod pa ni rgyu'i ngo bo sa des 'phangs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par las 'bras bu skyed
translated: Because the cause and effect of the past and future are uncertain, they are🔽nihilists with regard to cause and effect.🔽The past exists because the effect arises from the special power projected by the cause.

original: pa'o // ma 'ongs pa yod pa ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo des 'phangs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par las byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: pa'o // ma 'ongs pa yod pa ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo des 'phangs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par las byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The future exists because the effect arises from the special power projected by the effect.

original: de dag bshad do //
analyzed: de dag bshad do //
translated: These are explained as follows.🔽If the past and future existed substantially, they would not be past and future, respectively, as they were and will be. Therefore the Bhagavān would not

original: gal te yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas kyi sgo nas @141b yod pa de lta na de ltar byung ba bzhin 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa yod do ma 'ongs pa yod zhes bya
analyzed: gal te yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas kyi sgo nas @141b yod pa de lta na de ltar byung ba bzhin 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa yod do ma 'ongs pa yod zhes bya
translated: have made the statement, “The past exists; the future exists.”🔽He said,🔽“The past is the exhaustion of the appropriated aggregates. The future is the

original: ba'i gsung skabs 'byed par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: ba'i gsung skabs 'byed par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gang gsungs pa /
translated: nonarising of the appropriated aggregates.”

original: rgyus 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa nus pa la gus pas rnam par dpyad par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rgyus 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa nus pa la gus pas rnam par dpyad par mi dmigs so //
translated: The result projected by the cause is not observed to be capable of producing the result.

original: de la 'di ni yang dag par rnam par dpyad pa la gus pas de'i phyir gnas brtan rnams kyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di ni yang dag par rnam par dpyad pa la gus pas de'i phyir gnas brtan rnams kyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not capable of producing the result, the elder ones do not understand it through respect for correct analysis.

original: nus pa med par dngos po so sor nges pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nus pa med par dngos po so sor nges pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Without capability, the definite particular of things is not tenable as the connection between cause and effect.

original: de yang nus pa med na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin thams cad la thams cad nus par thal bar de'i phyir rgyu nyid las 'bras bu bzhin du de'i khyad par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang nus pa med na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin thams cad la thams cad nus par thal bar de'i phyir rgyu nyid las 'bras bu bzhin du de'i khyad par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, if it is not capable, it follows that all natures of things are capable of everything. Therefore, like the effect from the cause, its particularity should be accepted.

original: de'i phyir yid ces bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid ces bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the term “mind” is a verbal prefix, he says.

original: tshig phrad smos pa ni brjod pa'i ngo bo dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig phrad smos pa ni brjod pa'i ngo bo dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of the verbal prefix is for the purpose of negating the nature of expression.

original: dus gsum gyi yul can nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi yul can nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the purpose of being understood as having the three times as its object.

original: gal te 'di brjod pa yin na ni 'dir 'di'i 'das pa yod do //
analyzed: gal te 'di brjod pa yin na ni 'dir 'di'i 'das pa yod do //
translated: If it is said that it is expressed, then its past exists here.

original: ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba nyid du mi 'gyur te da ltar gyi dus yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba nyid du mi 'gyur te da ltar gyi dus yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is said that this is the meaning, then the expression “it exists in the past” and “it exists in the future” would not be used, because it would be in the present.🔽The example of the lamp

original: mar me snga na med pa yod do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mar me snga na med pa yod do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The example of the lamp is not established.

original: mar me snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mar me snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dang rdzas su yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: The lamp that is not burning does not exist, nor does the lamp that is burning not exist.

original: 'on kyang yod par smra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yod par smra'o //
translated: But it is said that the lamp exists.

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not the same.

original: ma skyes pa dang zhig pa'i mar me ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med par smra'o //🔽de lta yin na mar me nyid mar me'i snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang zhig pa'i mar me ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med par smra'o // de lta yin na mar me nyid mar me'i snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa ste /
translated: The lamp that is not yet arisen and the lamp that has ceased are said to be the lamp that does not exist prior to burning and the lamp that does not exist after burning.

original: da ltar ba las yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba las yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, the lamp itself would be the lamp that does not exist prior to burning and the lamp that does not exist after burning, and it would follow that the lamp would be in the present.

original: da ltar ba'i gnas skabs na ma skyes pa dang 'das pa'i gnas skabs snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i gnas skabs na ma skyes pa dang 'das pa'i gnas skabs snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'o //
translated: The lamp that is not yet arisen in the present and the lamp that has ceased in the past do not exist prior to burning and after burning.

original: 'di la skyon med de /
analyzed: 'di la skyon med de /
translated: There is no error here.

original: gcig gi snga ma'i gnas skabs nyams nas gnas skabs gzhan sgrub pa mi rigs pas snga ma kho na /🔽ni rlo thi tam /
analyzed: gcig gi snga ma'i gnas skabs nyams nas gnas skabs gzhan sgrub pa mi rigs pas snga ma kho na / ni rlo thi tam /
translated: It is not logical that the former state of a thing would be impaired and another state would be established.

original: de'i phyir snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yang yin no zhes smra ba 'dis mi g-yo'o //🔽ji ltar 'gags pa yod ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'gags pa'i mar me yod do zhes bya ba bye brag tu @142a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yang yin no zhes smra ba 'dis mi g-yo'o // ji ltar 'gags pa yod ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'gags pa'i mar me yod do zhes bya ba bye brag tu @142a * //
translated: Therefore, this assertion that the nature of a thing that did not exist previously and that no longer exists is not refuted.🔽How could there be cessation, etc.?

original: smra ba'i ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: smra ba'i ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the statement, The lamp that has ceased exists, is not a thesis of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: de la 'dir 'di'i don ni mar me 'gags pa yod do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de la 'dir 'di'i don ni mar me 'gags pa yod do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: But here the meaning of this is understood as follows: The lamp that has ceased exists.

original: 'o na ci bden par 'gog ce na de'i phyir yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don med pa can 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: 'o na ci bden par 'gog ce na de'i phyir yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don med pa can 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: But if it is said that cessation is refuted as true, then the word exists is understood to mean that it is not meaningless.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la gal te byung ba ni 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la gal te byung ba ni 'das pa yin la /
translated: If that were not so, then arising would be past.

original: rkyen yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma 'ongs pa yin zhes bya ba de ltar yod pa'i sgra brjod par mi 'dod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: rkyen yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma 'ongs pa yin zhes bya ba de ltar yod pa'i sgra brjod par mi 'dod par gyur na'o //
translated: If you do not want to say that the future exists in that way,

original: byung bar gyur pa 'das pa de yod la gang rgyu yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma 'ongs pa de yang yod do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa 'das pa de yod la gang rgyu yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma 'ongs pa de yang yod do zhes bya'o //
translated: then you must say that the past exists, since it has already occurred, and the future exists, since it will occur when its conditions are present.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the past and future are established.

original: da ltar ba bzhin du thams cad kyi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba bzhin du thams cad kyi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they exist by intrinsic identity at all times, just as the present does.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Well then, the Lord Buddha has said, etc.

original: 'di ltar mdo las sh'a ri'i bu gang dag gis las spangs pa dang zad pa dang / 'gags pa dang / bral ba dang rnam par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni med do zhes de skad du smras pa'i tshig de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni byis pa blun pa mi gsal ba mi dge ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du kun tu rgyu dbyug thogs thor
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las sh'a ri'i bu gang dag gis las spangs pa dang zad pa dang / 'gags pa dang / bral ba dang rnam par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni med do zhes de skad du smras pa'i tshig de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni byis pa blun pa mi gsal ba mi dge ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du kun tu rgyu dbyug thogs thor
translated: So too, a sutra declares:🔽 Sariputra, those who say, “That karma which is abandoned, exhausted, stopped, and transformed does not exist” are not speaking correctly.🔽Those words are like the nonsense of fools, the babbling of idiots, the prattle of those who are unclear, those who are not virtuous.

original: tshugs can rnams kyis bab chol du so sor ma brtags par smras pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: tshugs can rnams kyis bab chol du so sor ma brtags par smras pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: Sariputra, that karma which is past, exhausted, stopped, transformed, does exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sh'a ri'i bu las 'das pa dang zad pa dang 'gags pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yod do zhes gsungs na /🔽ci de dag las de sngon byung ba nyid du mi 'dod par gyur tam /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / sh'a ri'i bu las 'das pa dang zad pa dang 'gags pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yod do zhes gsungs na / ci de dag las de sngon byung ba nyid du mi 'dod par gyur tam /
translated: Why is that?🔽Do they not assert that karma arises earlier?

original: de dag gis ni las sngon byung ba nyid du rtogs pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gis ni las sngon byung ba nyid du rtogs pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: They understand that karma arises earlier.

original: de'i rnam par smin pas 'jigs pas 'gags pa ni rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pas 'jigs pas 'gags pa ni rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma rtogs so //
translated: Because of the fear of its maturation, it is not understood to exist substantially.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ni yod do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ni yod do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān said, “It exists,” in order to teach that it exists.

original: de lta ma yin na bstan pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni re zhig bye brag tu smra ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bstan pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni re zhig bye brag tu smra ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, the teaching would be meaningless. This is the explanation of the meaning of the Vaibhāṣika sūtra.

original: slob dpon gyis rnam pa gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir de las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //🔽de las ni zhes @142b bya ba ni las de rgyud gang du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rnam pa gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir de las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // de las ni zhes @142b bya ba ni las de rgyud gang du gtogs pa'o //
translated: The master Vasubandhu explains it differently, saying, “It is not that.”🔽“It” refers to the continuum in which that karma is included.

original: des kun tu drangs pa ni las nges kun tu drangs shing bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: des kun tu drangs pa ni las nges kun tu drangs shing bskyed pa'o //
translated: “Drawn by that” means drawn by and produced by that karma.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'i mthu yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'i mthu yod pa'o //
translated: It is the power to produce an effect.

original: 'di ltar las des rgyud 'bras bu khyad par can bskyed par nus par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar las des rgyud 'bras bu khyad par can bskyed par nus par byed de /
translated: In this way, that karma makes the continuum capable of producing a special effect.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis las de 'gags kyang des kun tu drangs pa 'bras bu skyed pa'i mthu yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ni yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis las de 'gags kyang des kun tu drangs pa 'bras bu skyed pa'i mthu yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ni yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavån taught that even though the action has ceased, it has the power to generate its effect, since it is drawn along by it.🔽If it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gal te 'das pa yod pa nyid du ston na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gal te 'das pa yod pa nyid du ston na'o //
translated: if it were taught that the past exists,

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nar yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nar yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: if it existed just by its own nature,

original: las de rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod na ni de ltar byung ba ji lta ba bzhin yin pas 'das pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las de rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod na ni de ltar byung ba ji lta ba bzhin yin pas 'das pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since it would be just as it was when it occurred, the past would not be established.

original: de'i phyir 'di las don du bzhed kyi snga ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di las don du bzhed kyi snga ma ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of the passage, not the former one.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par zhes bya ba la /
translated: It must be just like that.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi mgur nyid nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med do zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir mdo 'di'i don ni 'di kho na yin gyi bye brag tu smra bas yongs su btags pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi mgur nyid nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med do zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir mdo 'di'i don ni 'di kho na yin gyi bye brag tu smra bas yongs su btags pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Because the Bhagavån himself declared in the Sūtra on the Ten Stages that the past and future do not exist, we know that this is the meaning of the sūtra and not the interpretation of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: gal te da ltar gyi dus su zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te da ltar gyi dus su zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that it is not tenable that the present exists in the present,🔽we reply that it is not tenable that the present exists in the past or future.

original: da ltar gyi dus su da ltar gyi dngos por ma byung ba las byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus su da ltar gyi dngos por ma byung ba las byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If you say that it is not tenable that the present exists in the present,

original: mi rung ste dus ni dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rung ste dus ni dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: we reply that it is not tenable that time is a different object from things.

original: gang de ltar byung ba'i dus 'di mig la sogs pa rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par yod ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar byung ba'i dus 'di mig la sogs pa rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par yod ces bya'o //
translated: If you say that the present time that has arisen in this way does not exist as a different object from such things as the eye,

original: ji ltar de'i bdag nyid du ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i bdag nyid du ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: we reply that it is not tenable that it arises from that which has not arisen in the present.

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply that it is not tenable that it is not different from that.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // zhes bshad do //
translated: They are the same in terms of time and basis.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The future eye does not exist.

original: gal te rang gi bdag nyid la ma byung ba las byung na ni de ltar na mig ma byung ba las byung ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rang gi bdag nyid la ma byung ba las byung na ni de ltar na mig ma byung ba las byung ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it were to arise from that which does not exist in its own intrinsic reality, then in that case, the eye would arise from that which does not exist.

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the future eye does not exist.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṅghabhadra says:

original: gang zag la sogs pa bzhin 'ga' zhig tu ma bkag pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid kyi lung 'di ni nges pa'i don to zhe na /🔽nges pa'i don ni rnam pa gzhan du brtag @143a * //
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa bzhin 'ga' zhig tu ma bkag pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid kyi lung 'di ni nges pa'i don to zhe na / nges pa'i don ni rnam pa gzhan du brtag @143a * //
translated: Since it is not refuted in some places, like the person, this scripture that the past and future exist is of definitive meaning.

original: par mi rigs la /
analyzed: par mi rigs la /
translated: Definitive meaning cannot be interpreted in another way.

original: gang zag yod pa zhes bya ba de dang der gsungs pa ni ma nu shya ka mi can gyis mdo la sogs pa rnams su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir de yod pa nyid rjod par byed pa'i lung rnams ni drang ba'i don nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: gang zag yod pa zhes bya ba de dang der gsungs pa ni ma nu shya ka mi can gyis mdo la sogs pa rnams su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir de yod pa nyid rjod par byed pa'i lung rnams ni drang ba'i don nyid du rigs so //
translated: The statement that the person exists in this and that scripture is not a statement that it exists, because the existence of the person is refuted in the sūtras and so on. Therefore it is reasonable that scriptures that express its existence are of provisional meaning.

original: de bzhin du pha dang ma ni gsad bya zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha dang ma ni gsad bya zhing //
translated: Likewise, the statement, “Father and mother are to be killed,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang drang ba'i don nyid rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang drang ba'i don nyid rigs te /
translated: and so on, is also interpretable in meaning, because

original: gzhan du mtshams med pa'i byed pa rnams de ma thag tu dmyal bar skye bar gsungs pa'i phyir de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du mtshams med pa'i byed pa rnams de ma thag tu dmyal bar skye bar gsungs pa'i phyir de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: it is said elsewhere that the perpetrators of heinous acts are immediately reborn in hell.

original: rang gis gsal bar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid smras pa dang / kha cig gis de bzhin kho nar gsal bar bkag pa dmigs pas /
analyzed: rang gis gsal bar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid smras pa dang / kha cig gis de bzhin kho nar gsal bar bkag pa dmigs pas /
translated: Some have clearly stated that the past and future exist inherently, and others have clearly refuted that, as we have seen.

original: gang zhig 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i lung 'di ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i lung 'di ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this scripture that proves the existence of the past and future is interpretable in meaning.

original: 'dir smras pa ci rnam pa gzhan du na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po nyid mi grub ste /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ci rnam pa gzhan du na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po nyid mi grub ste /
translated: Here, someone might say, “If it is not in another way, the existence of the past and future is not established.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed kyi dngos po skye ba med do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed kyi dngos po skye ba med do //
translated: The past and future do not exist as things that arise.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i dngos po de med pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa dang lam dag kyang de bzhin te bden pa bzhi med pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang mngon du bya ba dang bsgom pa dag kyang mi rung la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i dngos po de med pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa dang lam dag kyang de bzhin te bden pa bzhi med pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang mngon du bya ba dang bsgom pa dag kyang mi rung la /
translated: Because the things of the truths of suffering and origination do not exist, and because cessation and the path are also like that, the four noble truths do not exist. Therefore, complete understanding, abandonment, realization, and cultivation are not tenable.

original: de med pa'i phyir 'bras bu la gnas pa dang zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams kyang med do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir 'bras bu la gnas pa dang zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams kyang med do //
translated: Because those do not exist, persons who abide in or enter the fruits do not exist.

original: de ltar sgra ji bzhin pa'i don yongs su brtags pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i lung rnams mtha' dag gsung rab dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar sgra ji bzhin pa'i don yongs su brtags pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i lung rnams mtha' dag gsung rab dang 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, when the meaning of the scriptures is investigated literally, all scriptures that prove the existence of past and future lives contradict the scriptures.

original: de'i phyir lung 'di ni drang ba'i don te nges pa'i don ma yin zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lung 'di ni drang ba'i don te nges pa'i don ma yin zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that these scriptures are provisional and not definitive.

original: gzhan yang don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mdo las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de nyid rdzas kyi sgo nas bkag go //
analyzed: gzhan yang don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mdo las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de nyid rdzas kyi sgo nas bkag go //
translated: Moreover, the Sūtra on Ultimate Emptiness refutes the substantial existence of past and future lives.

original: mig ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas 'jig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas 'jig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eye arises from that which is not yet arisen, and having arisen, it is destroyed.

original: de'i phyir gang gnas brtan rnams kyis sgrub byed smras pa de 'brel pa med pas gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas dgag pa rgyas par ma byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gnas brtan rnams kyis sgrub byed smras pa de 'brel pa med pas gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas dgag pa rgyas par ma byas so //
translated: Therefore, since the argument of the elders is incoherent, we have not refuted it extensively out of fear of verbosity.

original: 'ga' zhig 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'di skad du /
translated: Some say:

original: mig me'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las 'byung zhing yang de nyid du thim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig me'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las 'byung zhing yang de nyid du thim par 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye arises from the orb of the sun because it has the nature of fire and it dissolves into the orb of the sun.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang rig par bya ste /🔽@143b ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi mig ni da ltar byung ba'i dus su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang rig par bya ste / @143b ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi mig ni da ltar byung ba'i dus su 'gyur zhing /
translated: This should be understood in the same way for other things.🔽The eye of the future becomes the eye of the present.

original: da ltar byung ba las 'das par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba las 'das par 'gyur te /
translated: The eye of the present becomes the eye of the past.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po gzhan rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan la yang zhugs pa'i rang bzhin las mig 'byung zhing yang de nyid du thim mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po gzhan rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan la yang zhugs pa'i rang bzhin las mig 'byung zhing yang de nyid du thim mo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is the case that one thing is understood as another, the eye arises from a nature that is engaged with another and dissolves into that.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir mig ni skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir mig ni skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
translated: To refute that, the eye does not come from anywhere when it is born.

original: 'gag pa na gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'gag pa na gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes smos so //
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: rang gi lugs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi lugs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To present our own position,🔽the sutra says:

original: de lta bas na dge slong dag mig ni ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang slar 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong dag mig ni ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang slar 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Monks, the eye arises from what did not exist before and having arisen, it is destroyed again.”

original: zin pa'i rang bzhin yongs su btang nas zhes bya ba de ltar mdo'i don rnam par gzhag go / slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: zin pa'i rang bzhin yongs su btang nas zhes bya ba de ltar mdo'i don rnam par gzhag go / slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is presented in this way: “Having relinquished its appropriated nature.”🔽Master Saṅghabhadra says:

original: gzhan du brjod pa ma byung ba las byung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du brjod pa ma byung ba las byung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Arising from what did not exist before” is stated in the sutra.

original: ma byung ba dang 'ga' zhig tu sogs pa ni rang gi rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma byung ba dang 'ga' zhig tu sogs pa ni rang gi rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “From what did not exist” means “from its own causes and conditions.”

original: 'ga' zhig ni lus kyi dkyil rgyur 'dod pas de'i phyir ma byung ba ni rgyu la brjod de /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni lus kyi dkyil rgyur 'dod pas de'i phyir ma byung ba ni rgyu la brjod de /
translated: Some assert that the center of the body is the cause, so “what did not exist” refers to the cause.

original: de'i rgyu can gzhan nyid las de skye'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can gzhan nyid las de skye'o zhes bya'o //
translated: That which has that as its cause is said to arise from another.

original: ma byung ba las byung ba ni /
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba ni /
translated: Arising from what did not exist before

original: gnas skabs snga ma thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas skabs snga ma thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it obtains the previous state.

original: byung nas kyang 'jig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du 'bras bu 'phangs pa bya ba med pa'i gnas skabs thob po zhes bya bar bsams pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: byung nas kyang 'jig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du 'bras bu 'phangs pa bya ba med pa'i gnas skabs thob po zhes bya bar bsams pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: And having arisen, it is destroyed means that, as before, it obtains the state of having projected its effect and being devoid of activity.

original: 'di dag kyang mdo'i don bstan pa mtha' dag gi don dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang rig pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir mi 'thad do //🔽gang bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang mdo'i don bstan pa mtha' dag gi don dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang rig pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir mi 'thad do // gang bshad pa /
translated: But these interpretations are not correct, because they contradict the entire meaning of the sutra and because they contradict reason.🔽If you say that the meaning of this sutra is understood from the statement,

original: byung ba las ma byung zhes ma bshad pa'i phyir 'di'i don rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: byung ba las ma byung zhes ma bshad pa'i phyir 'di'i don rtogs so zhe na /
translated: “From what has arisen, it does not arise,”

original: 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: 'dir dngos po rnams kyi ma byung ba ni rang bzhin sgrub pa dang zin pa'i rang bzhin yongs su btang bar 'chad par 'dod pas de nyid kyi phyir de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po rnams kyi ma byung ba ni rang bzhin sgrub pa dang zin pa'i rang bzhin yongs su btang bar 'chad par 'dod pas de nyid kyi phyir de ltar bshad do //
translated: Because we maintain that the nonarising of things is the nonestablishment of intrinsic reality and the relinquishing of intrinsic reality, we explain the meaning of this sutra in that way.

original: re zhig 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: re zhig 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Here, the meaning of “here” is explained in detail.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams ni yul da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir rten ltar dmigs pa yang skyed par byed pa nyid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nar nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams ni yul da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir rten ltar dmigs pa yang skyed par byed pa nyid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nar nye bar bkod do //
translated: The eye consciousness, etc., are the objective condition of the mental consciousness, because they are the object-field of the mental consciousness.

original: yid da ltar ba kho na de'i rkyen nyid du gnas pas skyed par byed pa'i rkyen yin pa ltar chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra'am zhe na /🔽de lta na 'das pa dang @144a * //
analyzed: yid da ltar ba kho na de'i rkyen nyid du gnas pas skyed par byed pa'i rkyen yin pa ltar chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra'am zhe na / de lta na 'das pa dang @144a * //
translated: But if the object-field of the mental consciousness is present, the mental consciousness is produced by the mental faculty, which is also present.

original: ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par 'grub po //🔽de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par 'grub po // de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir /
translated: If the past and future exist as real entities, then the past and future are established as real entities.🔽If the past and future exist as real entities, then consciousness that has them as objects must be produced by real entities.

original: rdzas nyid bskyed pa por 'dod do //
analyzed: rdzas nyid bskyed pa por 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the past and future are the productive causes of consciousness.

original: 'on te rdzas ma yin gyi dmigs pa tsam yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rdzas ma yin gyi dmigs pa tsam yin na /
translated: If the past and future do not exist as real entities, but are mere objects,

original: skyed par byed pa'i rkyen ma yin no ;
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rkyen ma yin no ;
translated: then they are not productive causes.

original: / de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyang dmigs pa'i dngos por mi 'gal lo //🔽bskal pa stong na 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa nye ba yang skyed par byed pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod na /
analyzed: / de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas kyi sgo nas yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyang dmigs pa'i dngos por mi 'gal lo // bskal pa stong na 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa nye ba yang skyed par byed pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod na /
translated: Thus, the past and future do not exist as real entities, but this does not contradict their being objects of cognition.

original: shin tu bskal pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam du dgongs te ;
analyzed: shin tu bskal pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam du dgongs te ;
translated: The phrase “arises after a thousand eons” means that if one does not accept that the present is the condition that generates the future, then how much less could this be true of something that is extremely remote?

original: 'bras bu snga la rgyu phyi'o snyam du rtog pa ni rig pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu snga la rgyu phyi'o snyam du rtog pa ni rig pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The idea that the effect precedes the cause is not reasonable.

original: gal te med pa ji ltar dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med pa ji ltar dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “How can something nonexistent be an object of cognition?”

original: skyed par byed pa ma 'ongs pa'i rdzas kyi sgo nas 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma 'ongs pa'i rdzas kyi sgo nas 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: The future is not accepted as a real entity that generates the present.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “What is it?”

original: dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa ma yin pa ni nye bar ma bshad pas dmigs pa'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa ma yin pa ni nye bar ma bshad pas dmigs pa'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is not explained as being nonexistent, it is not reasonable for it to be an object of cognition.

original: gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ma yin pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase “past and future form” means that past and future form do not exist.

original: da ni 'dir ji ltar dmigs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: da ni 'dir ji ltar dmigs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Now, the root text states, “Here, how is there an object of observation?”

original: kho bo cag gis de'i dmigs pa smras pa ji lta ba de ltar med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis de'i dmigs pa smras pa ji lta ba de ltar med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the object of observation that we describe does not exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: khyed cag rnams kyis rdzas kyi sgo nas btags pa ji lta ba de ltar med ces bya'o //
analyzed: khyed cag rnams kyis rdzas kyi sgo nas btags pa ji lta ba de ltar med ces bya'o //
translated: It is the case that the object of observation does not exist in the way that you describe it as substantially existent.

original: byung zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: byung zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: “Arisen” refers to the observation of the past.

original: de bzhin du de yod pa nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de yod pa nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, “it will exist” refers to the observation of the future.

original: de yang de bzhin du yod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du yod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it exists in that way,

original: ci ltar yang 'di shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar yang 'di shes par bya zhe na /
translated: how is it to be known?

original: byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la dmigs par byed do //
translated: It is known through the observation of what has arisen and what will arise.

original: yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'das pa'i gzugs sam tshor ba zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'das pa'i gzugs sam tshor ba zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, since it does not exist, the root text states, “Past form or feeling . . . ”

original: yang ji ltar da ltar gyi gzugs nyams su myong ba ni mig gis so //
analyzed: yang ji ltar da ltar gyi gzugs nyams su myong ba ni mig gis so //
translated: Moreover, how is present form experienced? It is experienced through the eye.

original: rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyis de ltar 'das pa dran no //
analyzed: rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyis de ltar 'das pa dran no //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body and consciousness remember the past in the same way.

original: de nyid du nye bar bsags pa las gzhan de ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba de nyid kyis bdag nyid 'das so zhes bya ba dang byung bar gyur to zhes 'dzin no //
analyzed: de nyid du nye bar bsags pa las gzhan de ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba de nyid kyis bdag nyid 'das so zhes bya ba dang byung bar gyur to zhes 'dzin no //
translated: It is the self that is remembered as having experienced the past, because it is the self that has accumulated the aggregates in the past.

original: nyams su myong ba dang mthun par dran par byed @144b do ;
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang mthun par dran par byed @144b do ;
translated: It is remembered in accordance with the experience.

original: / de lta bu ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / de lta bu ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Buddhas know it as it is,

original: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar mkhyen to //
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar mkhyen to //
translated: because they have unobstructed knowledge of everything.

original: gal te yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de de bzhin du yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de de bzhin du yod do zhe na /
translated: If the past and future exist in the same way as the present,

original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur bas da ltar byung bar 'gyur te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur bas da ltar byung bar 'gyur te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it occurs just as it was experienced, it exists in the present, because there is no difference between past, future, and present.

original: 'on te med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say it does not exist,
