original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du yod pas zin pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin yongs su btang ba'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du yod pas zin pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin yongs su btang ba'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: then past and future form do not exist, because they are not the nature of form that is apprehended as it is experienced and as it occurs.

original: de ltar na med pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na med pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is established that nonexistent objects are also apprehended.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: rdzas dang btags pa nye bar len pa'i yul nyid shes pa ni yul med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas dang btags pa nye bar len pa'i yul nyid shes pa ni yul med pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of the apprehension of substantial and nominal form is not nonexistent,

original: med pa gnyis smos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa gnyis smos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not mentioned that the two are nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir ma sbrel bar smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma sbrel bar smras so //
translated: Therefore it is said without connecting it to the past and future.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang dmigs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang dmigs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement “The past and future are also apprehended”🔽is not a reply to the question.

original: gnyi ga yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: gnyi ga yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rkyen te /
translated: Both are conditions for the production of mental consciousness.

original: yid ni rten gyi ngo bo dang chos ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: yid ni rten gyi ngo bo dang chos ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The mind is the support and the mental factors are the object.

original: ji ltar rten med par yang skye ba mi 'thad par de bzhin du dmigs pa med par yang ste bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rten med par yang skye ba mi 'thad par de bzhin du dmigs pa med par yang ste bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as it is not tenable that there is production without a support, so it is not tenable that there is production without an object, because there would be no activity.

original: chos thams cad thams cad nyid la dmigs pa tsam gyis 'ga' zhig tu cung zad skyed par byed pa tsam gyi sgra smos pa don med do ;
analyzed: chos thams cad thams cad nyid la dmigs pa tsam gyis 'ga' zhig tu cung zad skyed par byed pa tsam gyi sgra smos pa don med do ;
translated: It is meaningless to say that the mind is produced by the mere observation of all phenomena, because it is produced by the mere observation of some phenomena.

original: / shes bya'i thibs po rnams la 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo ma yin pa'i phyir de dag nyams su myong ba nyid dang dran pas ji ltar dus rnam par 'byed par byed /
analyzed: / shes bya'i thibs po rnams la 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo ma yin pa'i phyir de dag nyams su myong ba nyid dang dran pas ji ltar dus rnam par 'byed par byed /
translated: Since mundane valid cognition is not a completely pure mind, how can it distinguish the times of the experience and memory of the dense thicket of objects of knowledge?

original: 'di ni 'di ltar gang nyams su myong ba ma 'ongs pa ni yul can du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar gang nyams su myong ba ma 'ongs pa ni yul can du mi 'gyur la /
translated: This is because the experience of the future does not become the subject,

original: blo rnam par dag pa'i yul ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo rnam par dag pa'i yul ni 'gyur ro //
translated: and the object of a completely pure mind is not the object of the experience.

original: de'i rnam pa gzhan nyid kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs so //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa gzhan nyid kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs so //
translated: It is the past and future that are imagined to exist by means of another aspect of that consciousness.

original: rnam pa gzhan du de yod pa nyid kyis snga nas med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag brtags par yod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du de yod pa nyid kyis snga nas med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag brtags par yod pa ste /
translated: The past and future exist in the manner of an existent that is imagined to be nonexistent prior to its existence and nonexistent after its cessation.

original: de'i ngo bo dngos po la ma bltos par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dngos po la ma bltos par brtags pa ste /
translated: That is to say, it is imagined to exist without regard to the entity that is its essence.

original: @145a * // bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽de'i phyir gnyis kyi khongs su 'dus par grub po //
analyzed: @145a * // bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no // de'i phyir gnyis kyi khongs su 'dus par grub po //
translated: It is like a pot, etc.🔽Therefore, it is established that the past and future are included in the two.

original: de bas na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs so zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs so zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa'o //
translated: Thus, the statement that the past and future are perceived is not tenable.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i chos da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yin bzhin du skyed par byed par 'dod pa de lta na /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i chos da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yin bzhin du skyed par byed par 'dod pa de lta na /
translated: If you maintain that a future entity generates consciousness of the present,

original: skyes bu byed pa med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ma gzung ba kho nar 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ma gzung ba kho nar 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the future would produce its effect without any human effort, and it would not be apprehended as future.

original: rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu rung gi skyes bu byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu rung gi skyes bu byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, future consciousness is a dominant result of future dharmas, but it is not a result of conscious effort.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The dominant result is

original: sngar byung las gzhan 'dus byas chos //
analyzed: sngar byung las gzhan 'dus byas chos //
translated: a conditioned dharma that arises later than its cause.

original: 'dus byas kyi ni bdag po'i 'bras bu zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi ni bdag po'i 'bras bu zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the dominant result of a conditioned dharma is a conditioned dharma that arises later than its cause.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang rgyu las sngar skyes pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang rgyu las sngar skyes pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: Also, the result of conscious effort is not asserted to arise earlier than its cause.

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyis da ltar ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyis da ltar ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pas /
translated: Therefore, it is logical to say that a future dharma that generates present consciousness does not generate it because it contradicts your own tenets.

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin la bskyed par bya ba yang mi 'gyur ro zhes rigs so //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin la bskyed par bya ba yang mi 'gyur ro zhes rigs so //
translated: It is also logical to say that it is not a result of generation.

original: dmigs pa tsam khas blangs pa la ni grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam khas blangs pa la ni grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you accept that it is merely an object, then there is no contradiction with your own tenets.

original: chos thams cad byed pa med pa yin pas 'dis bya ba gang ci yang rung ba dgag pa ni rgyu'i ngo bo dgag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa med pa yin pas 'dis bya ba gang ci yang rung ba dgag pa ni rgyu'i ngo bo dgag pa ma yin no //
translated: Since all dharmas are inactive, this refutes any activity whatsoever, but it does not refute the nature of a cause.

original: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams gzhan du dmigs shing gzhan du yod pa nyid na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams gzhan du dmigs shing gzhan du yod pa nyid na /
translated: If the past and future exist in a different way than they are perceived,

original: da ltar byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: then they would exist only in the present.

original: byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There would be no past or future at all.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes khas blangs so //🔽de nyid sil bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes khas blangs so // de nyid sil bu yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, you have accepted that a cognition can arise in a different aspect than its object.🔽If you say that the past and future are discrete states,

original: gang da ltar byung ba de nyid sil bu ste /
analyzed: gang da ltar byung ba de nyid sil bu ste /
translated: then the present is discrete,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni ma yin te sil bu mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni ma yin te sil bu mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but the past and future are not discrete, because they are not apprehended as discrete.

original: gal te de sil bur gyur pas sil bu nyid 'dzin cing da ltar byung ba nyams su myong bas dran pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de sil bur gyur pas sil bu nyid 'dzin cing da ltar byung ba nyams su myong bas dran pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say that the past and future are discrete states, but you apprehend the present as discrete and you remember the past as experienced,

original: byung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: then the past and future would be present.

original: dper na da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi tshogs pa ni sil bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi tshogs pa ni sil bu yin la /
translated: For example, the collection in the present moment is discrete.

original: tshogs pa'i gnas skabs la ma bltos par sil bu 'dzin pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i gnas skabs la ma bltos par sil bu 'dzin pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: But the apprehension of the discrete does not depend on the collection in the present moment.🔽If you say that the present is the state of the past and future, then you are merely saying that the present is past and future in terms of the atoms.

original: gal te de yang de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa @145b dang da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo de ni rdul phra rab gyis pa las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par brjod par zad kyi chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gags pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de yang de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa @145b dang da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo de ni rdul phra rab gyis pa las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par brjod par zad kyi chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gags pa med do zhe na /
translated: But no dharma whatsoever arises or ceases.

original: de lta yin na rdul phra rab rnams rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na rdul phra rab rnams rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the atoms would be permanent,

original: dus gsum du yang rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the nature of not changing in the three times.

original: bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam las 'gyur ba rjes su 'jug pas gang da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na rdul phra rab bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam las 'gyur ba rjes su 'jug pas gang da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na rdul phra rab bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the change is merely the collection and dispersal of the atoms, the atoms in the present moment become past and future merely through the collection and dispersal of the atoms.

original: de lta na rtag tu rdul phra rab bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam 'di 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na rtag tu rdul phra rab bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam 'di 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the mere aggregation and dispersal of subtle particles would always be the past and the future.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa tsam kho na la da ltar byung ba zhes bya'i 'ga' yang skye ba med do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa tsam kho na la da ltar byung ba zhes bya'i 'ga' yang skye ba med do //
translated: Only the mere aggregation of subtle particles is called the present, and nothing arises.

original: de gyes pa tsam la 'das pa zhes bya'i 'ga' yang skye ba med do //
analyzed: de gyes pa tsam la 'das pa zhes bya'i 'ga' yang skye ba med do //
translated: Only the mere dispersal of that is called the past, and nothing arises.

original: de ltar na 'tsho byed kyi rtsod pa blangs pa yin te de dag ni 'di ltar smra ste'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'tsho byed kyi rtsod pa blangs pa yin te de dag ni 'di ltar smra ste'o //
translated: Thus, the argument of Jīvaka is accepted, and they speak in this way.

original: mdo yang bor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo yang bor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: The sūtra would be rejected means that it would be contradicted.

original: ji ltar 'gal bar byas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal bar byas she na /
translated: How is it contradicted?

original: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sil bu dang da ltar byung ba'i dus na bsags pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sil bu dang da ltar byung ba'i dus na bsags pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The subtle particles of the eye sense faculty are discrete in the future, and they are aggregated in the present.

original: mig ni skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ongs zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: mig ni skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ongs zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: This contradicts the statement, “When the eye arises, it does not come from anywhere.”

original: de bzhin du mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam du khas blangs pas 'gags pa na gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de dang 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam du khas blangs pas 'gags pa na gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de dang 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, since it is accepted that the atoms of the eye sense faculty are merely accumulated and dispersed, it is contradicted that when they cease, they do not accumulate anywhere.

original: 'gags pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas mig ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig ces bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gags pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas mig ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig ces bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar byas pa yin te /
translated: Since it is said that they do not cease, it is contradicted that the eye arises from what did not exist and having arisen, it is destroyed.

original: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa'i phyir dang bsags pa de rnams kyang dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa'i phyir dang bsags pa de rnams kyang dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the atoms of the eye sense faculty are permanent and because their accumulation is not a thing.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams kyis bsags pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams kyis bsags pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those that are not an accumulation of atoms means those that are not an accumulation of atoms.

original: ci ltar sil bu nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar sil bu nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How are they discrete?

original: yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir sil bu nyid de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir sil bu nyid de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: They are discrete because they do not exist as objects.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba @146a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba @146a * //
translated: Also refers to the following.

original: ni tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ni tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “Those” refers to feelings, etc.

original: skye mched bcu gsum pa yang dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gsum pa yang dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The thirteenth sense sphere would be the object.

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yod pa de bzhin du skye mched bcu gsum pa yod pa ma yin pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bzhin du de yang dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yod pa de bzhin du skye mched bcu gsum pa yod pa ma yin pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bzhin du de yang dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If the object of the mental consciousness exists, then the thirteenth sense sphere would exist, just as the past and future exist.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa med de zhes bya bar nges so //🔽'on te skye mched bcu gsum pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa med de zhes bya bar nges so // 'on te skye mched bcu gsum pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that consciousness does not exist without an object.

original: skye mched bcu gsum pa med do snyam pa'i shes pa 'di'i dmigs pa dngos por mi rung ste /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gsum pa med do snyam pa'i shes pa 'di'i dmigs pa dngos por mi rung ste /
translated: But if the thirteenth sense sphere does not exist, then the cognition that thinks “the thirteenth sense sphere does not exist” is not tenable.🔽The object of that cognition is not a real entity,

original: skye mched bcu gsum pa mig la sogs pas bltar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gsum pa mig la sogs pas bltar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thirteenth sense sphere is not visible, like the eye, etc.

original: de'i phyir med pa las tha dad pa 'di'i dmigs pa ci zhig yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa las tha dad pa 'di'i dmigs pa ci zhig yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that the object of that cognition is something different from nonexistence.

original: ming de nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming de nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The name itself is the object of meditation.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: don med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is meaningless.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: 'dir yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di mngon par brjod pa'i rnam grangs yod pas 'di mngon par brjod pa de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa de'i rnam grangs kyang brjod pa'i blo skye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dir yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di mngon par brjod pa'i rnam grangs yod pas 'di mngon par brjod pa de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa de'i rnam grangs kyang brjod pa'i blo skye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Here, the expression “nonexistent” is a synonym for “nonexistent.” Because of that expression, the cognition “nonexistent” arises as a synonym for that expression.

original: med pa nyid yin na de lta na ni 'o na ming nyid med do zhes bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid yin na de lta na ni 'o na ming nyid med do zhes bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were nonexistent, then it would be understood that the name itself does not exist.

original: de don med de ming yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i nyams su myong ba nyid med pas ci ltar rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de don med de ming yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i nyams su myong ba nyid med pas ci ltar rtog par 'gyur /
translated: That is meaningless, because the name is not experienced by the ear consciousness. How could it be understood?

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: de la nges pa med do snyam pa'i blo skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la nges pa med do snyam pa'i blo skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The cognition “It is not ascertained” does not arise.

original: 'o na ci zhe na yod do snyam pa'i blo skyes pas de'i dngos po dgag pa'i yul rnams dngos po'i yul can te dngos po dgag pa'o //🔽med ces brjod pa de'i phyir brjod pa'i yul gyi blo'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na yod do snyam pa'i blo skyes pas de'i dngos po dgag pa'i yul rnams dngos po'i yul can te dngos po dgag pa'o // med ces brjod pa de'i phyir brjod pa'i yul gyi blo'o //
translated: But if it is asked, “What is it?” the cognition arises that it exists. Therefore, the objects of negation are objects of cognition that have real entities as their objects.🔽The negation of real entities is the cognition that has as its object the expression “nonexistent.”

original: gang la yul med par 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin pas dgag pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang la yul med par 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin pas dgag pa'i don to //
translated: Since it is not appropriate to occur without an object, the meaning of negation is the object of the cognition that has as its object the expression “nonexistent.”

original: de la don rjod par byed pa dang blo ni dper na bram ze rtag go zhes gang brjod pa brjod bya ma yin pa ji lta bar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la don rjod par byed pa dang blo ni dper na bram ze rtag go zhes gang brjod pa brjod bya ma yin pa ji lta bar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In this regard, the expression and the cognition do not exist, just as, for example, the expression “the brahmin is permanent” does not exist.

original: de la don med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhes rjod par byed pa nyid kyi blo las /
analyzed: de la don med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhes rjod par byed pa nyid kyi blo las /
translated: Since it has no meaning, the cognition that has as its object the expression “nonexistent” does not exist.

original: gal te med pa brjod byar gyur na sgra gang yang rung ba don med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te med pa brjod byar gyur na sgra gang yang rung ba don med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nonexistent were the object of expression, then any sound would be meaningless.

original: gal @146b te dngos po dgag pa'i yul yod pa ma yin pa'i blo las ming gi yul du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal @146b te dngos po dgag pa'i yul yod pa ma yin pa'i blo las ming gi yul du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object of negation were not the object of a cognition that has a real entity as its object, then it would not be the object of a name.

original: yang na ming med pa'i rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ming med pa'i rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or else it would follow, absurdly, that it would be of the nature of the nameless.

original: gal te dngos po dgag pa'i yul yang dngos po nyid du dmigs na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po dgag pa'i yul yang dngos po nyid du dmigs na /
translated: If the object of negation were to be perceived as an entity,

original: bram ze la sogs pa dgag pa'i yul yang bram ze nyid du dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽gang bshad pa dngos po dgag pa med par bshad pas 'dir dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ram brjod bya ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po dgag pa brjod par brtag ce na /
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa dgag pa'i yul yang bram ze nyid du dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro // gang bshad pa dngos po dgag pa med par bshad pas 'dir dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ram brjod bya ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po dgag pa brjod par brtag ce na /
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that the object of negation, the Brahmin, would be perceived as a Brahmin.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang skye ba med de de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'on te dngos po'i sgra ni yod pa'i sgrar brjod do zhe na de lta na yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang skye ba med de de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // 'on te dngos po'i sgra ni yod pa'i sgrar brjod do zhe na de lta na yang mi rigs te /
translated: You may say, The negation of an entity is explained as being without an entity, and so here we are speaking of the negation of an entity because of its being of the nature of a nonentity or because of its being inexpressible, but in neither case is there arising, because it is of the nature of that.

original: 'dir yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i sgra'i ngo bos 'chad par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i sgra'i ngo bos 'chad par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: If you say that the word entity is used to refer to an existent, then that is also incorrect, for here the word nonexistent is not being used in the sense of not existent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: skye mched bcu gsum pa'i sgra'i don no //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gsum pa'i sgra'i don no //
translated: It is the referent of the word thirteenth sense base.

original: bram ze ma yin zhes bya bas kyang bram ze dang 'dra bar gzhan rtogs te /
analyzed: bram ze ma yin zhes bya bas kyang bram ze dang 'dra bar gzhan rtogs te /
translated: The statement “He is not a Brahmin” also makes one understand that he is like a Brahmin.

original: gzhan thams cad ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba 'dir bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba 'dir bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement “He is not all of the others” means that he is not a Brahmin.

original: sgra la shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra la shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The word “Brahmin” does not exist in consciousness.

original: skye mched bcu gsum pa yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'dir yang skye mched bcu gsum pa'i sgra'i don nyid yod pa ma yin par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gsum pa yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'dir yang skye mched bcu gsum pa'i sgra'i don nyid yod pa ma yin par sgrub par byed do //
translated: The statement “The thirteenth sense sphere does not exist” proves that the meaning of the word “thirteenth sense sphere” does not exist.

original: med pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin gang yin pa 'di gnyis brjod byar 'dod pas de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa brjod par byed pa'i sgra don med pa can du 'dod do //
analyzed: med pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin gang yin pa 'di gnyis brjod byar 'dod pas de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa brjod par byed pa'i sgra don med pa can du 'dod do //
translated: Since you assert that both the word “nonexistent” and the word “existent” are the referents of the words “nonexistent” and “existent,” therefore you assert that the words that express existent and nonexistent things are meaningless.

original: gang bshad pa dngos po ci yang med pa ni shes bya ma yin zhing brjod bya ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang bshad pa dngos po ci yang med pa ni shes bya ma yin zhing brjod bya ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nonexistent is not an object of knowledge and not an object of expression,

original: de lta na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa yang shes bya ma yin pa dang brjod bya ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa yang shes bya ma yin pa dang brjod bya ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that a pot, a cloth, and so on are not objects of knowledge and not objects of expression.

original: dngos po ci yang med pa dag kyang snga na med pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa ni mi 'gal te /
analyzed: dngos po ci yang med pa dag kyang snga na med pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa ni mi 'gal te /
translated: Also, it is not contradictory for things that are absolutely nonexistent to be different by way of the divisions of prior nonexistence and so on,

original: bltos pas tha dad pa'i bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bltos pas tha dad pa'i bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are different by way of dependence, like a vase and a cloth and so on.

original: sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: That which observes the prior nonexistence of sound is that which observes the unborn.

original: de la dmigs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is observed by that?

original: skye ba dgag pa ma gtogs pa gzhan ma yin pas sgra'i ma skyes pa yod do zhes dgongs pa'o //🔽bye brag tu smra ba @147a * //
analyzed: skye ba dgag pa ma gtogs pa gzhan ma yin pas sgra'i ma skyes pa yod do zhes dgongs pa'o // bye brag tu smra ba @147a * //
translated: The nonexistence of sound is observed, because it is nothing other than the negation of the arising of sound.🔽The Vaibhasikas say:

original: rnams ni sgra kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnams ni sgra kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Sound itself.

original: dus gsum du yang sgra'i rang bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang sgra'i rang bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of sound does not differ in the three times.

original: de lta na 'o na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then the following error would ensue.

original: gal te gang zhig sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs na des sgra kho na dmigs pas dgag pa tsam thob kyi gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gang zhig sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs na des sgra kho na dmigs pas dgag pa tsam thob kyi gzhan ma yin no //
translated: If one observes the prior nonexistence of sound, one observes sound itself and one obtains mere negation, but not something else.

original: de lta yin na gang zhig sgra med pa don du gnyer ba de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gang zhig sgra med pa don du gnyer ba de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then for one who seeks soundlessness, sound would have to be produced.

original: des sgra don du gnyer bar 'gyur gyi sgra med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des sgra don du gnyer bar 'gyur gyi sgra med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For one who seeks soundlessness would seek sound, not soundlessness.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that it is the future state,

original: ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba sgra kho na'i sgra snga na med pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba sgra kho na'i sgra snga na med pa'o //
translated: then it is called the state of non-arising, and the sound itself is non-existent prior to the sound.

original: gang zhig sgra med pa don du gnyer ba ni ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs kyi sgra de nyid don du gnyer ba yin la de'i bya ba 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig sgra med pa don du gnyer ba ni ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs kyi sgra de nyid don du gnyer ba yin la de'i bya ba 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: For one who seeks soundlessness seeks just that sound in the state of non-arising, and the activity of that does not occur.

original: yod na ji ltar med pa'i blor 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod na ji ltar med pa'i blor 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it exists, how could there be the cognition of non-existence?

original: sngar skyes pa'i sgra med pa ste da ltar ba'i sgra bzung nas med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa'i sgra med pa ste da ltar ba'i sgra bzung nas med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The cognition thinking it does not exist does not arise by apprehending the non-existence of sound that has arisen earlier, i.e., the present sound.

original: da ltar byung ba med do zhes bya ba la 'di da ltar byung ba med do snyam pa'i de lta bur de la med do snyam pa'i blo 'jug gi / yang med pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba med do zhes bya ba la 'di da ltar byung ba med do snyam pa'i de lta bur de la med do snyam pa'i blo 'jug gi / yang med pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the mind observes a non-existent object.

original: gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is the same.

original: gang kho na ma 'ongs pa de nyid da ltar byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gang kho na ma 'ongs pa de nyid da ltar byung ba yin na /
translated: If that which is future is the same as that which is present,

original: ci ltar da ltar byung ba med ces bya ba dang da ltar byung yang ma 'ongs pa med pas de la yang med pa'i blo yod par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar da ltar byung ba med ces bya ba dang da ltar byung yang ma 'ongs pa med pas de la yang med pa'i blo yod par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then how can the mind engage in the thought “It does not exist in the present”? Or, since the present does not exist in the future, how can the mind engage in the thought “It does not exist in that”? There is no difference between them.

original: yang na bye brag gang yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na bye brag gang yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, what is the difference?

original: da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na gang med pa de ni da ltar byung ba la med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na gang med pa de ni da ltar byung ba la med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which does not exist in the present state is said to not exist in the present.

original: de ma byung ba las byung bar grub ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ma byung ba las byung bar grub ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is established that it arises from what has not yet occurred.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su ma byung ba las da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs su byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su ma byung ba las da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs su byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it occurs in the present state from what has not yet occurred in the future state.

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga zhes bya ba la da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na ni yod pa dmigs pa yin la ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na ni med pa dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga zhes bya ba la da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs na ni yod pa dmigs pa yin la ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na ni med pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: “Both existent and non-existent” means that in the present, the existent is observed, and in the future, the non-existent is observed.

original: gal te med pa dmigs pa yin na 'o na byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs pa ji ltar drang /
analyzed: gal te med pa dmigs pa yin na 'o na byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs pa ji ltar drang /
translated: If the non-existent is observed, then how can it be said that the bodhisattva is not observed?

original: gang 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The text continues, “Whatever does not exist in the world…”

original: de las ni de'i dmigs pa med pa nyid yin pa @147b bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de las ni de'i dmigs pa med pa nyid yin pa @147b bkag pa yin no //
translated: This passage refutes the idea that the object of observation is non-existent.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gzhan zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gzhan zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The text continues, “Other conceited ones…”

original: 'dir mdo'i dgongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su ma dag pa rnams snang ba med bzhin du ste /
analyzed: 'dir mdo'i dgongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su ma dag pa rnams snang ba med bzhin du ste /
translated: The intended meaning of this sutra is that those whose meditative stabilization is impure do not observe appearances.

original: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na lha'i mig gi snang ba med bzhin du yod par lta'i bdag ni lha'i mig gi snang ba gsal ba'i ngo bor yod pa kho na yod par lta'i zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na lha'i mig gi snang ba med bzhin du yod par lta'i bdag ni lha'i mig gi snang ba gsal ba'i ngo bor yod pa kho na yod par lta'i zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: But when the Bodhisattva is in the state of preparation, he sees the appearance of the divine eye as existent, even though it is not yet present.

original: rtog par yang ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yod dam med ces the tshom du ste /
analyzed: rtog par yang ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yod dam med ces the tshom du ste /
translated: How could there be doubt?

original: blo rnams yod pa dang med pa'i yul can nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: blo rnams yod pa dang med pa'i yul can nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the cognitions have existent and nonexistent objects,

original: gnyis ka la lta ba'i dgos pa grub kyi /
analyzed: gnyis ka la lta ba'i dgos pa grub kyi /
translated: then the purpose of seeing both is accomplished.

original: yod pa'i yul can nyid yin na mi grub bo //
analyzed: yod pa'i yul can nyid yin na mi grub bo //
translated: But if they have only existent objects, it is not accomplished.

original: yang na khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya ba la /
translated: Or else, what is the difference?🔽If they also see only the appearance of the existent and not the nonexistent, then what is the difference between them and the others?

original: gal te de dag kyang yod pa'i snang ba kho na lta'i med pa ma yin na ni gzhan dag las byang chub sems dpa' la khyad par ci zhig yod 'di yod pa dang med pa gnyis blo'i yul yin pa nyid la dper brjod pa ni yod pa la
analyzed: gal te de dag kyang yod pa'i snang ba kho na lta'i med pa ma yin na ni gzhan dag las byang chub sems dpa' la khyad par ci zhig yod 'di yod pa dang med pa gnyis blo'i yul yin pa nyid la dper brjod pa ni yod pa la
translated: The example is given of the fact that both existence and nonexistence are objects of the mind.

original: yang yod par shes la /
analyzed: yang yod par shes la /
translated: One knows the existent as existent,🔽and one knows the nonexistent as nonexistent.

original: med pa la yang med par shes so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: med pa la yang med par shes so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: and that which is nonexistent is known to be nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the reason “because consciousness has an existent object” is also not correct.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: blo skye ba'i rgyu yod pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: blo skye ba'i rgyu yod pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause for the arising of cognition is twofold:

original: rdzas su yod pa dang btags par yod pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa dang btags par yod pa'o //
translated: substantial existence and imputed existence.

original: gang la bltos pa med par blo skye ba de ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la bltos pa med par blo skye ba de ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
translated: That which arises without depending on anything else is substantially existent.

original: gang la bltos pas blo skye ba de ni btags par yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la bltos pas blo skye ba de ni btags par yod pa'o //
translated: That which arises in dependence on something else is imputedly existent.

original: rdzas su yod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Substantial existence is also twofold:

original: bya ba'i khyad par dang / dngos po tsam mo //
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par dang / dngos po tsam mo //
translated: the particular activity and mere entity.

original: btags par yod pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te rdzas nye bar len pa dang / btags pa nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: btags par yod pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te rdzas nye bar len pa dang / btags pa nye bar len pa'o //
translated: Imputed existence is also twofold: that which appropriates a substance and that which appropriates an imputation.

original: gal te btags par yod pa'i yul la yang rnam par shes pa dngos po ma yin pa dmigs na /
analyzed: gal te btags par yod pa'i yul la yang rnam par shes pa dngos po ma yin pa dmigs na /
translated: If consciousness that has a nonexistent object arises, then even in the case of an object that is imputedly existent, if consciousness arises in dependence on that, then it is imputedly existent.

original: btags par yod pa'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rang bzhin med pa'i phyir de nye bar len pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: btags par yod pa'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rang bzhin med pa'i phyir de nye bar len pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is like a form that is imputedly existent, it is not the object of appropriation.

original: gal te de ltar rnam par shes pa la btags par yod pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rnam par shes pa la btags par yod pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na /
translated: If consciousness does not have an object that is imputedly existent,

original: de nye bar len pa rdzas su yod pa'i phyir /🔽rnam par shes pa la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i @148a * //
analyzed: de nye bar len pa rdzas su yod pa'i phyir / rnam par shes pa la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i @148a * //
translated: then because the object of appropriation exists substantially,🔽the aspects of a vase, cloth, etc.

original: rnam pa gzugs la sogs pa yul du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gzugs la sogs pa yul du mi rung ngo //
translated: are not suitable as objects such as form in consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa so so ba nyid kyang de'i rnam par gzugs la sogs par thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa so so ba nyid kyang de'i rnam par gzugs la sogs par thal ba ma yin no //
translated: Because form, etc., are not its aspects, it is not a consequence that its individual aspects are form, etc.

original: rgyu tsam nyid kyis yul dmigs par thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu tsam nyid kyis yul dmigs par thal ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not a consequence that an object is perceived by mere cause,

original: rkyen thams cad dmigs pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen thams cad dmigs pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that all conditions are objects.

original: de'i phyir rang dang mthun pa'i shes pa skyed pa ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang dang mthun pa'i shes pa skyed pa ni rgyu yin la /
translated: Therefore, that which generates consciousness that is compatible with it is the cause.

original: de nyid dmigs pa ni rgyu rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dmigs pa ni rgyu rkyen yin no //
translated: The object of that is the cause.

original: de ltar ma yin par gal te snang ba med pa'i shes pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa gzhan yin par 'dod pa de lta na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin par gal te snang ba med pa'i shes pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa gzhan yin par 'dod pa de lta na /
translated: If it were otherwise, if the object of a cognition that does not appear were accepted as being of a different kind,

original: ha cang thal ba'i phyir bstan pa chen po las nye bar 'khyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba'i phyir bstan pa chen po las nye bar 'khyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because of the absurdity of the consequence, the great teaching would be reduced to a mere wandering in circles.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig ka ba la skyes bu'i rnam par shes pa de ni ka ba la dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dang der yang skyes bu med pa'i phyir yul med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig ka ba la skyes bu'i rnam par shes pa de ni ka ba la dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dang der yang skyes bu med pa'i phyir yul med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the cognition of a person that arises in relation to a pillar is not different from the cognition that has the pillar as its object, and since there is no person in the pillar, the object does not exist.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i rgyud kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i rgyud kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “from the special continuum that precedes it” is as follows.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyud yin no //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyud yin no //
translated: The special continuum that precedes it is the continuum that is in conformity with the effect that is a natural outcome.

original: khyad par smos pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyud bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par smos pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyud bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “special” is used to indicate the continuum that is in conformity with the effect that is a ripening.

original: bdag tu smra ba dgag pa nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dgag pa nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las te /
translated: The refutation of the doctrine of self will be explained in the chapter on the refutation of the doctrine of self.

original: sa bon dang 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sa bon dang 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The example of seed and fruit is given in the verse that begins, “Just as a seed and a sprout.”

original: gang zhig 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa ni btags par ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa ni btags par ma yin no //
translated: That which exists substantially in the past and future is not a nominal reality.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la'o //
translated: “That” refers to the effect.

original: de med par de yod pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i yod pa skye bar bya ba la rgyu'i nus pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de med par de yod pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i yod pa skye bar bya ba la rgyu'i nus pa yin pas so //
translated: Since the effect does not exist without the cause, the cause has the power to produce the existent effect.

original: gal te 'bras bu rtag tu yod na ni de la las kyi nus pa med de /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rtag tu yod na ni de la las kyi nus pa med de /
translated: If the effect always existed, then the cause would not have the power to produce it.

original: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las don med par thal bar 'gyur bas chen pos bstan pa las nyams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las don med par thal bar 'gyur bas chen pos bstan pa las nyams so //
translated: Therefore, the doctrine of the uselessness of virtuous and nonvirtuous action would follow, and this would contradict the teaching of the great teacher.

original: a'a ra tsi to bha ba ti /
analyzed: a'a ra tsi to bha ba ti /
translated: The word “aracita” means “produced.”

original: skyed par nus so zhes bya ba la /🔽yang 'di skyed pa ci gal te /
analyzed: skyed par nus so zhes bya ba la / yang 'di skyed pa ci gal te /
translated: The word “bhavati” means “has the power to produce.”🔽If the effect exists, what is the use of producing it?

original: 'bras bu yod pa skyed ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa skyed ce na ma yin te /
translated: If the effect does not exist, what is the use of producing it?

original: 'o na ma 'ongs pas rdzas su yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ma 'ongs pas rdzas su yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But then the future would be substantially existent.

original: gal te skyed pa de yod pa nyid las tha dad pa'i 'ga' zhig khyad par 'dzin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyed pa de yod pa nyid las tha dad pa'i 'ga' zhig khyad par 'dzin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the distinction is that the effect is produced from that which exists,

original: 'o na ni skye ba ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba grub @148b pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni skye ba ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba grub @148b pa yin te /
translated: then it is established that the effect arises from that which has not yet arisen.

original: khyad par de sngar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par de sngar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that distinction did not exist previously.

original: 'bras bu las gzhan du brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu las gzhan du brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that the effect is different from its cause,

original: gal te 'di las gzhan pa las dang 'bras bu'i nus pa med pas de'i gnas skabs kho na skyed na /
analyzed: gal te 'di las gzhan pa las dang 'bras bu'i nus pa med pas de'i gnas skabs kho na skyed na /
translated: because if the effect is produced from that which is different from its cause, then the effect would not be produced from the power of the cause.

original: snga na med pa'i phyir dang phyis kyang thams cad yod par smra bas yongs su btang bas dngos po re re ba gzhan ma yin pas de dag kyang rtag pa 'am mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i phyir dang phyis kyang thams cad yod par smra bas yongs su btang bas dngos po re re ba gzhan ma yin pas de dag kyang rtag pa 'am mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect is produced from a state that is different from the cause, then the effect would not exist prior to its production, and because the Sāṃkhyas maintain that everything exists, the effect would not be different from the cause. Therefore it follows that the effect would be either permanent or impermanent.

original: yang cha shas kyi rtag pa nyid du khas len na gzhan nyid rtag la gzhan mi rtag go zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang cha shas kyi rtag pa nyid du khas len na gzhan nyid rtag la gzhan mi rtag go zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if you accept that the effect is permanent in part, then it follows that the other part would be permanent and impermanent.

original: btags par yod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid skye bar brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: btags par yod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid skye bar brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Because it exists as a designation, it should not be said that non-entityness arises.

original: de la las rnams kyi nus pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la las rnams kyi nus pa mi rigs so //
translated: And the potency of karma is not tenable in regard to that.

original: yang thams cad yod pa kho na zhes bya ba ni las de dang 'bras bu skye ba'o //
analyzed: yang thams cad yod pa kho na zhes bya ba ni las de dang 'bras bu skye ba'o //
translated: “Everything exists” means that karma and the arising of its effect exist.

original: da ni gang la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ni gang la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Now, “in regard to what” means

original: skye ba'am 'bras bu la las sam gzhan yang rung ste rgyu gang zhig nus te /
analyzed: skye ba'am 'bras bu la las sam gzhan yang rung ste rgyu gang zhig nus te /
translated: in regard to arising or the effect, what cause—whether karma or something else—is potent?

original: thams cad kyi tshe rdzas su yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe rdzas su yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because everything is substantially existent at all times.

original: de lta na lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod pa skad du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod pa skad du zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that case, the logicians’ argument is stated:🔽“It is not perceived.”

original: 'di nye bar mi dmigs so zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: 'di nye bar mi dmigs so zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: This is what Master Samghabhadra says.

original: rnam grangs kyis 'gags pa'i rigs rnams yod pa dang med par khas blangs pa'i phyir yod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis 'gags pa'i rigs rnams yod pa dang med par khas blangs pa'i phyir yod pa'o //
translated: Because the ceased class of things is accepted as both existent and nonexistent by way of alternative categories, it exists.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang 'jig pa'i chos can shes bya'i bdag nyid sngar skyes pa rnams dang lhan cig spyod pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni med pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang 'jig pa'i chos can shes bya'i bdag nyid sngar skyes pa rnams dang lhan cig spyod pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni med pa'o //
translated: The past and future, which are the objects of knowledge, are not the present self of the effect, which is the simultaneous activity of the previously arisen.

original: da ltar byung ba'i bdag nyid rab tu sbyor ba la mngon par 'jug pa ni da ltar byung ba ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i bdag nyid rab tu sbyor ba la mngon par 'jug pa ni da ltar byung ba ste /
translated: The present self is the present engagement in the application of the effect.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: The past and future are not like that.

original: de ltar lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod pa skad du byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod pa skad du byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the dispute of the astrologers is that the past and future exist.

original: gal te shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that they are the self of consciousness,

original: lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod pa med pa bden no //
analyzed: lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod pa med pa bden no //
translated: then it is true that the dispute of the astrologers does not arise.

original: 'on te yang da ltar byung ba bzhin rang gi ngo bos shes bya'i bdag nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te yang da ltar byung ba bzhin rang gi ngo bos shes bya'i bdag nyid du 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that they are the self of the object of knowledge by means of their own nature, like the present,

original: de lta na thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir ji ltar lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod par thal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir ji ltar lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod par thal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: then since they exist at all times, why would the dispute of the astrologers not arise?

original: 'o na da ltar du byed nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu yod bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'o na da ltar du byed nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu yod bzhin du'o //
translated: But if you say that it is able to do so now, then action and effect would exist.

original: yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yul na mi gnas pas zhes @149a * //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yul na mi gnas pas zhes @149a * //
translated: If you say that it is led to another place, then the future does not exist in a place,

original: bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis smras pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis smras pa'o //
translated: and this is the intention expressed by the phrase “since it does not exist in a place.”

original: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de 'dren pa'i rkyen rnams rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de 'dren pa'i rkyen rnams rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would follow that it is permanent, because the conditions that lead it to another place would always be present.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa de tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la de ji ltar te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa de tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la de ji ltar te /
translated: How could it lead feeling, etc., which are not material?

original: 'dren zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dren zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: The phrase “it is led” is supplied.

original: de rnams ni rtag tu yul na mi gnas pas dris pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni rtag tu yul na mi gnas pas dris pa yin no //
translated: They are not led because they do not exist in a place.

original: 'bras bu'i 'dren pa bya ba'i ming can gang yin pa de yang ma byung ba las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i 'dren pa bya ba'i ming can gang yin pa de yang ma byung ba las byung ba yin te /
translated: That which is called the activity of leading to the effect also arises from what is non-existent,

original: de ni sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist previously.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Here, the same analysis applies as before.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par zhig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par zhig ces bya ba la /
translated: If you say that it is a particular intrinsic nature,

original: da ltar ba byed pa'i rang bzhin sngar da ltar byung ba ma yin pa da ltar byung bar byed pa yin pa de lta na las kyis nus pa grub pas /
analyzed: da ltar ba byed pa'i rang bzhin sngar da ltar byung ba ma yin pa da ltar byung bar byed pa yin pa de lta na las kyis nus pa grub pas /
translated: If the present action has the nature of not having arisen previously, and now arises, then in that case, since the potency of the action is established,

original: ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba grub po //
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba grub po //
translated: it is established that it arises from what did not exist.

original: de ltar de yang da ltar byung bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de yang da ltar byung bar byas pa yin no //
translated: And in that case, it is also present.

original: gal te sngar ma byung ba las phyis byung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: gal te sngar ma byung ba las phyis byung ba nyid dam /
translated: If it is said that it arises later from what did not exist previously,

original: 'on te sngar yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: or if it is said that it existed previously,

original: da ltar bar byas pas 'di la khyad par yod pa ma yin pas las kyis nus pa med pa so na 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: da ltar bar byas pas 'di la khyad par yod pa ma yin pas las kyis nus pa med pa so na 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: then since there is no difference in this case due to the present action, the potency of the action remains as it is, without being established.

original: ji ltar ming med pa'i ngo bo 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ming med pa'i ngo bo 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can an entity without a name arise?

original: btags pa dang bcas pa dang btags pa med pa nyid kyis shin tu tha dad pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: btags pa dang bcas pa dang btags pa med pa nyid kyis shin tu tha dad pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It would be an entity without a name due to the complete difference between that which is nominally designated and that which is not.

original: 'o na rgyu'i rkyen yod pa rnams la dngos por 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu'i rkyen yod pa rnams la dngos por 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
translated: If the causes exist, then it would be an entity.

original: de ni snga na yod pa ma yin pa las bya ste /
analyzed: de ni snga na yod pa ma yin pa las bya ste /
translated: It is produced from what did not exist previously.

original: gang bshad pa ci ltar med pa'i khyad par yongs su brtag ce na /
analyzed: gang bshad pa ci ltar med pa'i khyad par yongs su brtag ce na /
translated: How can one conceive of the difference of nonexistence that has been explained?

original: 'di dngos po med pa rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'di rgyu med pa can zhes de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: 'di dngos po med pa rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'di rgyu med pa can zhes de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is explained in this way: “This is nonexistence with a cause; this is without a cause.”

original: kha cig med pa'i rgyu yongs su rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig med pa'i rgyu yongs su rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Some do not conceive of a cause of nonexistence.

original: 'o na dngos po rnams kho na'i rgyu khas len pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po rnams kho na'i rgyu khas len pa ci zhe na /
translated: Well, then, why do you accept a cause of things?

original: de ni sngar byung ba ma yin pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: de ni sngar byung ba ma yin pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: It is of what was not previously existent.

original: de yang thams cad la thams cad ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang thams cad la thams cad ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not of everything.

original: 'o na ci zhe na 'dir yod pa gang yin pa de nyid gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na 'dir yod pa gang yin pa de nyid gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Well, then, what is it? It is of what exists here, not of what is other.

original: dper na bya ba snga na med pa'i rkyen mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bya ba snga na med pa'i rkyen mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the fact that the condition of the nonexistence of an action prior to its performance is not accepted.

original: 'o na bya ba nyid kyis ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bya ba nyid kyis ci zhe na /
translated: Well, then, what about the action itself?

original: bya ba snga na med pa la rkyen rnams kyis bya ba mi byed pas dus dang bya ba snga na med pa mi 'dod do //
analyzed: bya ba snga na med pa la rkyen rnams kyis bya ba mi byed pas dus dang bya ba snga na med pa mi 'dod do //
translated: Since the conditions do not perform the action of the nonexistence of an action prior to its performance, the nonexistence of time and action prior to its performance is not accepted.

original: de'i tshe dus dang bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa @149b 'di brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dus dang bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa @149b 'di brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: At that time, the presentation of time and action would be untenable,

original: rdzas bzhin du bya ba yang rtag pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te skye mched bcu gnyis yod kyi /
analyzed: rdzas bzhin du bya ba yang rtag pa'i phyir ro // gal te skye mched bcu gnyis yod kyi /
translated: because action would be permanent, like a substance.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med na /
translated: If the twelve bases exist, but the past and future do not exist,

original: yid kyi skye mched 'das par ji ltar gzhag ce na smras pa /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched 'das par ji ltar gzhag ce na smras pa /
translated: how can the mental base be posited as past?

original: rnam par shes pa da ltar ba kho na rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos por rnam par gnas kyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa da ltar ba kho na rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos por rnam par gnas kyi /
translated: Past consciousness exists as the basis of another consciousness that is present,

original: 'das pa ni ma yin pas skyon 'di med do //
analyzed: 'das pa ni ma yin pas skyon 'di med do //
translated: but not as past. Therefore this error does not arise.

original: yang na dus gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na dus gsum ste /
translated: Or, the three times exist.

original: gal te dus gsum yod do zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te dus gsum yod do zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say the three times exist,

original: 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa grub bo zhe na /
translated: then the past and future exist.🔽Therefore it is said, “We have already explained how they exist. ”

original: de'i phyir ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te sngon byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te sngon byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yin no //
translated: That which occurred in the past is past.

original: rgyu yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: That which will occur if its cause exists is future.

original: byung nas ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar ba yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: byung nas ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar ba yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: That which has arisen and not yet ceased is present.🔽How is one said to possess past and future afflictions?

original: ji ltar na des der ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des sam 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos por der ldan pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar na des der ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des sam 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos por der ldan pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: How is one said to possess past and future afflictions?

original: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas /
analyzed: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas /
translated: Because the negative tendencies that arise from them exist.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /🔽'das pa'i nyon mongs pa las skyes pa'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te / 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa las skyes pa'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan no //
translated: This is explained in detail.🔽One possesses past afflictions because the negative tendencies that arise from past afflictions exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dang ldan no //
translated: One possesses future afflictions because the negative tendencies that are the cause of future afflictions exist.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir de'i dngos po dang ldan no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir de'i dngos po dang ldan no zhes bya'o //
translated: One possesses the thing in the sense that the negative tendencies of the mental afflictions that focus on past and future things exist.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: don 'di ni gsog ste 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang phra rgyas zhes bya ba'i chos 'ga' yang rgyud las skye ba med do //
analyzed: don 'di ni gsog ste 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang phra rgyas zhes bya ba'i chos 'ga' yang rgyud las skye ba med do //
translated: This point is obscure. No past mental affliction or negative tendency arises in the mindstream.

original: chos gzhan gyis phra rgyas skye ba ni yod do //
analyzed: chos gzhan gyis phra rgyas skye ba ni yod do //
translated: The arising of negative tendencies is due to other factors.

original: 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not desire.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽'gag bzhin pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ma 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / 'gag bzhin pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ma 'ongs pa na /
translated: What is it?🔽It is the mental continuum that is in the process of ceasing, and the future mental continuum that is compatible with the arising of mental afflictions.

original: de skye ba nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mthun pa'i rgyud kyi ngo bo las rgyud de la skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa ni phra rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de skye ba nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mthun pa'i rgyud kyi ngo bo las rgyud de la skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa ni phra rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: The negative tendencies that are compatible with the arising of mental afflictions in the mental continuum are called negative tendencies.

original: de yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gi 'bras bu dang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gi 'bras bu dang rgyu yin no //
translated: They are the results and causes of past and future mental afflictions.

original: de la spangs pas phra rgyas bcom @150a * //
analyzed: de la spangs pas phra rgyas bcom @150a * //
translated: The negative tendencies are destroyed by abandoning the mental afflictions.

original: pa ma yin pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag dang ldan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pa ma yin pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag dang ldan zhes bya ste /
translated: The past and future afflictions are said to be possessed by one who is not a non-possessor.

original: 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir dang rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir dang rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect exists and because the cause exists.

original: de spangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de spangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not abandoned.

original: de'i phyir chos nyid dag ni zab pa yin zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos nyid dag ni zab pa yin zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that reality is profound.

original: shr'antotta ra ma ta phr'a sha ni k'a b'a /
analyzed: shr'antotta ra ma ta phr'a sha ni k'a b'a /
translated: The Sūtra on the Ten Stages says,

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni chos nyid do //
translated: The intrinsic nature of phenomena is reality.

original: skabs 'dir slob dpon 'dus bzang gis /
analyzed: skabs 'dir slob dpon 'dus bzang gis /
translated: In this context, Master Saṃghabhadra explains:

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gtan la dbab pa mang du bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gtan la dbab pa mang du bshad mod kyi /
translated: Although many topics are explained in the ascertainment of the past and future,

original: 'dir ni gzhung mngas pa'i 'jigs pas tshig so so la bshad pa ni ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung mngas pa'i 'jigs pas tshig so so la bshad pa ni ma byas so //
translated: here I have not explained each word for fear of being verbose.

original: don gyi (ltag lung rgya dper mu ta/) sgo nas ni dgag pa thams cad rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi (ltag lung rgya dper mu ta/) sgo nas ni dgag pa thams cad rtogs par bya'o //
translated: All negations should be understood from the perspective of the meaning.

original: gzugs skye'o gzugs 'gag go zhes bya ba'i don ni de nyid da ltar ba gyur nas 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs skye'o gzugs 'gag go zhes bya ba'i don ni de nyid da ltar ba gyur nas 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “form arises” and “form ceases” is that it becomes present and then becomes past.

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa skye la /
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa skye la /
translated: The future arises because it is directed toward arising.🔽The present ceases because it is directed toward cessation.

original: 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i da ltar gyi 'gag go / dus kyang skye ste zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i da ltar gyi 'gag go / dus kyang skye ste zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Time arises because it is included in the phenomena of arising.

original: dus las kyang ste zhes bya ba ni skye zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus las kyang ste zhes bya ba ni skye zhes bya'o //
translated: Time arises because it is included in the phenomena of arising.🔽Since it is momentary because it is not a single moment, it is momentary.

original: skad cig ma du ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig go / yod pa'i tshig gi rim pa gang skye ba de 'gag go zhes bshad de dpe smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma du ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig go / yod pa'i tshig gi rim pa gang skye ba de 'gag go zhes bshad de dpe smos te /
translated: The phrase “that which exists” is a general term for the present.🔽That which arises ceases. For example, form arises and form ceases.

original: gzugs skye bo gzugs 'gag go / rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan skye'o gzhan 'gag go zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs skye bo gzugs 'gag go / rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan skye'o gzhan 'gag go zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Since it is not a different substance, it arises and ceases as another.

original: gzhan skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa skye'o //
translated: The future arises because it is directed toward arising as another.

original: gzhan 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba 'gag go /
analyzed: gzhan 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba 'gag go /
translated: The present ceases because it is directed toward cessation as another.

original: dus kyang skye ste zhes bya ba dus ni skye ba'i chos kyis bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus kyang skye ste zhes bya ba dus ni skye ba'i chos kyis bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Time arises because it is included in the phenomena of arising.

original: dus kyi rang bzhin las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus kyi rang bzhin las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: from the nature of time.

original: de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang zhes pa'i mtshan nyid las dus kyang ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang zhes pa'i mtshan nyid las dus kyang ste /
translated: They are also time, since they are the basis of the expression “time,”

original: 'byung khungs kyi ngo bo las chos skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung khungs kyi ngo bo las chos skye ba'o //
translated: because phenomena arise from the nature of the source.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ma 'ongs pa'i dus skad cig ma du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ma 'ongs pa'i dus skad cig ma du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why? He says: because the future time is a multiplicity of moments.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma du ma spungs pa'i rang bzhin rnams las skad cig ma 'ga' zhig skye ba de'i phyir dus las kyang skye'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma du ma spungs pa'i rang bzhin rnams las skad cig ma 'ga' zhig skye ba de'i phyir dus las kyang skye'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Because the future is a multiplicity of moments that have the nature of an aggregation, a certain moment arises from that. Therefore, it is said that it arises from time.

original: zhar las 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma @150b kun gyi kun dang ldan zhes bya ba 'di'i zhar las 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhar las 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma @150b kun gyi kun dang ldan zhes bya ba 'di'i zhar las 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: The term “incidentally” means that this is an incidental discussion of “all of all” .

original: dngos po de spangs pa yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po de spangs pa yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: “Is that entity abandoned?”

original: 'dir spangs pa ni thob pa dang bral ba las mngon par 'dod la bral ba ni de la dmigs ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa las mngon par 'dod de de la dmigs pa'i nyon mong pa spangs na de ma spangs par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir re zhig
analyzed: 'dir spangs pa ni thob pa dang bral ba las mngon par 'dod la bral ba ni de la dmigs ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa las mngon par 'dod de de la dmigs pa'i nyon mong pa spangs na de ma spangs par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir re zhig
translated: If the affliction that focuses on that object is abandoned, it is not abandoned.

original: gang dang bral na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: gang dang bral na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If one is free from that,” and so on.

original: spangs kyang de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa yod pas de'i phyir spangs la de dang ma bral ba yang yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: spangs kyang de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa yod pas de'i phyir spangs la de dang ma bral ba yang yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Even though it is abandoned, since the affliction that focuses on that object is not abandoned, therefore it is said, “There is abandonment but not freedom from that,” and so on.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal mthong bas spangs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal mthong bas spangs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: From the perspective of the path of seeing, it is said, “Even though objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are abandoned,” and so on.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas dang po'i rnam pa spangs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas dang po'i rnam pa spangs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: From the perspective of the path of meditation, it is said, “Even though the first aspect is abandoned,” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa ni skyes la zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa gzung ngo //🔽kun 'byung shes pa yang de ltar gnyi ga gzung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa ni skyes la zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa gzung ngo // kun 'byung shes pa yang de ltar gnyi ga gzung ngo //
