translated: The phrase “one who has generated the knowledge of suffering” refers to one who has obtained the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering and subsequent knowledge.🔽The phrase “one who has generated the knowledge of origin” refers to one who has obtained both the knowledge of the dharma with regard to origin and subsequent knowledge.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsnan pa'i don to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsnan pa'i don to //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path are included.

original: rnam dgu po'i rnam pa gang dang gang sngar spangs pa'i lhag ma de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: rnam dgu po'i rnam pa gang dang gang sngar spangs pa'i lhag ma de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: The phrase “those that are concomitant with the remaining afflictions that focus on the remaining objects to be abandoned” means that the afflictions that focus on the remaining objects to be abandoned that are not yet abandoned are concomitant with the knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: 'dir de'i yul smos pas tha dad do zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: 'dir de'i yul smos pas tha dad do zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: Here, Master Saṅghabhadra says that they are differentiated by mentioning their objects.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams phan tshun dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir gang la 'dis khyad par du bya ba der ma byas so //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams phan tshun dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir gang la 'dis khyad par du bya ba der ma byas so //
translated: Since objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation mutually focus on each other, he does not make a distinction here.

original: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun tu 'gro ba gang gis sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa yod ce na /
analyzed: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun tu 'gro ba gang gis sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa yod ce na /
translated: What is the pervasive object to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin that focuses on objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering?

original: mdo las lan gsungs pa 'jig rten pa'i las kyis ji ltar ji srid pa bzhin mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu cig car spong bar byed do //
analyzed: mdo las lan gsungs pa 'jig rten pa'i las kyis ji ltar ji srid pa bzhin mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu cig car spong bar byed do //
translated: The sutra responds: “By mundane action, one simultaneously abandons the nine types of affliction that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation, just as they are.”

original: de la sngar spangs pa'i rnam pa kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang ldan pas de'i don du de'i yul smos pas skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba rnams de'i dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid grub po //
analyzed: de la sngar spangs pa'i rnam pa kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang ldan pas de'i don du de'i yul smos pas skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba rnams de'i dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid grub po //
translated: Since one possesses the pervasive states that were previously abandoned, the meaning of that is established by the statement that the object of that is its domain, because the pervasive states of the dissimilar realm are not its object.

original: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni de'i yul smos pas mi 'grub @151a * //
analyzed: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni de'i yul smos pas mi 'grub @151a * //
translated: The objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin are not established by the statement that they are its object.

original: bo ; / nus pa de yang kyang gi sgra dang mngon par 'brel pas brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: bo ; / nus pa de yang kyang gi sgra dang mngon par 'brel pas brtag par bya ste /
translated: That capacity is also to be analyzed in connection with the term also.

original: sngon du spangs pa'i rnam pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sngon du spangs pa'i rnam pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also in relation to the types that were previously abandoned.

original: de'i yul rnams ni sngar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i yul rnams ni sngar bshad do //
translated: Their objects have been explained previously.

original: 'dir ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nyon mongs pa'i yul nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nyon mongs pa'i yul nyid de /
translated: Here all afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation are the object of affliction.

original: yul gzhan dgu dang nyon mongs pa rnams gzhan du ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan dgu dang nyon mongs pa rnams gzhan du ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The other nine objects and the other afflictions are not concomitant with it.

original: de'i phyir 'di yul gyi khyad par du byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yul gyi khyad par du byas te /
translated: Therefore, this is distinguished as its object.

original: spangs pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang ldan la /
analyzed: spangs pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang ldan la /
translated: It is concomitant with that which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: lhag ma kun tu 'gro ba rnams sngar spangs pa'i rnam pa lhag ma rnams dang ldan no zhes rjes su 'jug go / ci thams cad dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma kun tu 'gro ba rnams sngar spangs pa'i rnam pa lhag ma rnams dang ldan no zhes rjes su 'jug go / ci thams cad dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is concomitant with the remaining pervasive negative tendencies that were not previously abandoned and the remaining objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽What is the meaning of the phrase “all”?

original: 'o na ci de'i yul rnams dang zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'o na ci de'i yul rnams dang zhes smos te /
translated: The root text states, “The objects of those two.”

original: gnyi ga dang mngon par 'brel pa de'i phyir 'di glan ka ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang mngon par 'brel pa de'i phyir 'di glan ka ma yin no //
translated: Since it is concomitant with both, this is not a fault.

original: chos bcu drug po zhes bya ba dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: chos bcu drug po zhes bya ba dmigs pa ste /
translated: The root text states, “The sixteen aspects.”

original: khams gsum po re re zhing rnam pa lnga po //
analyzed: khams gsum po re re zhing rnam pa lnga po //
translated: Each of the three realms has five aspects:

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang zag pa med pa ste bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang zag pa med pa ste bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: those to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, and those to be abandoned by the path of meditation. Thus there are sixteen.

original: sems rnams kyang bcu drug ste de dag nyid do //
analyzed: sems rnams kyang bcu drug ste de dag nyid do //
translated: The minds are also sixteen, those same ones.

original: kun tu 'gro ba dang kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa gcig tu byas nas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba dang kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa gcig tu byas nas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bshad do //
translated: The pervasive and nonpervasive are combined into one and explained as objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa la gcig tu byas nas bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa la gcig tu byas nas bshad do //
translated: Similarly, those abandoned by seeing the origin, those abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, and those abandoned by seeing the truth of the path are combined into one and explained as objects abandoned by seeing the truth of the origin, objects abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, and objects abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gcig tu byas nas bshad do //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gcig tu byas nas bshad do //
translated: Those abandoned by the path of meditation are combined into one and explained as afflicted and unafflicted objects abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: zag pa med pa yang chos dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa gcig tu byas nas bshad do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang chos dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa gcig tu byas nas bshad do //
translated: Also, those that are uncontaminated are combined into one and explained as objects abandoned by the path of seeing that are objects of Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge.

original: re zhig sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Those that are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.🔽Those that are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of origin are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.🔽Those that are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation.🔽Those that are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of the path are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.🔽Those that are objects abandoned by the path of meditation are objects abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽Those that are uncontaminated are uncontaminated.

original: de la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba go rims bzhin du phra rgya sa bcu dang bdun dang / de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / de rnams kyi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa dag dang /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba go rims bzhin du phra rgya sa bcu dang bdun dang / de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / de rnams kyi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa dag dang /
translated: those that arise simultaneously with them, their obtainment and their subsequent attributes,

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang de rnams kyi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang @151b bcas pa dag dang / gzugs gzhan thams cad la yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang de rnams kyi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang @151b bcas pa dag dang / gzugs gzhan thams cad la yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: the four abandoned by the path of meditation and their obtainment and subsequent attributes and all other phenomena that are not afflicted.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas bdun dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / de'i thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa dag dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang de rnams kyi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa dag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas bdun dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / de'i thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa dag dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang de rnams kyi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa dag ste /
translated: Similarly, the seven subtle developers abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, those that arise simultaneously with them, their obtainment and their subsequent attributes and the eight abandoned by seeing the truth of path, those that arise simultaneously with them and their obtainment and subsequent attributes.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: So too, the form and formless realms should be understood in the same way.🔽The three of one's own realm

original: rang gi khams pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /🔽sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi khams pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
translated: are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering🔽and objects abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The three of one's own realm are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, objects abandoned by the path of meditation and objects not to be abandoned.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ma 'ongs pas bsdus pa dang / bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhis bsdus pa mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can nam /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ma 'ongs pas bsdus pa dang / bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhis bsdus pa mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can nam /
translated: The phenomena of the desire realm to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are objects of the desire realm consciousness to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, those concomitant with the pervasive states to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin and those subsumed by future nonvirtuous states to be abandoned by the path of meditation and the aspects of repulsiveness and so on subsumed by the actual basis of absorption.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa zhig gang gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyis sems la lta ba 'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa zhig gang gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyis sems la lta ba 'am /
translated: Or they are objects of the mind of one born in the form realm that views the minds of sentient beings of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa de la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig / gang gi tshe mthong ba'i chos la bde ba gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi khams de nyid la dmigs pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa de la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig / gang gi tshe mthong ba'i chos la bde ba gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi khams de nyid la dmigs pa yang rung ste /
translated: When one born in the desire realm who is free from attachment to the desire realm focuses on the desire realm itself, either for the sake of abiding happily in this life or for the sake of eliminating afflictions,

original: gzugs na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dge ba gcig dang / zag pa med pa ste chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dge ba gcig dang / zag pa med pa ste chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: then one focuses on one virtuous state to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the form realm and one uncontaminated state, which is compatible with Dharma knowledge.

original: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag kyang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag kyang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the focal objects of the truths of origin that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de la sdug bsngal du gtogs pa'i sems can kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs so //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal du gtogs pa'i sems can kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs so //
translated: The mind associated with the pervasive states that belong to the truth of suffering focuses on objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of origin and objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: kun 'byung du gtogs pa kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom @152a * //🔽pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs so //
analyzed: kun 'byung du gtogs pa kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom @152a * // pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs so //

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs so //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs so //
translated: The non-defiled factors belonging to the path of cultivation are the objects of the path of seeing the origin of suffering.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa thams cad ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs so //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa thams cad ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs so //
translated: All the defiled and non-defiled factors belonging to the path of cultivation are the objects of the path of cultivation.

original: gzugs su gtogs pa dang zag pa med pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs su gtogs pa dang zag pa med pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The factors belonging to the form realm and the uncontaminated factors are as above.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal mthong ba la sogs pas spang bar bya ba'i chos 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sems lnga po re re'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal mthong ba la sogs pas spang bar bya ba'i chos 'dod pa na spyod pa ni sems lnga po re re'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the factors belonging to the desire realm that are to be abandoned by seeing suffering and so on are the objects of each of the five types of mind.

original: rang gi khams pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rang gi khams pa gsum ste /
translated: The three of one's own realm.

original: de dag nyid dang zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag go / de nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba yang dag pa'i

translated: Those that are called the same are the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin and those to be abandoned by the path of meditation, in terms of the aspects explained above.

analyzed: lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / bsgom pa las byung zhi ba la sogs pa'i sems yod pa yin no //

analyzed: sngar bshad pa lnga dang zhes bya ba la /

translated: They are antidotes to the nine objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation of the desire realm, the six objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the two pervasive negative tendencies of the truth of suffering and origin that are concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: gzugs na spyod pa dag ni dgu ste /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa dag ni dgu ste /

analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba gnyis dang @153a * //

analyzed: lhag ma dag gis ni gnyi gas kyang ma yin no //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan yang de bzhin du ci rigs par dpyad par bya'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni rang gi ris pa dag dang / kun tu 'gro ba dag gis rgyas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bos phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Nonafflicted states have negative tendencies by the power of the object field and the power of pervasive states.

original: mdor bsdu na thams cad ma spangs pa nyid kyi nyon mongs phra rgyas bcas rnam gnyis yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na thams cad ma spangs pa nyid kyi nyon mongs phra rgyas bcas rnam gnyis yin te /

original: lhan cig pa'i dngos po dang rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dngos pos so //
analyzed: lhan cig pa'i dngos po dang rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dngos pos so //

analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni spangs kyang nam zhig de las dmigs pa ma spangs pa dang spangs pa na ste /

analyzed: ma spangs ba nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyis phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That which is not abandoned is associated with the negative tendencies of the non-defiled negative tendencies.

original: spangs pa ni rgyas par mi 'gyur ba de la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas rnams sngar cig car spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyis sems la rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phra @159a * //

translated: That which is abandoned is associated with the negative tendencies of the defiled mind, because the negative tendencies that focus on it are previously simultaneously abandoned.

original: rgyas rnams kyis phra rgyas dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas rnams kyis phra rgyas dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be associated with the negative tendencies that increase the defiled mind.

original: de la gang rnams kyi yin zhes bya ba mi shes pas de'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang de la dmigs pa'am zhes bya ba smos so //

translated: Since it is not known whose they are, it is said, “associated with that, or focusing on that.”

original: ci thams cad kyi tshe ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad kyi tshe ma yin nam zhe na /

original: smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te /

original: 'o na ci zhe na ma spangs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na ma spangs pa zhes bya ba smos so //

original: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba la phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba la phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin te /

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: ci thams cad kyis de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang de la dmigs pas yin nam zhe na ma yin te /

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: They are associated with that.🔽Are all of them at all times?

original: ci thams cad kyi tshe'am zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci thams cad kyi tshe'am zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.

original: spangs pa rnams kyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: spangs pa rnams kyis zhes smos so //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, “Those not abandoned.”

original: ma spangs pa rnams kyis ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas kyang de phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin no //🔽de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni de dang lhan cig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma spangs pa rnams kyis ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas kyang de phra rgyas dang bcas pa yin no // de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni de dang lhan cig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those not abandoned are also associated with that through the process of nourishing.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of that is explained as follows: because they are simultaneous.

original: gnyen pos ni nam yang sems nyon mongs pa las logs shig tu bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gnyen pos ni nam yang sems nyon mongs pa las logs shig tu bya bar mi nus so //
translated: The antidote never has the ability to separate the mind from the mental factor of affliction.

original: yang phra rgyas bcu po 'di dag ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: yang phra rgyas bcu po 'di dag ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'byung ngo ;
translated: How do these ten proclivities operate?

original: / thams cad thams cad kyi mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir 'di dag skye ba la skye ba thams cad kyi la ni rim pa nges pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: / thams cad thams cad kyi mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir 'di dag skye ba la skye ba thams cad kyi la ni rim pa nges pa med mod kyi /
translated: Although there is no fixed order in the arising of all of them,🔽the order of the ten is taught in terms of the predominance of the arising of each.

original: phal cher skye ba dang mthun pa'i sgo nas srid tshad la rim pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas re zhig dang po kho nar ma rig pa dang ldan pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: phal cher skye ba dang mthun pa'i sgo nas srid tshad la rim pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas re zhig dang po kho nar ma rig pa dang ldan pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: First of all, ignorance arises in one who possesses ignorance.

original: sdug bsngal las phung po bsal nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las phung po bsal nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The aggregates are removed from suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: This is not suffering.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /

original: 'dir bsam pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag las bsal ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag las bsal ba ste /
translated: The thought here is that the aggregates are removed from the aspects of suffering, etc.

original: de'i phyir dgra bo'i rnam par 'dzin pa las mngon par zhen pas de'i spyi'i rnam pa la log par lta ba shes kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgra bo'i rnam par 'dzin pa las mngon par zhen pas de'i spyi'i rnam pa la log par lta ba shes kyi /
translated: Therefore, because of the manifest clinging to the aspects of an enemy, one has a false view of their general aspect.

original: thams cad la skur ba btab pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la skur ba btab pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: But this is not the case for all of them.

original: gzhi med na de'i @159b dgra zla'i rnam pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi med na de'i @159b dgra zla'i rnam pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For if the basis does not exist, then the form of its adversary cannot exist.

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni log par lta ba las 'jig tshogs la lta ba kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni log par lta ba las 'jig tshogs la lta ba kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: The word “it is said” is used because the afflicted view of the self arises only from wrong views.

original: bya ba'i nges pa med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bya ba'i nges pa med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the order of the arising of these views is not fixed.

original: 'di ltar res 'ga' mchog gam gtso bor 'dzin pa las lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang de'i mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽dgra bor gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba yang dgra bo yin mod kyi de las dmigs pa'i zhes sdang ni mthong bas spang bar bya bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar res 'ga' mchog gam gtso bor 'dzin pa las lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang de'i mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i phyir ro // dgra bor gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba yang dgra bo yin mod kyi de las dmigs pa'i zhes sdang ni mthong bas spang bar bya bar mi rung ste /
translated: Sometimes the overesteeming of mere morality and austerities arises immediately after the overesteeming of mere rules and ritual.🔽The word “enemy” is used because right view is an enemy of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not tenable that the view of the self is abandoned by the path of seeing, because it is abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de'i bdag gzugs yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag gzugs yin no //
translated: The self is the form of the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba de ltar lta ba'i dgra bo ni sems pa la sogs bdag tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar lta ba'i dgra bo ni sems pa la sogs bdag tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba yin te /
translated: The enemy of view is the view that conceives the aggregates to be the self.

original: lta ba gzhan dang ldan pa'i lta ba gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba gzhan dang ldan pa'i lta ba gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to other views.

original: de ltar dgra bor gyur pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa dag la sdang ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par rang gi lta ba la ste /

translated: Hatred of the aspects of the view that are enemies is not similar to correct view, because it is governed by afflicted view.

original: gzhan nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should apply the term “other” to one’s own view.🔽Because it is a view that exists in one’s own continuum.

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni kha nang du bltas te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni kha nang du bltas te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment and so on that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are internal since they engage the internal.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de ni sdang bas de ni dmigs she na /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de ni sdang bas de ni dmigs she na /
translated: But that to be abandoned by the path of meditation is external since it engages the external.

original: thob pa de yang kha nang du phyogs pas 'jug pa'i phyir lta ba la dmigs par mi nus so //
analyzed: thob pa de yang kha nang du phyogs pas 'jug pa'i phyir lta ba la dmigs par mi nus so //
translated: But this is not possible, since the possession of the view of self is turned inward.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

analyzed: rang gi lta ba la lhag par zhen pa de ni nges par gzhan gyi lta ba la sdang bar 'gyur te /
translated: One who is attached to his own view is necessarily hostile to the views of others,

original: dper na bdag tu lta ba bdag med par lta ba la sdang ba bzhin no //🔽yang ji ltar nyon mongs pa skye zhe na de skye ba'i rgyu mang po zhig mthong ste /

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i ris mthong ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i ris nges pas nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i ris mthong ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i ris nges pas nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: The arising of the defilements is due to the perception of the similarity of the object, due to the perception of the similarity of the class, due to the perception of the similarity of the action, due to the perception of the similarity of the time, due to the perception of the similarity of the place, due to the perception of the similarity of the person, due to the perception of the similarity of the name, due to the perception of the similarity of the word, due to the perception of the similarity of the letter.🔽For example, the defilements arise through the perception of the similarity of the object: a man has intercourse with a female dog, a female pig, etc.🔽The defilements arise through the perception of the similarity of the class: a man has intercourse with a woman of his own class, the brahmin with a brahmin woman, etc.🔽The defilements arise through the perception of the similarity of the action: a man has intercourse with a woman who is his servant, who is his slave, etc.

original: dper na 'dod chags drag po nyid kyis bya dur pa la sogs pa dang kho na drag po nyid kyis sbrul sogs pa rnams phrad pa las nyon mongs pa snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags drag po nyid kyis bya dur pa la sogs pa dang kho na drag po nyid kyis sbrul sogs pa rnams phrad pa las nyon mongs pa snang ba bzhin no //
translated: The defilements arise through the perception of the similarity of the time: a man has intercourse with a woman at a certain time, in the morning, etc.🔽The defilements arise through the perception of the similarity of the place: a man has intercourse with a woman in a certain place, in a temple, etc.🔽The defilements arise through the perception of the similarity of the person: a man has intercourse with a woman who is like his father, mother, sister, or daughter.🔽The defilements arise through the perception of the similarity of the name: a man has intercourse with a woman whose name is the same as that of his mother, etc.🔽The defilements arise through the perception of the similarity of the word: a man has intercourse with a woman who utters the same words as his mother, etc.🔽The defilements arise through the perception of the similarity of the letter: a man has intercourse with a woman whose name begins with the same letter as his mother, etc.

original: sdug bsngal mang po (byed pa) las zhe sdang shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po (byed pa) las zhe sdang shas che ba yin no //
translated: Anger is the most important in the production of many sufferings.

original: chang 'thung ba la sogs pas kyang nyon mongs pa yongs su snang ba yin te /
analyzed: chang 'thung ba la sogs pas kyang nyon mongs pa yongs su snang ba yin te /
translated: Also, the afflictions are manifested by drinking alcohol and so on.

original: khyad par de dag la rag lus pa nyon mongs kun tu spyod do //
analyzed: khyad par de dag la rag lus pa nyon mongs kun tu spyod do //
translated: The afflictions are engaged through dependence on those specific states.

original: gang dang gang gis nyon mongs pa shin tu bsten pa de dang de yis skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis nyon mongs pa shin tu bsten pa de dang de yis skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is born through those specific states that are the basis of the afflictions.

original: rang gi rten dang mthun pa'i yul rnyed pa las kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi rten dang mthun pa'i yul rnyed pa las kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: The afflictions arise as a cause from obtaining an object that is compatible with one's basis.

original: dus gang yang rung ba kha cig tu nyon mongs dang mthun par 'gyur ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gang yang rung ba kha cig tu nyon mongs dang mthun par 'gyur ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: At some time or other, one becomes compatible with the afflictions.

original: skye ba na gtso bo'i rgyu gsum gyis skye ste /🔽phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba na gtso bo'i rgyu gsum gyis skye ste / phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: When they arise, they arise through three principal causes:🔽The root text states, “The non-abandonment of the negative tendencies, the presence of their objects, and the occurrence of incorrect mental activity.”

original: ma spangs shing zhes bya ba ni de'i thob pa ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma spangs shing zhes bya ba ni de'i thob pa ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “the non-abandonment of the negative tendencies” means that their acquisition has not been severed.🔽The phrase “the presence of their objects” means that the object that is compatible with a particular affliction is present.

original: yongs su ma shes pa yin zhes bya ba ni de'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa yin zhes bya ba ni de'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not completely understood means that the antidote to that has not yet arisen.

original: yang na rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis ma spangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis ma spangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the phrase not abandoned is due to three causes:

original: thob pa ma bcad pa'i phyir dang gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa ma bcad pa'i phyir dang gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the non-severance of the obtainment of the seeds, the non-arising of the antidote, and the non-complete understanding of the objective.

original: spangs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spangs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Abandonment is also of two types:

original: lhag ma dang bcas par spangs pa dang lhag ma med par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas par spangs pa dang lhag ma med par spangs pa'o //
translated: abandonment with a remainder and abandonment without a remainder.

original: de'i phyir ma spangs pa yongs su shes pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma spangs pa yongs su shes pa zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, the complete understanding of what has not been abandoned.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the appearance of entities that are conducive to the fetter of desire realm attachment means

original: 'di dag gis kun nas dkris @160b bas na kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis kun nas dkris @160b bas na kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
translated: that these entities are conducive to the fetter because they are fetters.

original: dper na 'dis myos par byed pas na myos par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dis myos par byed pas na myos par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the term intoxicant is used because it causes intoxication.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ni 'dod pa nyid 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ni 'dod pa nyid 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
translated: That which is compatible with the entanglement of desire realm attachment is compatible with desire realm attachment.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang rjes su mthun zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de dag kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang rjes su mthun zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de dag kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul rnams so //
translated: The meaning is that it is compatible with the entanglement of desire realm attachment. Those are objects such as form and sound.

original: snang bar gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dngos por gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dngos por gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which has become manifest means that it abides as the entity of an object.

original: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni snang bar gyur ba'i yul de la'o //
analyzed: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni snang bar gyur ba'i yul de la'o //
translated: With regard to that, there is incorrect mental attention, which is with regard to that object that has become manifest.

original: yid la byed pa phyin ci log ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa phyin ci log ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Incorrect mental attention is distorted mental attention.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i skyon 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas de ni rgyu'i stobs so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i skyon 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas de ni rgyu'i stobs so //
translated: The fault of the equivalent immediately preceding condition is the negative tendency of desire realm attachment. That is the power of the cause.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni yul gyi stobs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni yul gyi stobs so //
translated: The power of the object is the objects that are in conformity with the fetters of desire realm attachment.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'i stobs so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'i stobs so //
translated: The power of application is improper mental attention.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'dod na ji ltar dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'dod na ji ltar dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that affliction arises due to three causes, how could an arhat retrogress?

original: de la phra rgyas ma spangs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la phra rgyas ma spangs pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because he has no negative tendencies that are not abandoned.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de rgyu tshang ba kho na rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'dod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de rgyu tshang ba kho na rgyu gsum gyis skye bar 'dod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: This fault does not exist because we assert that affliction arises due to three causes only when the causes are complete, not in all cases.

original: res 'ga' yul gyi stobs kyis skye'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' yul gyi stobs kyis skye'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Sometimes it arises due to the power of the object and so on.

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu ma tshang ba'i 'bras bu ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu ma tshang ba'i 'bras bu ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “it is said” is used because it is taught that an effect does not arise when its causes are incomplete.

original: sbyor ba bzhi ste de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / sred pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi ste de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / sred pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The bonds of desire, the bonds of existence, the bonds of views, and the bonds of ignorance.

original: phra rgyas kho na zhes nges par gzung ba ni kun nas dkris pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas kho na zhes nges par gzung ba ni kun nas dkris pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “only the proclivities” is stated in order to exclude the entanglements.

original: ma rig pa logs shig kho na ma rig pa'i zag par bshad pa de'i phyir ma rig pa ma gtogs par zhes bya bar sbyar te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma rig pa logs shig kho na ma rig pa'i zag par bshad pa de'i phyir ma rig pa ma gtogs par zhes bya bar sbyar te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since ignorance is explained as a separate contaminant, the phrase “except for ignorance” is stated.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir de smos she na zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa rmugs pa dang rgod pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir de smos she na zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa rmugs pa dang rgod pa'o //
translated: Why is that mentioned here? The entanglements are lethargy and excited speech.

original: rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ji @161a * //
analyzed: rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ji @161a * //
translated: Because they are not independent.

original: ltar rang dbang can ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ltar rang dbang can ma yin zhe na /
translated: How are they not independent?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are associated with attachment and so on.

original: ji ltar phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / 'gyod pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chag pa rnams ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //🔽kha cig smos pa ni de lta na 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa rnams kyang rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i zag par bsdus par mi rigs so zhe na 'dir rang gi 'jug pa shas che ba mi srid pa'i phyir rang dbang can ma yin pa yin gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i
analyzed: ji ltar phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / 'gyod pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chag pa rnams ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no // kha cig smos pa ni de lta na 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa rnams kyang rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i zag par bsdus par mi rigs so zhe na 'dir rang gi 'jug pa shas che ba mi srid pa'i phyir rang dbang can ma yin pa yin gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i
translated: Jealousy, avarice, regret, anger and sleepiness are not autonomous, because they are concomitant with mere ignorance.🔽If you say that some are mentioned, then it is illogical to include shamelessness, nonembarrassment, lethargy and excitation of the desire realm in the contaminants of the desire realm, because they are not autonomous.

original: phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here they are not autonomous because it is impossible for them to have a strong engagement of their own, but not because they are concomitant with other afflictions.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su 'di dag dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag kyang nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa nyid kyis rang dbang can gyis kun nas dkris pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su 'di dag dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag kyang nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa nyid kyis rang dbang can gyis kun nas dkris pa ste /
translated: In the desire realm, these and shamelessness and absence of abashment are autonomous entanglements because they are not concomitant with other afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not concomitant with other afflictions.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

analyzed: kun nas dkris pa rnams kyang khams kyi sgo nas tha dad pa ma yin pas rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag srid pa'i zag par ma bshad do //
translated: Since the entanglements are not differentiated by realm, agitation and regret are not explained as contaminants of existence.

original: ci ste 'di dag khams kyis tha dad par 'dod na srid pa'i zag pa rnams rdzas lnga bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag khams kyis tha dad par 'dod na srid pa'i zag pa rnams rdzas lnga bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur la /
translated: If it is asserted that they are differentiated by realm, then the contaminants of existence would be thirty six substances.

original: de lta na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung dang mthun par 'gyur ro zer ro //
analyzed: de lta na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung dang mthun par 'gyur ro zer ro //
translated: In that case, it would accord with the treatise topic divisions.

original: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Both means

analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dag ste /
translated: those belonging to the form and formless realms that are neutral.

original: gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that all higher realms are neutral.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṅghabhadra says:

analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang reg bya'i yul la 'jug pa'i phyir te kha cig ni kha phyir bltas pas 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Because they engage objects of form, sound, and tactility, some engage external objects.

original: de'i phyir ches gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ches gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: Therefore they are clearer.

original: gang dag rgyu gsum gyis brjod par bya ba gnyen po gcig ste /
analyzed: gang dag rgyu gsum gyis brjod par bya ba gnyen po gcig ste /
translated: Those to be abandoned by the path of meditation have different antidotes,

translated: and they are unclear.🔽Because they are abandoned by the path of meditation, they are the three causes for engaging internal objects. Therefore they are the three causes for engaging internal objects.🔽Because they engage internal objects,🔽they are said to be the contaminants of existence.🔽Because they face inward,

analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams gnyen po tha dad pas de'i phyir phal cher kha nang du bltas te 'jug pa nyid kyi rgyu gsum pa logs te de nyid kyis srid pa'i zag pa zhes so //

original: thar pa'i 'du shes bzlog phyir bshad //
analyzed: thar pa'i 'du shes bzlog phyir bshad //
translated: they are said to be the contaminants of existence.

original: ces @161b gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i phra rgyas rnams srid pa'i 'dod chags bzhin du gcig tu byas nas srid pa'i zag pa zhes bshad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ces @161b gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i phra rgyas rnams srid pa'i 'dod chags bzhin du gcig tu byas nas srid pa'i zag pa zhes bshad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus the proclivities belonging to the realms of form and the formless are considered as one, like the attachment to existence, and are called the impure influence of existence.

original: rdzas bco lnga zhes bya ba ni khams gsum po re re yang ma rig pa lnga lnga yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas bco lnga zhes bya ba ni khams gsum po re re yang ma rig pa lnga lnga yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Fifteen real entities: because there are five ignorances in each of the three realms.

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i zag pa la sogs pa dag dang 'khor ba'i ste /

analyzed: mdo las kun du chags par byed pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa'o zhes rgyas par gsungs la /
translated: The sutra states: The cause of complete attachment is ignorance.🔽And again:

original: slar yang 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol na //
analyzed: slar yang 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol na //
translated: In this world and the next,

original: 'dod dang chags pas bslad pa yi //
analyzed: 'dod dang chags pas bslad pa yi //
translated: corrupted by desire and attachment,

original: ngan 'gro gang dag ci yod pa //
analyzed: ngan 'gro gang dag ci yod pa //
translated: whatever bad destinies there are,

analyzed: thams cad ma rig rtsa ba can // zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: yongs su bgrang ba'i sgo nas ni nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad ces bshad do //
translated: From the point of view of enumeration, there are one hundred and eight afflictions.

analyzed: 'jog pa'i rjes su ni mthun lo zhes bya ba ni gnas ba'i rjes su mi mthun zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase after the placement means after the abiding.

analyzed: lta ba rnams 'ba' zhig g-yo ba'i phyir dang gsal ba'i phyir 'jog pa'i rjes su mi mthun gyi /
translated: Because only the views are mobile and manifest, they are not in accord with the placement.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig pa rnams ni zag pa'i don 'dzin par byed pas 'dod pas dang srid pa'i zag pa'i nang du bkod do //
translated: The others, which are concomitant with the afflictions, are included in the contaminants of desire and existence because they grasp the meaning of defilement.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: sdud pa ni nyon mongs pa gzung ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: sdud pa ni nyon mongs pa gzung ba'i don du ste /
translated: The term accumulation has the meaning of grasping the afflictions.

original: chu bo dang sbyor ba dang nye bar len pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chu bo dang sbyor ba dang nye bar len pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the meaning of a flood, a bond, or a grasping.

original: ji ltar yang 'dir don gzhan nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nus pa kho na gcig pu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'dir don gzhan nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nus pa kho na gcig pu ste /
translated: In any case, here the power of the afflictions is the only meaning.

original: lta ba gzhan ni gsal ba nyid dang sdud pa dang sbyor ba dang 'dzin par nus pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lta ba gzhan ni gsal ba nyid dang sdud pa dang sbyor ba dang 'dzin par nus pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The other views are only manifest, accumulative, binding, and grasping.

analyzed: nye bar 'dzin pas na nye bar len pa ste /

analyzed: de dang der lus 'dzin pas na nye bar len pa dag go //
translated: They are appropriators because they appropriate the body in this and that place.

original: 'di skad du ches shin tu legs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du ches shin tu legs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is said to be very good.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i zag pa'i 'dod pa 'di ches legs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i zag pa'i 'dod pa 'di ches legs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This assertion of the Vaibhāṣikas is very good.

original: lung ston pa'i tshul la khrid pas zag pa zhes 'thob po //
analyzed: lung ston pa'i tshul la khrid pas zag pa zhes 'thob po //
translated: They are called contaminants because they lead to the mode of prophecy.🔽Therefore, this digression is stated to show that all of these are faultless.🔽They are called appropriators because they appropriate.

original: des na zhar las 'byung ba 'dis thams cad la skyon med pa nyid du tshig rnam par sbyar ba gsungs so //
analyzed: des na zhar las 'byung ba 'dis thams cad la skyon med pa nyid du tshig rnam par sbyar ba gsungs so //
translated: They are appropriators because they appropriate the body in this and that place.🔽This is said to be very good.🔽This assertion of the Vaibhāṣikas is very good.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: They are called contaminants because they lead to the mode of prophecy.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis mngon par 'du byed pa chen pos sems kyi rgyud kyi gru zlog phyogs su dkris shing yul dag las bzlog pa dang / de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyi chus rgyun phyogs su rang gi ngang gis 'khyer bar byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis mngon par 'du byed pa chen pos sems kyi rgyud kyi gru zlog phyogs su dkris shing yul dag las bzlog pa dang / de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyi chus rgyun phyogs su rang gi ngang gis 'khyer bar byed do //
translated: The mind-stream is turned around and wrapped up in the opposite direction from the objects by the great formative influence of virtuous things, and in the same way, it is carried along by the current of the water of the defilements in the natural direction.

original: de dag gis de dag dang ldan pa khyer bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gis de dag dang ldan pa khyer bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are carried along by them.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are carried along?

original: de'i phyir de'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Hence he says: because they follow after them.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs dang sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs pa dag dang sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs dang sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs pa dag dang sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because they are joined to various kinds of suffering means: because they are joined to various kinds of suffering such as birth.

original: yang na yang dang yang du rjes su 'brel pa'i sgo nas so zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dag go zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: yang na yang dang yang du rjes su 'brel pa'i sgo nas so zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dag go zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyor ro //
translated: Or else, because they are repeatedly connected means: because they are repeatedly connected with the formative forces.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na chu bo ni res 'ga' yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na chu bo ni res 'ga' yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that a river is sometimes and

original: sbyor ba ni thams cad kyi tshe yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni thams cad kyi tshe yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: a preparation is always.🔽They are called appropriators because they appropriate desire realm objects and so on.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phyir nye bar len pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba gang gis 'dod pa dag nye bar len pa de ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa ste 'dod pa dag la 'dun pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phyir nye bar len pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba gang gis 'dod pa dag nye bar len pa de ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa ste 'dod pa dag la 'dun pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One who appropriates desire realm objects is one who desires desire realm objects.

original: de bzhin du lta pa dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang bdag tu smra ba nye bar len par yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lta pa dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang bdag tu smra ba nye bar len par yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: So too, one who appropriates view, one who appropriates ethics and vows, and one who appropriates self declaration should be understood in the appropriate manner.

original: de la kun tu sbyor ba ni dgu ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la kun tu sbyor ba ni dgu ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The nine fetters are:

original: yul rnams dang skye bo dag la kun tu sbyor bar byed pas na kun tu sbyor ba rnams te /
analyzed: yul rnams dang skye bo dag la kun tu sbyor bar byed pas na kun tu sbyor ba rnams te /
translated: Fetters are so called because they bind one to objects and beings.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As the sutras state:

original: mig gis ni gzugs dag la kun tu sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gis ni gzugs dag la kun tu sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The eyes do not bind one to form.

original: 'on kyang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa 'di 'dir kun tu sbyor ba yin no zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa 'di 'dir kun tu sbyor ba yin no zhes gsungs la /
translated: But the desire and attachment that are intention are fetters here.

original: slar yang byis @164a * //
analyzed: slar yang byis @164a * //
translated: Again, the Sūtra on the Jewel at the Crown of the Head declares:

original: pa so so skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni bcings bzhin du skye /
analyzed: pa so so skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni bcings bzhin du skye /
translated: Childlike ordinary beings, lacking learning, are born fettered,

original: bcings bzhin du 'chi /
analyzed: bcings bzhin du 'chi /
translated: die fettered,

original: bcings bzhin du 'jig rten 'di nas pha rol du 'pho'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcings bzhin du 'jig rten 'di nas pha rol du 'pho'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: and pass from this world to the next fettered.

original: yang na 'di rnams yod na sdug bsngal gyi khyad par du ma dang kun tu sbyor bas na kun tu sbyor ba rnams te /
analyzed: yang na 'di rnams yod na sdug bsngal gyi khyad par du ma dang kun tu sbyor bas na kun tu sbyor ba rnams te /
translated: Or, they are fetters because many kinds of suffering and the afflictions are connected to them.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the basis of all the afflictions.

original: de la rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: de la rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: The fetter of attachment is the desire and attachment of the three realms.

original: rten dang dmigs pa'i sgo nas kyang 'dod chags pa yin te /
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa'i sgo nas kyang 'dod chags pa yin te /
translated: It is desire and attachment in terms of both the basis and the object.

original: yang yul yid du 'ong bar gyur pa la mngon par dga' ba'i 'du byed dang / sems pas dngos po 'tshog chas dang bcas pa dag la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang yul yid du 'ong bar gyur pa la mngon par dga' ba'i 'du byed dang / sems pas dngos po 'tshog chas dang bcas pa dag la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the formation of delight in a pleasant object, and the intention that is attached to things and possessions.

original: de ci'i phyir rjes su chags pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir rjes su chags pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called attachment?

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang rjes su mthun pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang rjes su mthun pas so //
translated: Because it is in conformity with an afflicted mind.

original: mi mthun pa'i 'du shes can de dang bral bar 'dod pa yongs su gyur pa'i sems phyir phyogs pa ni khong khro'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i 'du shes can de dang bral bar 'dod pa yongs su gyur pa'i sems phyir phyogs pa ni khong khro'o //
translated: Aversion is the turning away of the mind that has become the desire to be separated from that which is not agreeable.

original: nga rgyal bshad pa las nga rgyal rnam pa bdun zhes bya ba der ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal bshad pa las nga rgyal rnam pa bdun zhes bya ba der ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa ste /
translated: Seven types of pride are explained in the Abhidharma.

original: rten gyi sgo nas yin gyi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi sgo nas yin gyi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin no //
translated: They are based on the realms, not on the objects.

original: zag pa med pa khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir dang / ma rig pa yang de la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir dang / ma rig pa yang de la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes so //
translated: Because the uncontaminated is not included in the realms, and because ignorance focuses on that.

original: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa rgyas par bshad do //
translated: The teaching on dependent origination has been explained in detail.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba log par nges par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na de rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba log par nges par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na de rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: The fetter of clinging to views, which has the characteristic of false determination, is the afflicted view of the self, etc. What is its specific characteristic? It has already been explained in detail.

original: lta ba lnga ste /
analyzed: lta ba lnga ste /
translated: There are five views:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba zhes bya ba de la 'du byed rnams bdag tu khas blangs nas rtag pa dang chad par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o zhes mthar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba zhes bya ba de la 'du byed rnams bdag tu khas blangs nas rtag pa dang chad par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o zhes mthar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The afflicted view of the self and the view of holding to an extreme. The view of holding to an extreme is the view of permanence or annihilation that arises from the belief in a self of conditioned states. The characteristic of holding to an extreme has already been explained.

original: 'dir chad par lta ba zhes bya ba de ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir chad par lta ba zhes bya ba de ci zhe na /
translated: What is the view of annihilation?

original: 'du byed rnams phan tshun mi 'jug go zhes mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams phan tshun mi 'jug go zhes mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: It is the belief that conditioned states do not continue in a series.

original: 'o na 'di log par lta ba nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di log par lta ba nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn’t this the wrong view?

original: yang srid med na 'di yod @164b par brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: yang srid med na 'di yod @164b par brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: If there is no future existence, this is what should be said to exist.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin dang khyad par dang rnam pa mtshungs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin dang khyad par dang rnam pa mtshungs pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the similarity of its intrinsic nature, its distinction, and its aspect?

original: sred pa dang byams pa dag sbyor ba 'dra ste /
analyzed: sred pa dang byams pa dag sbyor ba 'dra ste /
translated: Craving and love are similar in their application.

original: dper na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i sbyor ba ni sred pas kun nas bslang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i sbyor ba ni sred pas kun nas bslang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, the application of benefiting others with a defiled mind is called “arisen from craving.”

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis ni byams pas kun nas bslang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis ni byams pas kun nas bslang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: With a non-defiled mind, it is called “arisen from love.”

original: rang bzhin dang khyad par dang rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis log pa'i thabs kyis 'du byed rnams mi 'jug par lta ba dang med par lta ba 'di ni khyad par ro zhes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang khyad par dang rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis log pa'i thabs kyis 'du byed rnams mi 'jug par lta ba dang med par lta ba 'di ni khyad par ro zhes so //
translated: The similarity of intrinsic nature, distinction, and aspect is that these two views, wrong view and view of annihilation, do not engage in conditioning due to wrong means. This is the distinction.

original: dngos po 'tshog chas dang bcas pa dag la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'tshog chas dang bcas pa dag la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is attachment to things and possessions.

original: ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The phrase “as appropriate” means that the fetters of anger, jealousy, and miserliness pertain to the realm of desire.

original: rjes su chags pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyis kun tu sbyor ba dag ni khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyis kun tu sbyor ba dag ni khams gsum pa'o //
translated: The fetters of attachment, pride, ignorance, views, clinging, and doubt pertain to the three realms.

original: rgyu ci zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir lta ba'i phra rgyas dang lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba yang zhes so smras pa yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dri ba'i lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ci zhe na / gang gi phyir lta ba'i phra rgyas dang lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba yang zhes so smras pa yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dri ba'i lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: What is the reason?🔽The root text states, “Because the proclivity of view and the fetter of view are not abandoned by the path of seeing.”

original: kun 'byung shes pa skyes la zhes bya ba 'dis ni lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba kun tu 'gro ba spangs par ston to //
analyzed: kun 'byung shes pa skyes la zhes bya ba 'dis ni lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba kun tu 'gro ba spangs par ston to //
translated: The phrase “when the knowledge of origination has arisen” indicates that the universal fetter of view is abandoned.

original: 'gog pa shes pa ma skyes pa'i tshe zhes bya ba 'dis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma spangs par bstan to //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ma skyes pa'i tshe zhes bya ba 'dis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma spangs par bstan to //
translated: This passage indicates that when the cognition of cessation has not yet arisen, the fetters of holding to be paramount and of adherence to rules and ritual are not abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.

original: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The fetters that are abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path are explained in detail.

original: de dag dang ni rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rang gi ris pa de las dmigs pas ldan gyi /🔽de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag dang ni rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rang gi ris pa de las dmigs pas ldan gyi / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One possesses those fetters and the fetter of adherence to rules and ritual that are specific to one’s class through their focal object,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not through their possession because they are not concomitant.🔽They are not concomitant because they are not concomitant with the view of annihilation.

original: kun tu 'gro ba ni spangs pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang par bya ba'i lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba kho na kun tu 'gro ba yin la de ni spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba ni spangs pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang par bya ba'i lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba kho na kun tu 'gro ba yin la de ni spangs pa yin no //
translated: Because the pervasive is abandoned means that only the fetter of view that is to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin is pervasive and that is abandoned.

original: 'o na de'i lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa ma spangs te nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa ma spangs te nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then one would definitely not abandon the pervasive fetter of the afflicted view of the self, since it is not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de'i phyir @165a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @165a * //
translated: Therefore, the root text states,

original: kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The nonpervasive is abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: der lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa ni log par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: der lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa ni log par lta ba yin no //
translated: The nonpervasive fetter of the afflicted view of the self is wrong view.

original: de ni 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: It focuses on cessation and the path,

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la ni ma yin la lta ba gnyis la mtshungs par ldan pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa dag la dmigs pa tha dad pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la ni ma yin la lta ba gnyis la mtshungs par ldan pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa dag la dmigs pa tha dad pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: but not on feeling that is concomitant with the clinging to rules and ritual as supreme. Nor does it focus on the two afflicted views that are concomitant with the clinging to rules and ritual as supreme.

original: rdzas dang mchog 'dzin 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽yang rdzas 'dra bas don ci zhig rnyed ce na /
analyzed: rdzas dang mchog 'dzin 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / yang rdzas 'dra bas don ci zhig rnyed ce na /
translated: The root text states, “Because they are similar to the clinging to substances and the clinging to what is supreme.”🔽What is the point of saying that they are similar to substances?

original: kun tu sbyor ba'i don nyid do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba'i don nyid do zhes smra'o //
translated: They are similar to the meaning of fetters.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dag re re kun tu sbyor ba'i don 'dzin pa de bzhin du lta ba dag gsum du gyur nas don de 'dzin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dag re re kun tu sbyor ba'i don 'dzin pa de bzhin du lta ba dag gsum du gyur nas don de 'dzin no //
translated: Just as attachment and so on individually grasp the meaning of fetters, so too the three views grasp that meaning.

original: de lta ma yin na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i kun tu sbyor ba yang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i kun tu sbyor ba yang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the Sūtra would have taught the fetters of the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: lta ba gsum gyi nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du lta ba gnyis kyi nus pa yang 'dra ba las yin par lta'o //
analyzed: lta ba gsum gyi nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du lta ba gnyis kyi nus pa yang 'dra ba las yin par lta'o //
translated: The two views are considered to have the same power as the three views.

original: de'i phyir de dag logs su kun tu sbyor ba nyid du ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag logs su kun tu sbyor ba nyid du ni ma bstan to //
translated: Therefore they are not separately taught as fetters.

original: de lta na 'o na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa lhan cig bya ba la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba de bzhin kho nar rdzas mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa lhan cig bya ba la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba de bzhin kho nar rdzas mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the afflicted view of the self and the overesteeming of mere rules and ritual as supreme function together, and wrong view and the overesteeming of mere rules and ritual as supreme are the same substance.

original: rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: ji ltar bkod pa nyid kyi rigs pa dang nges pas mchog tu 'dzin par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bkod pa nyid kyi rigs pa dang nges pas mchog tu 'dzin par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the same substance because they are similar in overesteeming that which is not supreme, as the Abhidharmakośa declares, Wrong view and the overesteeming of mere rules and ritual as supreme are the same substance.

original: gzhan dag na re rtags dang rdzas 'dra ba la bltos nas yin no zhe'o //🔽gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la gzung ba ni lta ba gsum mo //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rtags dang rdzas 'dra ba la bltos nas yin no zhe'o // gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la gzung ba ni lta ba gsum mo //
translated: According to another opinion, the two views are distinct factors because they are related to two different things, namely, the characteristics and the substance.🔽Because of the difference between the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: 'dzin pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis so //
translated: The three views are the apprehended object; the two attachments are the apprehending subject.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gcig gis ni lta ba gang gis bdag go snyam pa dang / gang gis med do snyam du sems pa de mchog tu 'dzin la /
analyzed: gcig gis ni lta ba gang gis bdag go snyam pa dang / gang gis med do snyam du sems pa de mchog tu 'dzin la /
translated: One of the two views, namely, the view of self and the view of holding to an extreme, is the attachment to the idea of a self and the attachment to the idea of non-existence.

original: gzhan gyis ni dag par 'dzin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni dag par 'dzin te /
translated: The other view, namely, the esteeming of views, is the attachment to purity.

original: de'i phyir ma 'chol bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin no //🔽gzhan dag na re srid pa'i longs spyod la lhag par zhen pa rnams lta ba'i kun tu sbyor bar lhag par 'ching la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'chol bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin no // gzhan dag na re srid pa'i longs spyod la lhag par zhen pa rnams lta ba'i kun tu sbyor bar lhag par 'ching la /
translated: Thus, in order to avoid confusion, the two attachments are distinguished from the three views.🔽According to another opinion, the two attachments are distinguished from the three views because the views bind one to the enjoyment of existence, and the attachments bind one to the idea of purity.

original: mya ngan las 'das pas dag par 'dod pa rnams mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor @165b bas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pas dag par 'dod pa rnams mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor @165b bas so zhes zer ro //
translated: The first two views are the view of self and the view of holding to an extreme.

original: the tshom gyis kun tu sbyor ba ni bden pa rnams la the tshom dang yid gnyis za ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: the tshom gyis kun tu sbyor ba ni bden pa rnams la the tshom dang yid gnyis za ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: Doubt as a fetter is the wisdom that is doubt and uncertainty about the truths.

original: the tshom la bi ma ti zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de las rdzas gzhan du bstan pa'i don te rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: the tshom la bi ma ti zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de las rdzas gzhan du bstan pa'i don te rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: The term “doubt” (vicikitsā) is taught as a different substance from the other afflictions, like consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar bsgyur ba'i khyad par las rkyen gzhan du blta ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar bsgyur ba'i khyad par las rkyen gzhan du blta ste /
translated: Therefore, it is viewed as a separate condition from the modifying prefixes,

original: kun tu dang ba dang rab tu dang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: kun tu dang ba dang rab tu dang ba bzhin no //
translated: like “clarity” and “complete clarity.”
