original: sdug bsngal nvi dman nvi dam sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nvi dman nvi dam sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the phrase “suffering, doubt, and inferior doubt,”

original: yang dag par nges pa bzhin 'byung ba dang log par nges pa bzhis sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa tha dad pa rnams las gzhan du the tshom dang som nyir brjod do //
analyzed: yang dag par nges pa bzhin 'byung ba dang log par nges pa bzhis sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa tha dad pa rnams las gzhan du the tshom dang som nyir brjod do //
translated: doubt is described as uncertainty and indecision about the different truths of suffering and so on, due to four factors: (1) doubt that arises from the correct ascertainment of the truths, (2) doubt that arises from the incorrect ascertainment of the truths, (3) doubt that arises from the ascertainment of the truths that is neither correct nor incorrect, and (4) doubt that arises from the nonascertainment of the truths.

original: the tshom ma yin zhes bya ba ni de yang lta ba dang bden pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: the tshom ma yin zhes bya ba ni de yang lta ba dang bden pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: “ Doubt” is not a view, but it is a fetter in relation to the truths.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig de rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig de rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “that which is in relation to those.🔽”

original: phrag dog ni sems rtsub pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phrag dog ni sems rtsub pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Jealousy is a harshness of mind.

original: phrag dog ni gzhan las mngon par mtho bar 'dzin pas de'i phyir gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzad pa sngon du 'gro bas sems kun tu gdud ba dang rtsub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phrag dog ni gzhan las mngon par mtho bar 'dzin pas de'i phyir gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzad pa sngon du 'gro bas sems kun tu gdud ba dang rtsub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Jealousy is a harshness of mind, because it is a mental state that is preceded by an intolerance of another’s excellence and is accompanied by a desire to disparage that excellence.🔽It is related to the mental factor of dissatisfaction, because it is a natural outcome of aversion and because it is a mental factor that is directed toward the superior quality of another.

original: de nyid ni khong khro'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir dang gzhan la gnod par zhugs pa'i phyir dang yid mi bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams nyid na dmigs shing mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas🔽kyang ldan no //
analyzed: de nyid ni khong khro'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir dang gzhan la gnod par zhugs pa'i phyir dang yid mi bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams nyid na dmigs shing mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang ldan no //
translated: It is found in the desire realm, with the exception of the northern region of Kuru, because it is observed and experienced there.

original: ser sna ni sems kyi kun tu 'dzin pa ste dngos po la mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: ser sna ni sems kyi kun tu 'dzin pa ste dngos po la mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Avarice is a mental state of grasping that is preceded by an attachment to one’s possessions and that is accompanied by a desire not to be separated from them.

original: 'di yang chags pa'i dri ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yo byad lhag par gnas pas zhugs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams nyid na yod do //
analyzed: 'di yang chags pa'i dri ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yo byad lhag par gnas pas zhugs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams nyid na yod do //
translated: Since this is also a stain of attachment and since it is the cause of the retention of property, it exists only in the realm of desire.

original: kun nas dkris pa gzhan ni de lta bu'i rigs can yod ma yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //🔽ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa gnyis ni gcig tu mi dge ba yin mod kyi rang dbang can ni ma yin pas 'gyod pa ni rang dbang can yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa gzhan ni de lta bu'i rigs can yod ma yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo // ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa gnyis ni gcig tu mi dge ba yin mod kyi rang dbang can ni ma yin pas 'gyod pa ni rang dbang can yin mod kyi /
translated: There is no other fetter that is like this.

original: gcig tu mi dge ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu mi dge ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Shamelessness and lack of conscience are nonvirtuous alone, but they are not independent. Regret is independent, but it is not nonvirtuous alone,

original: de ni dge ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dge ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is also virtuous.

original: gzhan dag ni gnyi ga yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gnyi ga yang ma yin no //
translated: The others are neither.

original: kun nas dkris pa bcu po de las gzhan pa ni rgyu nyid du smra ste /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa bcu po de las gzhan pa ni rgyu nyid du smra ste /
translated: The ten fetters are causes, because they are sharp,

original: shin tu rno ba dang / yang yang kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir @166a * //
analyzed: shin tu rno ba dang / yang yang kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir @166a * //
translated: because they arise repeatedly,

original: dang ; dbang chung bar grags pa dang / longs spyod chung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ; dbang chung bar grags pa dang / longs spyod chung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are known to be weak, and because they are the cause of little enjoyment.

original: thams cad mtshon pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis pos kun tu gdung ba dang lhan cig pas thams cad bzhir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mtshon pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis pos kun tu gdung ba dang lhan cig pas thams cad bzhir bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the cause of all weapons, it is taught as all, since it is associated with the two types of passions that torment all.

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs dag la so sor longs spyod dang chos kyi gnas dag la nyon mongs par byed do //🔽lha dang lha ma yin gyi phyogs dag la /
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs dag la so sor longs spyod dang chos kyi gnas dag la nyon mongs par byed do // lha dang lha ma yin gyi phyogs dag la /
translated: It torments the householder and renunciate in their respective enjoyments and in their abodes of Dharma.🔽It torments the gods and asuras in their respective factions.

original: shi shno da ra'i rgyu'i phyir te de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: shi shno da ra'i rgyu'i phyir te de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is the cause of the war between the gods and asuras.

original: lha dang mi rnams ni phrag dog dang ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba can yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams ni phrag dog dang ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba can yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said that gods and humans are bound by envy and avarice.

original: de ltar phrag dog dang ser sna dag ni kun tu sbyor ba logs shig pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phrag dog dang ser sna dag ni kun tu sbyor ba logs shig pa yin no //
translated: Thus envy and avarice are separate fetters.

original: tha ma'i cha ni 'dod pa'i khams yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha ma'i cha ni 'dod pa'i khams yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The desire realm is the lowest part.

original: khams gsum gyi dbang du byas nas cha yin la tha ma ni tha chad yin te /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi dbang du byas nas cha yin la tha ma ni tha chad yin te /
translated: The desire realm is the lowest part in terms of the three realms, since it is the worst.

original: gcig tu mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir dang / mi dge ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa sdug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir dang / mi dge ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa sdug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not rest evenly in one-pointed concentration, because they possess nonvirtuous qualities, because they go to miserable realms, and because they are afflicted by afflictions.

original: gnyis kyi 'dod pa las mi 'da' la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis kyi 'dod pa las mi 'da' la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The two do not transcend the desire realm.

original: de dag ma spangs na 'dod pa'i khams las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ma spangs na 'dod pa'i khams las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if they are not abandoned, one does not transcend the desire realm.

original: gsum po yis ni phyir zlog byed //🔽ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams gtugs te /
analyzed: gsum po yis ni phyir zlog byed // ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams gtugs te /
translated: The three cause one to turn back.

original: ma spangs na slar 'dod pa'i khams su bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma spangs na slar 'dod pa'i khams su bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: The three views of the transitory collection and so on cause one to turn back to the desire realm if they are not abandoned.

original: 'di dag ni tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: These are factors associated with inferior states.

original: sgo ba dang rjes su 'brang ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgo ba dang rjes su 'brang ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are similar to a gatekeeper and a follower.

original: sgo bas ni nye ba can 'byung ba las zlog par byed la /
analyzed: sgo bas ni nye ba can 'byung ba las zlog par byed la /
translated: A gatekeeper prevents those who are not permitted from entering and a follower does not go beyond where the gatekeeper goes.

original: dbyug pa dang / zhags pa can nam sgo ba'i rjes su 'brang ba gzhan gyis ni de dag med par 'gyur bas nyes can byung zhing thag ring por phyir zlog par byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: dbyug pa dang / zhags pa can nam sgo ba'i rjes su 'brang ba gzhan gyis ni de dag med par 'gyur bas nyes can byung zhing thag ring por phyir zlog par byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: The other gatekeepers, who are armed with clubs and lassos, expel the offenders far away, without allowing them to return.

original: gsum gyis ni sems can gyi tha ma zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byang ngo //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni sems can gyi tha ma zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byang ngo //
translated: The last three are called the worst of sentient beings.

original: tha ma'i cha ni gnyis te /
analyzed: tha ma'i cha ni gnyis te /
translated: The worst part is twofold:

original: khams las ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams las ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: the worst realm is the desire realm;

original: sems can rnams las ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams las ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: the worst sentient beings are ordinary beings.

original: de la 'phags pa'i chos thob kyang khams tha ma las mi 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems kyis @166b kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i chos thob kyang khams tha ma las mi 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems kyis @166b kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they have obtained the ārya Dharmas, they do not transcend the worst realm because they are bound by the fetters of sensual desire and malice.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral yang so so skye bo nyid las mi 'da' zhing phyir la 'dod pa'i khams dang sems can gyi tha ma la brten pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral yang so so skye bo nyid las mi 'da' zhing phyir la 'dod pa'i khams dang sems can gyi tha ma la brten pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: They possess the fetters of the afflicted view of the self, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme and

original: the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: doubt.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga nyid de /
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga nyid de /
translated: They possess the five that are compatible with inferior states.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom rnams kyang ngo //
translated: They possess the afflicted view of the self, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme and doubt.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dag bor nas zhes 'di ci ste ma brtsad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dag bor nas zhes 'di ci ste ma brtsad ce na /
translated: Why is it that they are not investigated after abandoning attachment and so on?

original: yongs su gtugs te zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: yongs su gtugs te zhes gsungs la /
translated: They are thoroughly investigated.

original: yongs su gtugs pa yang ma lus par zad pa yin na /
analyzed: yongs su gtugs pa yang ma lus par zad pa yin na /
translated: If thoroughly investigated means completely exhausted,

original: de'i 'dod chags la sogs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni zad pa yang ma yin pas ma brtsad do //
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags la sogs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni zad pa yang ma yin pas ma brtsad do //
translated: The desire realm and so on that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation are not exhausted, so they are not discussed.

original: de dag thams cad brjod par bya ba ni yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni lta ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad brjod par bya ba ni yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni lta ba gsum mo //
translated: All of these are indeed to be expressed, but

original: nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: afflictions are of three types.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to those to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rnam pa gcig dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One type

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / de dag la dmigs pa the tshom dang / de dag la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / de dag la dmigs pa the tshom dang / de dag la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go //
translated: is the afflicted view of the self and extreme view, doubt that focuses on them, and desire realm and so on that focuses on them.

original: de dag gi sgo ni 'di gsum gyis bsdus so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi sgo ni 'di gsum gyis bsdus so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These are subsumed by these three doors.

original: rnam pa gcig gi sgo ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gi sgo ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas bsdus so //
translated: One type is subsumed by the afflicted view of the self.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
translated: Two types are subsumed by holding ethics and rituals to be paramount.

original: rnam pa bzhi'i ni the tshom gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'i ni the tshom gyis so //
translated: Four types are subsumed by doubt.

original: de'i de dag spang bar gsungs pas de'i rnam pa can lhag ma rnams kyang spangs par gsungs par rigs par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i de dag spang bar gsungs pas de'i rnam pa can lhag ma rnams kyang spangs par gsungs par rigs par bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to conclude that the remaining afflicted views that have the same aspect also are abandoned.

original: phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because only a portion of the afflicted views is taught.

original: gzhan yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, extreme view is induced by the afflicted view of the self,

original: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po la rtag pa dang chad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po la rtag pa dang chad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one grasps the entity that is the object of the afflicted view of the self as permanent or annihilated.

original: de'i phyir de yang spangs par gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang spangs par gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that extreme view also is abandoned,

original: rtag pa dang chad par rtag pa'i gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan la yang de @167a * //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad par rtag pa'i gzhi med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan la yang de @167a * //
translated: because there is no basis for grasping permanence or annihilation.

original: dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta bas ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta bas ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: With regard to the statement, “The afflicted view of the self is induced by the view of the perishing aggregates,”

original: der de'i bdag por 'gyur ro zhes thar pa la skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der de'i bdag por 'gyur ro zhes thar pa la skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: one becomes frightened of liberation, thinking, “I will become nonexistent.”

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'du byed rtag par lta bas thar pa la 'dod pa mi skye zhing /
analyzed: 'du byed rtag par lta bas thar pa la 'dod pa mi skye zhing /
translated: One who views formations as permanent does not generate the desire for liberation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam mthong bas kyang lam 'khrul par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam mthong bas kyang lam 'khrul par 'gyur la /
translated: And one who views the mundane path as the path to liberation would be confused about the path.

original: lam med do zhes bya ba de ltar mthong bas kyang de nyid kyi lam ni sgrub po //
analyzed: lam med do zhes bya ba de ltar mthong bas kyang de nyid kyi lam ni sgrub po //
translated: And one who views the path as nonexistent would not practice that very path.

original: de'i phyir rtsa ba bsdus pas gsum kho na gsungs so zhes rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsa ba bsdus pas gsum kho na gsungs so zhes rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that only three are stated by including the roots.🔽The five that are compatible with higher states

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid ces bya ba la gong ma'i cha ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid ces bya ba la gong ma'i cha ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams te /
translated: The higher realms are the form and formless realms.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called compatible with higher states because they are the cause of higher states.

original: ji ltar 'di dag de dang mthun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag de dang mthun pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they compatible with higher states?

original: de'i phyir de dag ma spangs par khams gong ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ma spangs par khams gong ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, because one does not transcend the higher realms without abandoning them.

original: 'di dag rdzas kyi sgo nas brgyad yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag rdzas kyi sgo nas brgyad yin te /
translated: They are eight in terms of substance.

original: rgod pa dang nga rgyal dang gti mug rnams gzugs dang gzugs med pa so so'i dbye bas gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgod pa dang nga rgyal dang gti mug rnams gzugs dang gzugs med pa so so'i dbye bas gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Excitement, pride, and delusion are twofold, because they are divided into the form and formless realms.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams nyid gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams nyid gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
translated: Those that are to be abandoned by cultivation are the factors associated with higher states.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so //
translated: Therefore, they are called factors associated with higher states.

original: ma spangs pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba de kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma spangs pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba de kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not abandoned because the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are in operation.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa nye bar bsags pa rnams ni tha ma rim dang mthun pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa nye bar bsags pa rnams ni tha ma rim dang mthun pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are accumulated in the final stage, in accordance with the order of the stages.

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun par gsungs pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dbang du byas par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun par gsungs pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dbang du byas par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the factors associated with higher states are stated from the perspective of the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rgod pa la sogs pa rnams 'dir skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rgod pa la sogs pa rnams 'dir skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Excitement and so on that occur in the desire realm are not included here.

original: yang ci'i phyir rgod pa bzhin du rmug sa pa gong ma'i cha dang mthun par bshad ce na ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rgod pa bzhin du rmug sa pa gong ma'i cha dang mthun par bshad ce na ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is lethargy explained as a part of the upper stage, like agitation? Because it is in accord with concentration.

original: rmugs pa ni ting nge 'dzin 'khrug par byed pa nyid kyis kun tu sbyor ba'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: rmugs pa ni ting nge 'dzin 'khrug par byed pa nyid kyis kun tu sbyor ba'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: Lethargy is the nature of a fetter because it disturbs concentration.

original: rmugs pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang mthun par kun tu spyod bar ma bshad do //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang mthun par kun tu spyod bar ma bshad do //
translated: But it is not explained that lethargy is in accord with concentration.

original: 'di rnams kyis 'ching bar byed pas na 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis 'ching bar byed pas na 'ching ba ste /
translated: They are bonds because they bind.

original: 'dod @167b chags dang bral bar 'gro ba la gegs byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod @167b chags dang bral bar 'gro ba la gegs byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “they obstruct the attainment of freedom from attachment” is that they obstruct the attainment of the path of vision.

original: kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba rnams la mtshan nyid las tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba rnams la mtshan nyid las tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although there is no difference in their characteristics from the fetters and bonds,

original: 'on kyang tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum du bshad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum du bshad do //
translated: nevertheless, the bonds are explained as three in number because of the power of feeling.

original: 'ching ba 'dod chags thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa rnam pa lnga char yang ngo zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'ching ba 'dod chags thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa rnam pa lnga char yang ngo zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: “All bonds of attachment” shows that the five types in the three realms are all bonds of attachment.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang ci rigs par de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang ci rigs par de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Hatred and delusion should be understood in the same way, as appropriate.

original: sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Hatred is in relation to suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug ste /
translated: Delusion is in relation to that which is neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba thams cad du yang dbang du bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba thams cad du yang dbang du bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “in relation to the object” should be applied to all of these terms.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Desire and hatred are not like that.

original: bde ba la ji ltar 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar zhe sdang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: bde ba la ji ltar 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar zhe sdang ba ma yin la /
translated: Desire does not increase in relation to pleasure in the same way that hatred does.

original: sdug bsngal la ji ltar zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar 'dod chags la ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ji ltar zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar 'dod chags la ma yin te /
translated: Hatred does not increase in relation to suffering in the same way that desire does.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi /🔽mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag la zhe sdang dang 'dod chags dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi /🔽mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ma yin no //
translated: For example, desire and hatred increase in relation to pleasure and suffering, respectively, by way of their object, but not by way of their concomitants.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la gti mug ji ltar rgyas pa de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la gti mug ji ltar rgyas pa de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ma yin no //
translated: But when the object is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, attachment and hostility do not grow, but delusion does.

original: yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba dang ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni / rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba dang ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur la /
translated: Or else, the defilements grow by reason of the object, when it is present in the personal series.🔽Attachment grows by reason of the object, when the object is pleasant, and by reason of the presence of the defilement in the personal series.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa las ni dmigs pa tsam gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa las ni dmigs pa tsam gyi sgo nas so //
translated: Hostility grows by reason of the object, when the object is unpleasant, and by reason of the presence of the defilement in the personal series.

original: zhe sdang la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same for hostility.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: According to others,

original: rang gi rgyud la dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni bde ba las 'dod chags nyid du nges so //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni bde ba las 'dod chags nyid du nges so //
translated: attachment grows by reason of the object, when the object is pleasant, and by reason of the presence of the defilement in the personal series.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la ni zhe sdang du 'gyur bar ma nges so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la ni zhe sdang du 'gyur bar ma nges so zhes zer ro //
translated: Hostility does not grow by reason of the presence of the defilement in the personal series.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same for hostility.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: According to others,

original: phyi mo'i gnas lta bu yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'ching ba rnams gsum du gsungs te /
analyzed: phyi mo'i gnas lta bu yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'ching ba rnams gsum du gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavån has declared the fetters to be three in number, because they are like the root of the tree of cyclic existence.

original: 'di dag kyang de las gzhan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams kyi nang du 'du ste /🔽lta ba @168a * //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang de las gzhan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams kyi nang du 'du ste / lta ba @168a * //
translated: They are included among the other fetters.

original: dang the tshom dag ni rmongs pa'i phyogs la brten to //🔽nga rgyal dang ser sna dag ni 'dod chags kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: dang the tshom dag ni rmongs pa'i phyogs la brten to // nga rgyal dang ser sna dag ni 'dod chags kyi phyogs so //
translated: The views and doubt are based on delusion.🔽Pride and envy are based on attachment.

original: phrag dog dag ni zhe sdang gi phyogs so //
analyzed: phrag dog dag ni zhe sdang gi phyogs so //
translated: Jealousy is based on aversion.

original: yang na bden pa mthong ba rnams la khyad par du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir de skad bshad la /
analyzed: yang na bden pa mthong ba rnams la khyad par du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir de skad bshad la /
translated: Or, they are taught in that way in order to show that they are to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: blo ngan pa rnams la ji ltar rags pa'i nyon mongs pa bstan pa'i phyir de skad gsungs so zhes zer ro //🔽sems nye bar nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo ngan pa rnams la ji ltar rags pa'i nyon mongs pa bstan pa'i phyir de skad gsungs so zhes zer ro // sems nye bar nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and in order to show that they are the most coarse afflictions for those of bad intellect.🔽Because they afflict the mind.

original: sems nyon mongs pa can nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa can nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They afflict the mind itself.

original: de'i 'jug pa rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The proximate afflictions are the engagement of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The phenomena that are not fully qualified as afflictions are secondary afflictions.

original: re zhig gang dag nyon mongs pa phra rgyas zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gang dag nyon mongs pa phra rgyas zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa yang yin te /
translated: First, those that are called afflictions and proclivities are afflictions.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid tshang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid tshang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are complete with the characteristics of afflictions.

original: de dag ni kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
translated: They are called fetters, bonds, proclivities, secondary afflictions, and entanglements. Therefore, they are also secondary afflictions.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams las don gzhan gyi dngos por shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams las don gzhan gyi dngos por shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Other means that they should be known as entities that are different from the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Afflicted means

original: dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to exclude virtue and unobscured indeterminate.

original: sems byung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems byung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Mental factors means

original: gzugs dang mi ldan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽'du byed phung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang mi ldan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro // 'du byed phung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “and so on” is stated in order to exclude form.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba la sogs nga dag bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽de dag kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba la sogs nga dag bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro // de dag kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “the aggregate of formations” is stated in order to exclude the aggregates of feeling and the rest.🔽The phrase “and so on” is stated in order to exclude the secondary mental afflictions.

original: de dag ni rgyu gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dra bar 'jug pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dra bar 'jug pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The secondary mental afflictions are so called because they are similar to the mental afflictions in that they engage in three ways.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang phung po gcig gis bsdus pa dang de'i dri ma nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang phung po gcig gis bsdus pa dang de'i dri ma nyid kyis so //
translated: They are similar to the mental afflictions in that they are associated with them, they are included in the same aggregate, and they are their stains.

original: de dag nyon mongs pa'i ming can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs pa'i ming can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: However, they are not called mental afflictions

original: nyon mongs nyid ma tshang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs nyid ma tshang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not completely encompass the nature of a mental affliction.

original: gzhi phran tshegs las byung ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhi phran tshegs las byung ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are called secondary mental afflictions because they are similar to the mental afflictions in three ways.

original: mi dga' ba dang / glal byed pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid dang / rmya ba dang / zas kyi drod @168b mi zin pa dang rnam par rtog pa logs pa dag go //
analyzed: mi dga' ba dang / glal byed pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid dang / rmya ba dang / zas kyi drod @168b mi zin pa dang rnam par rtog pa logs pa dag go //
translated: The secondary mental afflictions are the following: lack of trust, lethargy, excitedness, carelessness, lack of vigilance, lack of conscience, and the four errors.🔽The four errors are the error of: (1) believing that what is impermanent is permanent, (2) believing that what is suffering is happiness, (3) believing that what is impure is pure, and (4) believing that what does not constitute a self is a self.

original: 'dir ni kun nas dkris pa dang nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa kho na zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pas bsdus pa dang nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni kun nas dkris pa dang nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa kho na zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pas bsdus pa dang nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Here, the term “only” means that they are included in the entanglements and the defilement-stains.

original: de la 'di dag gis srid pa'i btson rar kun nas dkris pas na kun nas dkris pa dag yin pa 'am /
analyzed: de la 'di dag gis srid pa'i btson rar kun nas dkris pas na kun nas dkris pa dag yin pa 'am /
translated: They are entanglements because they entangle one in the prison of existence.

original: yang ci'i phyir phyi ma nges par yang gzugs na spyod pa'i the tshom bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir phyi ma nges par yang gzugs na spyod pa'i the tshom bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: Why is doubt associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction in the realm of form?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid bde ba dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid bde ba dang ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not associated with mental satisfaction in the realm of desire,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma nges par yang skyo ba'i rnam par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma nges par yang skyo ba'i rnam par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that the defilements of the stage of detachment are associated with the aspect of dissatisfaction.

original: the tshom yang de dag dang der bde ba 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom yang de dag dang der bde ba 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Doubt is associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction in the realm of form because one desires to obtain that realm.

original: ji ltar 'dir 'dod pa'i gnas thob pa rnams ngal yang bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir 'dod pa'i gnas thob pa rnams ngal yang bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o //
translated: Just as those who have obtained a desired object experience the notion of pleasure when they rest.

original: gzhan dag ni gzugs na spyod pa dag bde ba dang yid bde ba dang the tshom rab tu zhi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzugs na spyod pa dag bde ba dang yid bde ba dang the tshom rab tu zhi /
translated: The others are the pacification of pleasure, mental pleasure, and doubt in the form realm.

original: 'di dag yod na spyod pa ngan pa la gnas pas na kun nas dkris pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag yod na spyod pa ngan pa la gnas pas na kun nas dkris pa dag go //
translated: When these exist, they are entanglements because one remains in bad conduct.

original: sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental distress is a deep agitation of the mind.

original: khong nas 'khrug pa ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sems kyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: khong nas 'khrug pa ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sems kyi gdung ba'o //
translated: Deep agitation is a torment of the mind preceded by an intolerance of another's excellence.

original: ser sna ni zhes bya ba la gang las bdag las gzhan du ma 'gro zhig snyam par gyur pa ni ser sna ste /
analyzed: ser sna ni zhes bya ba la gang las bdag las gzhan du ma 'gro zhig snyam par gyur pa ni ser sna ste /
translated: Stinginess is the state of mind that thinks, Let me not go away from here!

original: de'i dngos po ni ser sna nyid do //🔽chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dan 'gal ba can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni ser sna nyid do // chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dan 'gal ba can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature of that is stinginess itself.🔽The obstruction to giving Dharma, material goods, and knowledge is the obstruction to giving.

original: chos rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / zang zing rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can no //
analyzed: chos rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / zang zing rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can dang / mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can no //
translated: The obstruction to giving Dharma, the obstruction to giving material goods, and the obstruction to giving knowledge.

original: sems kyi kun tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi kun tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root text states, “The mental factor of covetousness is the desire to make another’s object one’s own by coveting it.”

original: sems kyi kun tu 'dzin pa ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro zhing de dang mi bral ba 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi kun tu 'dzin pa ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro zhing de dang mi bral ba 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Coveting is the desire to possess the object that is coveted, which is preceded by attachment to an object and is not separated from that attachment.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dis rnam par 'phro bar byed pas ser sna ste /🔽ji skad bshad pa dag las ma 'gro zhig ces rtag tu 'dzin pa de rnam par 'phro ba ni ser sna'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dis rnam par 'phro bar byed pas ser sna ste / ji skad bshad pa dag las ma 'gro zhig ces rtag tu 'dzin pa de rnam par 'phro ba ni ser sna'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Other masters say that covetousness is the desire not to be separated from an object that has been acquired, because it causes one to be attached to that object.🔽The root text states, “The mental factor of malice is the desire to harm another.”🔽Malice is the desire to harm another by causing him or her physical pain.

original: gnyid ni sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes brjod na ni /🔽snyoms par 'jug pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gnyid ni sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes brjod na ni / snyoms par 'jug pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: The root text states, “The mental factor of deceit is the desire to deceive another.”🔽 Deceit is the desire to deceive another by concealing one’s faults.

original: @169a * // de'i phyir lus yang dag par 'dzin par mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: @169a * // de'i phyir lus yang dag par 'dzin par mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The root text states, “The mental factor of dissimulation is the desire to conceal one’s faults.”

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi /🔽dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi / dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Dissimulation is the desire to conceal one’s faults when they have been discovered.🔽The root text states, “The mental factor of violence is the desire to harm another.”🔽Violence is the desire to harm another by causing him or her physical pain.🔽The root text states, “The mental factor of anger is the desire to strike another.”

original: 'gyod pa yang nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi /🔽dge ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi /🔽dge ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Anger is the desire to strike another with a stick, etc., in order to cause him or her physical pain.🔽The root text states, “The mental factor of spite is the desire to hurt another.”🔽Spite is the desire to hurt another by causing him or her physical pain.

original: gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase except for malice and violence is explained as follows.

original: sems can 'di rnams gsad dam bcings sam brlag gam 'dis phongs par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa'i rnam pas zhugs pa sems can la zhe sdang ba ni gnod sems so //
analyzed: sems can 'di rnams gsad dam bcings sam brlag gam 'dis phongs par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa'i rnam pas zhugs pa sems can la zhe sdang ba ni gnod sems so //
translated: Malice is the hatred of sentient beings that is engaged in with the thought, “How good it would be if these sentient beings were killed, bound, destroyed, or ruined.”

original: sems rnams dgug pa dang skrag pa dang brdeg pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa'i lam la zhugs pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: sems rnams dgug pa dang skrag pa dang brdeg pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa'i lam la zhugs pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Violence is the engagement in the path of summoning, terrifying, beating, binding, and so on.

original: khro ba ni de gnyis las gzhan pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa yin te /
analyzed: khro ba ni de gnyis las gzhan pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa yin te /
translated: Anger is the malice that is directed toward sentient beings and nonsentient things other than those two.

original: dper na dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnal 'byor dang ldan pa yongs su gtong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnal 'byor dang ldan pa yongs su gtong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the anger of a monk who has moral discipline, is engaged in spiritual practice, and is generous.🔽Concealment is the hiding of one’s faults.

original: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba 'khyud pa'o zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba ni smad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba 'khyud pa'o zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba ni smad par bya ba ste /
translated: Faults are those things that should be condemned.

original: tshul khrims dang spyod pa dang 'tsho ba rgud pa dag yin la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang spyod pa dang 'tsho ba rgud pa dag yin la /
translated: They are the degeneration of moral discipline, the degeneration of spiritual practice, and the degeneration of livelihood.

original: 'khyud pa ni de sped par 'dod pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'khyud pa ni de sped par 'dod pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause for concealing it is the desire to protect it.

original: sdig pa nang du gzhag pa phyir mi mngon par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdig pa nang du gzhag pa phyir mi mngon par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Sin is concealed in order to hide it.

original: go rims bzhin du shes pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du shes pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The first is for those who know and the second is for those who do not know.

original: rgyal po la sogs pas shes pa rnams kyi ni bdag la rnyed pa dang bkur sti med par 'gyur ro snyam du sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin no ;
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pas shes pa rnams kyi ni bdag la rnyed pa dang bkur sti med par 'gyur ro snyam du sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin no ;
translated: For those who know, such as kings, it is a cause for craving, thinking, “I will lose my wealth and honor.”

original: / mi shes pa rnams kyi ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: / mi shes pa rnams kyi ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
translated: For those who do not know, it is a cause for ignorance.

original: las bdag gir bya ba nyid du ma dang po ni kha na ma tho ba 'chab kyi gtsang mar bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi thad du 'chag par mi byed do //
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba nyid du ma dang po ni kha na ma tho ba 'chab kyi gtsang mar bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi thad du 'chag par mi byed do //
translated: The first is for those who are ashamed of sin, who do not go to others to confess their sins.

original: 'di'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of these two should be stated.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang grags pas yid nges par bcings pas rang gi nyes par spyod pa mi mngon par byed /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang grags pas yid nges par bcings pas rang gi nyes par spyod pa mi mngon par byed /
translated: The first is for those who conceal their own bad conduct in order to obtain wealth, honor, and fame.

original: 'dod pas sred pa dang rmongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i sems nye bar nyon mongs pa ni 'chab pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pas sred pa dang rmongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i sems nye bar nyon mongs pa ni 'chab pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Concealment is a mental affliction that is the natural outcome of craving for sensual pleasure and delusion.

original: khrel med pa ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: khrel med pa ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is lack of conscience a natural outcome of ignorance?

original: gang gi phyir khrel med @169b pa 'jig par mi lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khrel med @169b pa 'jig par mi lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because lack of conscience is the absence of dread of the blame of others.

original: the tshom las 'gyod ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom las 'gyod ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Regret is said to arise from doubt, because it is a form of mental affliction.

original: de la rgyu ni gzhan 'drid pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni gzhan 'drid pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cause of deceit is the desire to deceive others.

original: gzhan 'drid pa'i bsam bas log pa nye bar ston ba'i rgyur gyur ba yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gzhom byar gyur pa sems ma zhi ba ni sgyu ste /
analyzed: gzhan 'drid pa'i bsam bas log pa nye bar ston ba'i rgyur gyur ba yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gzhom byar gyur pa sems ma zhi ba ni sgyu ste /
translated: Deceit is a mental state that is not tranquil, and is the cause for the manifestation of falsity. It is overcome by correct meditative concentration.

original: 'jig rten ni rang gi don bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan bslu ba'i thabs la 'jug cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rang gi don bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan bslu ba'i thabs la 'jug cing /
translated: People engage in the means of deceiving others in order to achieve their own goals.

original: sgyu'i gzhi lus dang ngag gi las nye bar bsgrub pa de la sgyu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgyu'i gzhi lus dang ngag gi las nye bar bsgrub pa de la sgyu zhes bya ste /
translated: The basis of deceit is the manifestation of physical and verbal karma. Deceit is called a “mental factor” because it is a mental state.

original: rdzu 'phrul bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul bzhin no //
translated: It is like the supernormal power of magical creation.

original: g-yo ni sems gya gyu pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yo ni sems gya gyu pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Deceit is a crookedness of mind.

original: g-yo ni rang dang gzhan gyi nang gi bsam pa 'khyud pa dang mi gsal bar byed pa'i thabs su byed pa'i sems gya gyu ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo ni rang dang gzhan gyi nang gi bsam pa 'khyud pa dang mi gsal bar byed pa'i thabs su byed pa'i sems gya gyu ba'o //
translated: Deceit is a crookedness of mind that is a means of concealing one's own faults and of not clarifying one's thoughts to others.

original: sgyu dang g-yo dag gi khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo dag gi khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between deceit and crookedness?

original: gzhan 'drid par byed pas sgyu yin la /
analyzed: gzhan 'drid par byed pas sgyu yin la /
translated: Deceit is the concealment of one's faults by deceiving others.

original: rang gi rgyud kyi bsam pa sbed pas g-yo'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi bsam pa sbed pas g-yo'o //
translated: Crookedness is the concealment of one's own thoughts.

original: 'di dag gis rgyu mthun pa'i bya ba'i khyad par yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis rgyu mthun pa'i bya ba'i khyad par yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The difference in their actions will be explained later.

original: rgyags pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyags pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Arrogance has been explained.

original: gzhan dag na re lang tsho dang nad med pa dang 'tsho ba la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa kun tu chags pa las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba ni rgyags pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lang tsho dang nad med pa dang 'tsho ba la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa kun tu chags pa las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba ni rgyags pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that arrogance is a mental factor that arises from attachment to the perfection of youth, health, life, etc.

original: gzhan dag ni 'du byed kyi rgyun la mngon par dga' ba'i sems la gzhan la bltos pa med par bdag nyid la 'byung ba sngon du 'gro ba ni rgyags pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'du byed kyi rgyun la mngon par dga' ba'i sems la gzhan la bltos pa med par bdag nyid la 'byung ba sngon du 'gro ba ni rgyags pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Arrogance is the pre-eminence of the mind that delights in the continuity of the formations, independent of others.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po la dam du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po la dam du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement, The holding of a thing that is blameworthy is called grasping,

original: gang yod pas 'di dag gis gzung dka' ba 'dzin pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang yod pas 'di dag gis gzung dka' ba 'dzin pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: teaches that grasping is the holding of a thing that is difficult to hold because it exists.

original: gzhan dag kho na las nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa dang mi gtong ba ni khong khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag kho na las nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa dang mi gtong ba ni khong khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Desire for deliverance from something else and non-abandonment is resentment and enmity.

original: khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa dag gi khyad par brjod par bya ste /🔽rno zhing chung bar gnas pa ni khro ba'o //
analyzed: khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa dag gi khyad par brjod par bya ste / rno zhing chung bar gnas pa ni khro ba'o //
translated: The difference between anger and enmity should be stated.🔽Anger is sharp and remains for a short time.

original: dam zhing chung bar gnas pa ni khon du 'dzin pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: dam zhing chung bar gnas pa ni khon du 'dzin pa'o zhes so //
translated: Enmity is firm and remains for a long time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i mtshan nyid brjod pa bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i mtshan nyid brjod pa bya ste /
translated: Therefore, their characteristics should be stated.

original: khro ba la gnas pas de'i dngos po dang rjes su 'brel par byas pa'i sems kyis rtog pa ni khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //🔽rnam par 'tshe ba ni mtho 'tsham pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khro ba la gnas pas de'i dngos po dang rjes su 'brel par byas pa'i sems kyis rtog pa ni khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya'o // rnam par 'tshe ba ni mtho 'tsham pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The thought that is associated with the entity of anger and its aftermath is called resentment.

original: gzhan la gnod @170a * //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod @170a * //
translated: Hostility is the desire to harm others.

original: pa nye bar sgrub pa'i rgyur gyur ba snying rjes gzhom par bya ba sems nye bar nyon mongs pa ni rnam par 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: pa nye bar sgrub pa'i rgyur gyur ba snying rjes gzhom par bya ba sems nye bar nyon mongs pa ni rnam par 'tsho ba'o //
translated: The affliction of the mind that is the basis for the desire to harm others is called hostility.🔽Because it is associated with two types of mental afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: means that it is associated with the mental afflictions that are to be eliminated by the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: 'di ltar ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni mi dge ba thams cad mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni mi dge ba thams cad mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because shamelessness and lack of abashment are associated with all that is nonvirtuous,

original: rmugs pa dang rgod pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang rgod pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: while lethargy and excitedness are associated with all the mental afflictions.

original: gnyis ni yid kyi sa pa 'dod pa na spyod pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ni yid kyi sa pa 'dod pa na spyod pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other two are concomitant with all those operating in the desire realm that occur on the level of the mental faculty.

original: 'di dag nyon mongs pa gnyi ga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di dag nyon mongs pa gnyi ga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are concomitant with both the two afflictions and the view of the self,

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ma 'chol bar bstan pa'i don du gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ma 'chol bar bstan pa'i don du gsungs so //
translated: this is stated to clarify that those to be abandoned by the path of seeing are not mixed.🔽Those that are concomitant with those to be abandoned by seeing such and such

original: gang zhig gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: are to be abandoned by seeing such and such.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Those concomitant with those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, those to be abandoned by seeing the truths of origin, cessation, and path should be stated in the same way.

original: ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are concomitant with ignorance alone,

original: ma rig pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa de yang de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa de yang de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is concomitant with the root afflictions and secondary afflictions that are abandoned by the path of cultivation alone, and it is concomitant with the secondary afflictions that are concomitant with it.

original: 'dod na mi dge ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod na mi dge ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nonvirtuous in the desire realm.

original: rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang gnyid ma gtogs pa kun nas dkris pa bdun dang sgyu la sogs pa drug ni 'dod pa'i khams na gcig tu mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang gnyid ma gtogs pa kun nas dkris pa bdun dang sgyu la sogs pa drug ni 'dod pa'i khams na gcig tu mi dge ba yin no //
translated: The seven entanglements except for torpor, excitation, and sleep, and the six such as pretense are nonvirtuous alone in the desire realm.

original: rmugs pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: Torpor and so on are nonvirtuous and neutral.

original: gnyid ni dge ba yang yod pa ma yin nam ci ltar gnyis su brjod ce na ;
analyzed: gnyid ni dge ba yang yod pa ma yin nam ci ltar gnyis su brjod ce na ;
translated: Why is sleep said to be both?

original: kun nas dkris pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir de mi bzung ngo //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir de mi bzung ngo //
translated: It is not mentioned because this is the section on entanglements.

original: thams cad la thams cad mi srid pas ci rigs par zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thams cad la thams cad mi srid pas ci rigs par zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since it is not possible for all to exist in all, the root text states, “as is fitting.”

original: de dag ni mtha' dag yid kyi sa pa dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni mtha' dag yid kyi sa pa dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: All of these exist in the mental realm.

original: nga rgyal dang gnyid dag rnam pa lnga car yang yid kyis pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang gnyid dag rnam pa lnga car yang yid kyis pa ste /
translated: Pride and sleepiness are mental factors in all five modes.

original: @170b 'dod chags la sogs pa ji lta ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @170b 'dod chags la sogs pa ji lta ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not like attachment, etc.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs rang dbang ba yang zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs rang dbang ba yang zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The independent secondary afflictions are also like that.

original: phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / 'gyod pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chal ba rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rnams so //
analyzed: phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / 'gyod pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chal ba rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rnams so //
translated: They are jealousy, avarice, regret, anger, vengefulness, and the secondary afflictions that are defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du bshad pa gang dag yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du bshad pa gang dag yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are the ones that are explained among the secondary afflictions of the great ground.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: bag med pa dang / le lo dang / ma dad pa ste /
analyzed: bag med pa dang / le lo dang / ma dad pa ste /
translated: nonembarrassment, lethargy, excitedness, faithlessness, laziness, and carelessness.

original: de dag thams cad ni rnam par shes pa drug la brten par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni rnam par shes pa drug la brten par rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these should be understood as being based on the six consciousnesses.

original: ma rig pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa ni thal ma thag tu bshad zin pas yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa ni thal ma thag tu bshad zin pas yang mi brjod do //
translated: Ignorance, lethargy, and excitedness are not mentioned here because they have just been explained.

original: dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they operate in the modes of joy and sorrow.

original: dga' ba'i rnam pa dang skyo ba'i rnam pa ni dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rnam pa dang skyo ba'i rnam pa ni dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam pa dag go //
translated: The aspects of joy and sorrow are the aspects of joy and sorrow.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang de dag la de dag tu 'jug pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de dag ni dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang de dag la de dag tu 'jug pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de dag ni dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Attachment and aversion are the states of engaging in those, i.e., joy and sorrow.

original: de'i dngos po ni dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: The state of engaging in joy and sorrow is the state of joy and sorrow.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang de dag bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang de dag bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Therefore, attachment and aversion are concomitant with pleasure and pain.

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan la zhe sdang ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan la zhe sdang ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Attachment is concomitant with pleasure and mental pleasure because they have similar aspects and because they are the sixfold collections of consciousness. Aversion is concomitant with pain and mental displeasure.

original: bsod nams kyi las can dang / sdig pa'i las can rnams kyi dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las can dang / sdig pa'i las can rnams kyi dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who have meritorious karma and those who have sinful karma.

original: bsod nams kyi las can rnams kyis ni yid mi bde ba dang ngo //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las can rnams kyis ni yid mi bde ba dang ngo //
translated: Those who have meritorious actions have mental dissatisfaction.

original: sdig pa'i las can rnams kyis ni yid bde ba dang ngo //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las can rnams kyis ni yid bde ba dang ngo //
translated: Those who have sinful actions have mental satisfaction.

original: lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like the view.

original: log par lta ba ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Except for wrong view.

original: gzhan dag ni 'dir kha cig yid bde ba dang / mtshungs par ldan no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'dir kha cig yid bde ba dang / mtshungs par ldan no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that mental satisfaction is associated with all of these.

original: bdag tu lta bas bdag sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro snyam du yid mi bde ba dang de bzhin du chad par 'gyur ro snyam du yid mi bde bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag tu lta bas bdag sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro snyam du yid mi bde ba dang de bzhin du chad par 'gyur ro snyam du yid mi bde bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because of the view of self, there is mental dissatisfaction when one thinks, “I am suffering.” Similarly, there is mental dissatisfaction when one thinks, “I will be annihilated.”

original: de bzhin du skrag par 'gyur ro snyam nas byis pa rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skrag par 'gyur ro snyam nas byis pa rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: Because of fear, fools think, “I will be reborn in the hells.”

original: dka' thub kyis gtsang ba dang dag par lta ba dang nges par de'i bya bas yid gdung ba yin no //
analyzed: dka' thub kyis gtsang ba dang dag par lta ba dang nges par de'i bya bas yid gdung ba yin no //
translated: They think, “I will be purified and cleansed by austerities.” They are tormented by the thought of engaging in austerities.

original: thos pa dang @171a * //
analyzed: thos pa dang @171a * //
translated: They think, “I will be purified and cleansed by study,🔽knowledge, and so on.” They are tormented by the thought of engaging in study, knowledge, and so on.

original: rig la sogs pa ches bskal zhing yongs su gyur pas yid las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rig la sogs pa ches bskal zhing yongs su gyur pas yid las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal skye ba yin no //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction arises from the suffering of mind.

original: de'i phyir yid mi bde ba ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid mi bde ba ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, we see that mental dissatisfaction is associated with them.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: sems gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i tshor ba skye ba'i phyir bdag sdug bsngal bar gyur to snyam pa'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i tshor ba skye ba'i phyir bdag sdug bsngal bar gyur to snyam pa'o //
translated: because the feeling that arises with another mind is the thought, “I am suffering.”

original: sdug bsngal de nyid ni gzhan sdug bsngal ba'i yul las te bdag las ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de nyid ni gzhan sdug bsngal ba'i yul las te bdag las ma yin no //
translated: This suffering is due to the object of another’s suffering, not due to oneself.

original: de'i bdag nyid mthong bas ni de ltar dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid mthong bas ni de ltar dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one sees that it is of the nature of suffering, one becomes happy.

original: de chad par mthong ba'i rgyu las skrag pa skye ste /
analyzed: de chad par mthong ba'i rgyu las skrag pa skye ste /
translated: When one sees that it is subject to cessation, fear arises,

original: de'i yon tan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yon tan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one sees its good qualities.🔽When one has the view of eternalism, fear arises from the view of annihilation.

original: rtag par lta bas ni chad pa la 'jig pa skye'o //
analyzed: rtag par lta bas ni chad pa la 'jig pa skye'o //
translated: When one has the view of nihilism, fear arises from the view of eternalism.🔽When one has the view of the superiority of the self, fear arises from the view of the equality of the self.🔽When one has the view of the purity of the self, fear arises from the view of the impurity of the self.🔽When one has the view of the permanence of the self, fear arises from the view of impermanence.🔽When one has the view of the happiness of the self, fear arises from the view of suffering.🔽When one has the view of the self as pure, fear arises from the view of impurity.🔽When one has the view of the self as happy, fear arises from the view of suffering.🔽When one has the view of the self as permanent, fear arises from the view of impermanence.🔽When one has the view of the self as pure, fear arises from the view of impurity.🔽When one has the view of the self as happy, fear arises from the view of suffering.🔽When one has the view of the self as permanent, fear arises from the view of impermanence.🔽When one has the view of the self as pure, fear arises from the view of impurity.

original: dka' thub kyis gdung ba'i phyogs rnams kyis kyang sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro snyam nas sems gzhan 'dis gzir bas mchog dang dag par lta ba yid bde ba dang lhan cig skye'o //
analyzed: dka' thub kyis gdung ba'i phyogs rnams kyis kyang sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro snyam nas sems gzhan 'dis gzir bas mchog dang dag par lta ba yid bde ba dang lhan cig skye'o //
translated: When one has the view of the self as happy, fear arises from the view of suffering.🔽When one has the view of the self as permanent, fear arises from the view of impermanence.

original: yon tan gyi sgo nas de gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan gyi sgo nas de gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: When one has the view of the self as pure, fear arises from the view of impurity.🔽When one has the view of the self as happy, fear arises from the view of suffering.🔽When one has the view of the self as permanent, fear arises from the view of impermanence.🔽When one has the view of the self as pure, fear arises from the view of impurity.🔽When one has the view of the self as happy, fear arises from the view of suffering

original: pa ri bha ba buddhi tsitt'a me pa ka hi pa ri bha bo n+y'atka d'a m'a sya te /
analyzed: pa ri bha ba buddhi tsitt'a me pa ka hi pa ri bha bo n+y'atka d'a m'a sya te /
translated: Paribhava buddhi citta ame pa ka hi paribhavo nyat kadama asya te.

original: de'i phyir las gzhan pa yid bde ba dang zhes bya ba 'di legs par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir las gzhan pa yid bde ba dang zhes bya ba 'di legs par bshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is well explained that mental satisfaction is different from action.

original: 'dod las skyes zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: 'dod las skyes zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
translated: From what is this derived?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang bral ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang bral ba'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it is free from the feeling of pain and that which is concomitant with it.🔽The mind that is not fully matured is fully matured by another.

original: (/ yongs su ma bsgos pa'i blo sems nyid gang yongs su bsgos gzhan/) re zhig de ltar phra rgyas 'di dag dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam pa'i dbye bas bde ba'am sdug bsngal dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa so sor nges par bshad nas spyir smras pa zhes
analyzed: (/ yongs su ma bsgos pa'i blo sems nyid gang yongs su bsgos gzhan/) re zhig de ltar phra rgyas 'di dag dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam pa'i dbye bas bde ba'am sdug bsngal dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa so sor nges par bshad nas spyir smras pa zhes
translated: Thus, these negative tendencies are definitely explained to be concomitant with pleasure or pain by the division of the aspects of joy and sorrow.

original: bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: In general, it is said:🔽The mind that is not fully matured is fully matured by another.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po ni ma rig pas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ma rig pa yang nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po ni ma rig pas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ma rig pa yang nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of equanimity is nourished by ignorance, and ignorance is associated with all defilements.

original: dngos po so so pa'i rgyun chad pa'i dus su yang nyon mongs pa thams cad yul la lhod par 'dzin par /🔽aut+sa ky'a:aoo d'a sh'i n+y'a m'arg'a sya ni ru dhyi te /
analyzed: dngos po so so pa'i rgyun chad pa'i dus su yang nyon mongs pa thams cad yul la lhod par 'dzin par / aut+sa ky'a:aoo d'a sh'i n+y'a m'arg'a sya ni ru dhyi te /
translated: Even when the stream of individual things is interrupted, all defilements are relaxed in their hold on the object.🔽The path of effort is blocked by the path of ability.

original: (nus pa brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i lam gyis 'gog go/) / de dus dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir btang snyoms dang nyon mongs pa thams cad rjes su mthun par rung ngo //
analyzed: (nus pa brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i lam gyis 'gog go/) / de dus dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir btang snyoms dang nyon mongs pa thams cad rjes su mthun par rung ngo //
translated: Equanimity is suitable for all defilements because it is in conformity with time.

original: btang snyoms la dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin @171b nam ;
analyzed: btang snyoms la dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin @171b nam ;
translated: There is no joy or sorrow in equanimity.

original: de ji ltar dka' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam pas de dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dka' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam pas de dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: How can it be associated with that which has the aspect of difficulty and sorrow?

original: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir skyes bu gzu bo bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir skyes bu gzu bo bzhin no //
translated: There is no contradiction, just as an honest man is.

original: gang gis dga' ba dang skyo ba dag cig car 'gag pa na nye bar sbyor ba 'jug pas 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: gang gis dga' ba dang skyo ba dag cig car 'gag pa na nye bar sbyor ba 'jug pas 'di la skyon med do //
translated: When both joy and displeasure are simultaneously blocked, the application of the antidote is engaged.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag kyang dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rang bzhin ma yin yang de'i rang bzhin chos dang chos ma yin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir de ngag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas de'i rnam pa dag tu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag kyang dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rang bzhin ma yin yang de'i rang bzhin chos dang chos ma yin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir de ngag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas de'i rnam pa dag tu bstan to //
translated: Although neither attachment nor aversion is by nature joy or displeasure, they are associated with joy and displeasure, respectively, because they conform to the natures of joy and displeasure. Therefore, they are taught to have those aspects.

original: de bzhin du btang snyoms kyi dbang po yang dga' ba dang skyo ba las nges par grol ba yin yang phyogs gnyi ga dang mtshungs par ldan par rung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du btang snyoms kyi dbang po yang dga' ba dang skyo ba las nges par grol ba yin yang phyogs gnyi ga dang mtshungs par ldan par rung ngo //
translated: Similarly, although the faculty of equanimity is liberated from both joy and displeasure, it is suitable to be associated with both sides.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhin de'i rnam pa rnams su bstan cing brjod do //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhin de'i rnam pa rnams su bstan cing brjod do //
translated: It is taught and described as having the aspects of those two, like that which is associated with it.

original: yul gyi stobs las rnam par shes pa gzhan skyed pa la rgyu ba gsal ba nyid dang / gnas pa la btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa la nges pa mi 'thad par mthong bas nges par rgyun 'chad pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: yul gyi stobs las rnam par shes pa gzhan skyed pa la rgyu ba gsal ba nyid dang / gnas pa la btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa la nges pa mi 'thad par mthong bas nges par rgyun 'chad pa'i dus su'o //
