translated: It is not tenable that the faculty of equanimity is associated with the clear generation of consciousness from the power of the object, or with the faculty of equanimity associated with stability. Therefore, it is certain that the continuum is interrupted at the time of death.

original: grag go zhes bya ba la grag go'i sgra ni ma rangs pa'i don to //
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba la grag go'i sgra ni ma rangs pa'i don to //
translated: The word “they say” means “I do not agree.”

original: sa gang na dbang po ji snyed cig yod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa gang na dbang po ji snyed cig yod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: How many faculties exist in each realm?

original: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
analyzed: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
translated: In the absorptions of birth🔽there is mental satisfaction, pleasure, equanimity,🔽equanimity and mental satisfaction, pleasure,

original: yid bde bde dang btang snyoms dang ; / btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod //
analyzed: yid bde bde dang btang snyoms dang ; / btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod //
translated: and equanimity and equanimity.

original: ces phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: de nas yang ci rigs par rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nas yang ci rigs par rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then, the four collections of consciousness that exist in the desire realm and the first absorption are associated with the faculty of pleasure.

original: bsam gtan dang po na ni sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum pa'i bde ba yod la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na ni sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum pa'i bde ba yod la /
translated: In the first absorption, there is pleasure of the third aggregate of consciousness because nose and tongue consciousness do not exist there.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po yid kyi rnam par shes pa po yod do //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po yid kyi rnam par shes pa po yod do //
translated: There is the faculty of equanimity of the fourth aggregate of consciousness and the faculty of mental satisfaction of mental consciousness.

original: de yan na ni ci rigs par yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa thams cad yod do //
analyzed: de yan na ni ci rigs par yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa thams cad yod do //
translated: Above that, all mental consciousness aggregates exist as appropriate.

original: de la bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: In the second absorption, there is the faculty of mental satisfaction and the faculty of equanimity.

original: gsum pa na ni bde ba'i dbang po dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gsum pa na ni bde ba'i dbang po dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: In the third absorption, there is the faculty of pleasure and the faculty of equanimity.

original: de yan chad na ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na yod do //🔽yang @172a * //
analyzed: de yan chad na ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na yod do // yang @172a * //
translated: Above that, only the faculty of equanimity exists.

original: ci'i phyir / spyi ma nges par yang gzugs na spyod pa'i the tshom bde ba dang yid bde ba dag mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / spyi ma nges par yang gzugs na spyod pa'i the tshom bde ba dang yid bde ba dag mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: Why are doubt and pleasure concomitant with mental satisfaction in the form realm?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bde ba dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bde ba dang ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the pleasure of the realm of desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma nges par yang skyo ba'i rnam par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma nges par yang skyo ba'i rnam par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the defilements of the stage of detachment are not reasonable in the aspect of disgust.

original: the tshom yang de dag dang der bde ba 'dod par byed de /
analyzed: the tshom yang de dag dang der bde ba 'dod par byed de /
translated: Doubt also desires pleasure in these stages.

original: ji ltar / 'dir 'dod pa'i gnas thob pa rnams ngal yang bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o //
analyzed: ji ltar / 'dir 'dod pa'i gnas thob pa rnams ngal yang bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o //
translated: For example, those who have attained a state of desire here, even though tired, produce the idea of pleasure.

original: gzhan dag ni gzugs na spyod pa dag bde ba dang yid bde ba dang the tshom rnams rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzugs na spyod pa dag bde ba dang yid bde ba dang the tshom rnams rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that in the realm of form, pleasure, mental pleasure, and doubt are calmed.

original: nus pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “capable” is “associated.”

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid bde ba ni rab tu ma zhi ba yin pas gnas ma yin pa la yang skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid bde ba ni rab tu ma zhi ba yin pas gnas ma yin pa la yang skye bar mthong ste /
translated: Mental pleasure of the realm of desire is not calm. It is seen to arise even in an unsuitable place.

original: 'di ltar lag pa dang rkang pa gas shing zas dang gos med pa dri ngan pa'i dri ma'i 'dam rdzab 'dzin pa mchog tu sdug bsngal ba khur lci bas lus non pa dag kyang rab tu dga' bas glu dang gar lhur byed pa dang gzhan sdug bsngal bas
analyzed: 'di ltar lag pa dang rkang pa gas shing zas dang gos med pa dri ngan pa'i dri ma'i 'dam rdzab 'dzin pa mchog tu sdug bsngal ba khur lci bas lus non pa dag kyang rab tu dga' bas glu dang gar lhur byed pa dang gzhan sdug bsngal bas
translated: and who, in spite of this, are obliged to experience the most violent sensations of suffering, are seen to be happy and to laugh.

original: kyang ma gu ba mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: kyang ma gu ba mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: The same for the animals, the asuras, and the gods.🔽The same for the humans of the different continents, the inhabitants of Jambudvīpa, etc.🔽The same for the humans of the different regions, some of whom are happy, others who are suffering.🔽The same for the humans of the same region, who are all happy or all suffering, but of different complexions, different languages, different customs, etc.🔽The same for the humans of the same region, of the same country, of the same family, who are all happy, of the same complexion, of the same language, of the same customs, but who are nevertheless different from one another.

original: de ltar gnas ma yin pa la the tshom skye bas de dang 'di dag mtshungs pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar gnas ma yin pa la the tshom skye bas de dang 'di dag mtshungs pa med do //
translated: The same for the gods of the realm of desire, who are all happy, but who are different from one another.🔽The same for the gods of the realm of fine-materiality, who are all happy, of the same complexion, of the same language, of the same customs, but who are nevertheless different from one another.

original: the tshom yang gzugs kyi khams su dge ba'i phyogs kyi 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom yang gzugs kyi khams su dge ba'i phyogs kyi 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: The same for the gods of the realm of immateriality, who are all happy, of the same complexion, of the same language, of the same customs, of the same body, but who are nevertheless different from one another.🔽The same for the noble ones, who are all happy, of the same complexion, of the same language, of the same customs, of the same body, but who are nevertheless different from one another.

original: gzhan dag ni gang las de dag dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gang las de dag dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The same for the non-noble ones, who are all happy, of the same complexion, of the same language, of the same customs, of the same body, but who are nevertheless different from one another.🔽The same for the noble ones and the non-noble ones, who are all happy, of the same complexion, of the same language, of the same customs, of the same body, but who are nevertheless different from one another.🔽The same for the noble ones and the non-noble ones, who are all happy, of the same complexion

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mngon sum rnams kyi the tshom phal cher yang dag par nges pa la 'jug pas bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa rnams su the tshom dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rtogs pa dag yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dag
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mngon sum rnams kyi the tshom phal cher yang dag par nges pa la 'jug pas bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa rnams su the tshom dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rtogs pa dag yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dag
translated: and the direct perception of those free from attachment mostly engages in ascertaining doubt. Therefore, in the first, second and third absorptions, investigation that is concomitant with doubt arises.🔽Others say this.

original: zer ro // de rnams ni de dag la rang bzhin gyis yid 'byung ba zhes so //
analyzed: zer ro // de rnams ni de dag la rang bzhin gyis yid 'byung ba zhes so //
translated: They say that those are naturally arisen in those absorptions.

original: skye ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir dang yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i khyad par gnyis ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir dang yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i khyad par gnyis ni /
translated: The two distinctions “because they engage in the aspect of birth” and “because they are on the level of the mental faculty”

original: yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: are to eliminate the faculties of mental satisfaction and pain being concomitant with investigation.

original: 'tshig pa yang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tshig pa yang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Also anger is a natural outcome of holding a view to be paramount.

original: dga' ba'i rnam pa yid kyis @172b pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'i dbang po kho nar rigs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rnam pa yid kyis @172b pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'i dbang po kho nar rigs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The mental faculty is the faculty of delight, because it is the cause of delight.

original: gzhan dag ni ser sna bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ser sna bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The other faculties are like avarice.

original: gal te rgyu dang yid mi bde ba dag kyang mtshungs par ldan na ji ltar 'dod chags las skyes par brjod ce na /🔽dga' ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu mthun pa nyid kyis skye ba'i rnam par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang yid mi bde ba dag kyang mtshungs par ldan na ji ltar 'dod chags las skyes par brjod ce na / dga' ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu mthun pa nyid kyis skye ba'i rnam par mi rigs so //
translated: If pleasure and the mental faculty are associated with attachment, how can they be said to arise from attachment?🔽They are said to arise from attachment because they are the natural outcome of attachment.

original: rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang skyo bar mi rigs la /
analyzed: rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang skyo bar mi rigs la /
translated: It is not reasonable that the mental faculty, which is the cause of pleasure, is born from pleasure.

original: yang na rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mthun pas kyang rgyu zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽'di mtha' gcig tu sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mthun pas kyang rgyu zhes brjod par bya'o // 'di mtha' gcig tu sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Or else, the cause of consciousness should be called the cause of pleasure.🔽It is not maintained that pleasure is the natural outcome of craving,

original: ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa dag sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin pas mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa dag sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin pas mi 'dod do //
translated: because shamelessness and excitation are not associated with the feeling of pain.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags las skyes pa yang sgyu dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'gyur te ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags las skyes pa yang sgyu dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'gyur te ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, that born of attachment is deceit and lethargy, like shamelessness and excitation.

original: yang 'dod chags las skyes pa nyid spyir 'dod chags bzhin du sgyu yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'dod chags las skyes pa nyid spyir 'dod chags bzhin du sgyu yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that born of attachment is deceit in general, like attachment itself.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag dang dbang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag dang dbang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Shamelessness and excitation are not dominant,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang mi dge ba nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang mi dge ba nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are associated with all the defilements and because they are associated with the nonvirtue of the defilements.

original: de'i phyir sred pa bzhin du sgyu nyid skyo ba'i rnam par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sred pa bzhin du sgyu nyid skyo ba'i rnam par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, like craving, deceit is not lethargy in its aspect.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa dag ni rang dbang ma yin pa'i phyir skyo ba'i rnam par yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa dag ni rang dbang ma yin pa'i phyir skyo ba'i rnam par yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Shamelessness and excitation are not incompatible with lethargy, because they are not dominant.

original: 'di yang der dga' ba'i rnam pa dang skyo ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu mthun par grub po //
analyzed: 'di yang der dga' ba'i rnam pa dang skyo ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu mthun par grub po //
translated: This is established as the natural outcome of the aspect of delight in that and the aspect of lethargy.

original: 'di ni re zhig dga' ba'i rnam pa dang skyo ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig dga' ba'i rnam pa dang skyo ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is called the “consequence of the aspect of joy and the consequence of the aspect of disgust.”

original: de ni du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbye bas rang dbang dang gzhan dbang zhes bya ba khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ni du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbye bas rang dbang dang gzhan dbang zhes bya ba khyad par ro //
translated: It is distinguished as “autonomous” and “heteronomous” because of the differentiation of the dharmas, since it has many natures.

original: rang gi rgyud nyid las sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste skyo ba'i rnam par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud nyid las sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste skyo ba'i rnam par mi 'thad do //
translated: The consequence of the cause of craving is not tenable as the aspect of disgust in one’s own continuum.

original: rgyud tha dad pa las ni khong khro bzhin du skyo ba'i rnam par yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa las ni khong khro bzhin du skyo ba'i rnam par yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: But it is not contradictory that the aspect of disgust arises from a different continuum, just like anger.

original: sgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang 'ga' zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang 'ga' zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind associated with deceit also arises in some cases.

original: nus pa'i bdag nyid brjod par 'dod @173a * //
analyzed: nus pa'i bdag nyid brjod par 'dod @173a * //
translated: The mind that is the nature of ability is not asserted to be the object of expression.

original: pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid la dogs pa ste de dang mtshungs par ldan pa la yang skyo ba'i sems srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid la dogs pa ste de dang mtshungs par ldan pa la yang skyo ba'i sems srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The doubt about that is stated by “and so on.” Since the mind of disgust is possible in that association,

original: ma rig pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: like ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa'am nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa bkag pa med ba de bzhin du btang snyoms kyang yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'am nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa bkag pa med ba de bzhin du btang snyoms kyang yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as there is no restriction that it is concomitant with any of the root or secondary afflictions, so too it is neutral.

original: mi dge ba'i mang po ba yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i mang po ba yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa'o //
translated: Because it is a great deal of nonvirtue, means shamelessness and absence of abashment.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang rgod pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang rgod pa'o //
translated: Because it is a great deal of affliction, means lethargy and excitation.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la ni mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can srid pas de'i phyir dbang po lnga char dang mtshungs par ldan te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la ni mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can srid pas de'i phyir dbang po lnga char dang mtshungs par ldan te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since nonvirtue and affliction are possible in the sixfold collection of consciousness, therefore it is said that they are concomitant with all five faculties.

original: mdo las 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo las 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The sutra states:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag sgrib pa lnga ni mi dge ba'i phung po yin no zhes bya ba de dag ni yang dag par smra bas smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag sgrib pa lnga ni mi dge ba'i phung po yin no zhes bya ba de dag ni yang dag par smra bas smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Monks, the five obscurations are the aggregates of nonvirtue.” Those who speak correctly would say this.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge slong dag 'di ni mi dge ba'i phung po ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni mi dge ba'i phung po ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Monks, this is the complete and unmixed heap of nonvirtue,

original: 'di lta ste sgrib pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sgrib pa lnga'o //
translated: namely the five hindrances.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo zhes gsungs so ;
translated: They are sensual desire, malice, lethargy and sleep, excitation and regret, and doubt.

original: / de la ci rmugs pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: / de la ci rmugs pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: What is lethargy?

original: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / the tshom ni khams gsum pa yin la /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / the tshom ni khams gsum pa yin la /
translated: Lethargy, excitation, and doubt exist in the three realms.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin na /
translated: Sensual desire and malice exist in the desire realm.

original: de las ni khyad par med par gsungs pas /🔽ci rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang / the tshom khams gsum pa gzung ngam /
analyzed: de las ni khyad par med par gsungs pas / ci rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang / the tshom khams gsum pa gzung ngam /
translated: But they are taught without distinction in the sutra.🔽So do we take lethargy, excitation, and doubt to exist in the three realms?

original: 'on te 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems ltar 'dod pa dang ldan par gzung zhes mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems ltar 'dod pa dang ldan par gzung zhes mi shes pa'o //
translated: Or do we take them to exist in the desire realm like sensual desire and malice?

original: 'di ni mi dge ba'i phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang / the tshom rnams khams gsum pa nyid yin yang 'dod par gtogs pa dag kho na sgrib par bzhed do //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dge ba'i phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang / the tshom rnams khams gsum pa nyid yin yang 'dod par gtogs pa dag kho na sgrib par bzhed do //
translated: This is because the root text states, “These are called the aggregates of nonvirtue,” and so on. Thus, lethargy, excitation, and doubt exist in the three realms, but only those that belong to the desire realm are considered to be obscurations.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang gnyid dang 'gyod pa dag dang bsre bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang gnyid dang 'gyod pa dag dang bsre bar mdzad de /
translated: For this reason, lethargy, excitation, sleep, and regret are combined.

original: rmugs pa dang rgod pa 'dod pa na spyod pa dag kho na sgrib pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang rgod pa 'dod pa na spyod pa dag kho na sgrib pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because only lethargy and excitation that occur in the desire realm are to be understood as obscurations.

original: gnyid dang 'gyod pa nyon mongs pa can ma @173b yin pa dag sgrib pa'i ngo bo yin pa dgag pa mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyid dang 'gyod pa nyon mongs pa can ma @173b yin pa dag sgrib pa'i ngo bo yin pa dgag pa mdzad pa yin te /
translated: Sleep and regret that are not afflicted are denied to be the nature of obscurations.

original: rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang / bsres pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang gcig tu nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang / bsres pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang gcig tu nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are combined with lethargy and excitation and because they are not solely afflicted.

original: sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o ;
translated: Obscuration is the meaning of the obscuration of meditative stabilization, concentration and meditative attainment.

original: / mi mthun dang zas dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / mi mthun dang zas dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have the same object, food and action,🔽two are one.

original: gnyis gcig ces bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i zas sdug pa'i mtshan ma yin la /
analyzed: gnyis gcig ces bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i zas sdug pa'i mtshan ma yin la /
translated: Just as the food of the desire to enjoy is the sign of beauty,🔽its nonfood is ugliness,

original: zas ma yin pa mi sdug pa yin pa dang / gnod sems kyi zas khong khro ba'i mtshan ma yin la /
analyzed: zas ma yin pa mi sdug pa yin pa dang / gnod sems kyi zas khong khro ba'i mtshan ma yin la /
translated: the food of malice is the sign of anger,🔽its nonfood is love,

original: zas ma yin pa byams pa yin pa dang / the tshom zas dus gsum yin te /
analyzed: zas ma yin pa byams pa yin pa dang / the tshom zas dus gsum yin te /
translated: and the food of doubt is the three times,

original: 'das pa'i dus la the tshom za zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la the tshom za zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung bas so //
translated: because it is said that doubt arises with regard to the past and so on.

original: zas ma yin pa ni rkyen nyid 'di pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la so sor rtog pa yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zas ma yin pa ni rkyen nyid 'di pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la so sor rtog pa yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: Nonfood is the discernment of the dependent origination of this condition.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni re re zhing sgrib pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni re re zhing sgrib pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus each of these is an obscuration.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / rgod pa dang ; 'gyod pa'i yang de bzhin yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / rgod pa dang ; 'gyod pa'i yang de bzhin yin no //
translated: The same applies to torpor and sleep, and to restlessness and worry.

original: kha zas kyi drod mi zin pa zhes bya ba ni te por nyung ba'am mang ba za ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha zas kyi drod mi zin pa zhes bya ba ni te por nyung ba'am mang ba za ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “not knowing the right amount in eating” means eating too little or too much.

original: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin dang rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin dang rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Tranquility is the one-pointedness of mind that is concentration.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag gis ni tshul khrims kyi phung po la gnod bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag gis ni tshul khrims kyi phung po la gnod bar byed de /
translated: Desire for sensual pleasure and malice harm the aggregate of morality.

original: de gnyis kyi go rims bzhin du 'dod pa dang sdig pa las dben pa ring du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi go rims bzhin du 'dod pa dang sdig pa las dben pa ring du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of these two, one is far removed from the seclusion of the body and from the absence of malice.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis ni shes rab kyi phung po la gnod par byed de /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis ni shes rab kyi phung po la gnod par byed de /
translated: Torpor and sleep harm the aggregate of wisdom.

original: des lhag mthong ring du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des lhag mthong ring du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of these two, one is far removed from the insight that is the antidote to torpor and sleep.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po la gnod par byed de ;
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po la gnod par byed de ;
translated: Restlessness and worry harm the aggregate of concentration.

original: des zhi gnas ring du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des zhi gnas ring du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of these two, one is far removed from tranquility.

original: rtog pa 'di lta na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te rmugs pa dang gnyid shes rab kyi phung po dang 'gal ba nyid du rtog cing /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di lta na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te rmugs pa dang gnyid shes rab kyi phung po dang 'gal ba nyid du rtog cing /
translated: If one conceives of this, then if one conceives of lethargy and sleep as being in opposition to the aggregate of wisdom,

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang 'gal bar rtog na ni /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang 'gal bar rtog na ni /
translated: and if one conceives of excited speech and regret as being in opposition to the aggregate of meditative stabilization,

original: de lta yin dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis bsgribs pa'i sngar smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis bsgribs pa'i sngar smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the obscurations of excited speech and regret would be mentioned first, before the obscurations of lethargy and sleep.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar rim pa gang gis tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po dag bstan pa'i rim pa des de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i sgrib pa rnams kyis bstan par rigs te /🔽rim pa las rgyal ba la dgos @174a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar rim pa gang gis tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po dag bstan pa'i rim pa des de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i sgrib pa rnams kyis bstan par rigs te / rim pa las rgyal ba la dgos @174a * //
translated: Why? Because it is reasonable that the obscurations that are adverse to the aggregates of morality, meditative stabilization, and wisdom would be mentioned in the same order in which those aggregates are taught,

original: pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no purpose in violating the order.

original: grangs pa ni gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grangs pa ni gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the order?

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Lethargy and sleep are secondary afflictions of the aggregate of meditative stabilization.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni shes rab kyi phung po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni shes rab kyi phung po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Excitement and regret are secondary defilements of the aggregate of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa ni rmugs pa dang ; gnyid kyis 'jigs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa ni rmugs pa dang ; gnyid kyis 'jigs la /
translated: Thus, one who strives in meditative concentration fears torpor and sleepiness.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa la brtson pa ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pas 'jigs so //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa la brtson pa ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pas 'jigs so //
translated: One who strives to discern the dharmas fears excitement and regret.

original: rim pa tha dad pa la dgos pa yod de /🔽kha cig lhag mthong ni rmugs pa'i gnyen por bshad kyi zhi gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: rim pa tha dad pa la dgos pa yod de / kha cig lhag mthong ni rmugs pa'i gnyen por bshad kyi zhi gnas ma yin no //
translated: The different order has a purpose.🔽Some explain insight as the antidote to torpor, not serenity.

analyzed: zhi gnas kyang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i gnyen por bshad kyi lhag mthong ma yin pas /

analyzed: yang ci'i phyir ma rig pa sgrib par rnam par ma gzhag ce na /

analyzed: ma brjod kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //

original: mdo las ma rig pa ni bsgribs pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las ma rig pa ni bsgribs pa'o zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: sgrib pa rnams dang khur 'dren pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //

original: (gcig) @174b (gi gzhan yod/) nga rgyal gyi dbang gis kyang kha cig dge ba rtsom pa'i phyir nga rgyal sgrib pa rnams su ma bshad do //
analyzed: (gcig) @174b (gi gzhan yod/) nga rgyal gyi dbang gis kyang kha cig dge ba rtsom pa'i phyir nga rgyal sgrib pa rnams su ma bshad do //
translated: Some say: Pride is not mentioned as a hindrance because it causes some to undertake virtue.

original: sems rtsub par 'jug pas sgrib pa rnams te /
analyzed: sems rtsub par 'jug pas sgrib pa rnams te /
translated: They are hindrances because they cause the mind to enter into a state of turbulence.

original: sems rab tu bzung ste 'jug pa'i phyir nga rgyal lo zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: sems rab tu bzung ste 'jug pa'i phyir nga rgyal lo zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say: Pride is a hindrance because it causes the mind to enter into a state of complete control.

original: 'dis sems khengs par mi byed pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis sems khengs par mi byed pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: It is not because it does not cause the mind to swell.

original: sgrib pa med pas bdag med par lta ba ma tshang ba dang bdag med par lta bas khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba mthong ba'i phyir lta ba rnams ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pas bdag med par lta ba ma tshang ba dang bdag med par lta bas khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba mthong ba'i phyir lta ba rnams ma yin te /
translated: The views are not hindrances because the view of selflessness does not obstruct the view of nonself, and because one who has the view of nonself is free from attachment to the elements.

original: shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang gsal ba'i phyir gzhan dag go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang gsal ba'i phyir gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say: The views are hindrances because they are by nature wisdom and because they are clear.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir sgrib pa rnams te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir sgrib pa rnams te /
translated: They are hindrances because they are incompatible with the path.

original: khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la sgrib pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la sgrib pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams sgrib pa'o //
translated: The afflictions of the form and formless realms are obscurations because they obscure freedom from attachment to the three realms.

original: yang na de la sgrib pa'i phyir sgrib pa rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: yang na de la sgrib pa'i phyir sgrib pa rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Or else, obscurations are posited as obscurations because they obscure that.

original: lung ma bstan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung ma bstan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are neutral avyakṛta because they are neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous.

original: 'dir mi dge ba rnams ni sgrib pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir mi dge ba rnams ni sgrib pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Here, nonvirtuous states are obscurations.

original: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase “pervasive contaminants of different realms” is explained in detail.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag yin zhing /
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag yin zhing /
translated: The focal object of pervasive contaminants of different realms is the form and formless realms.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba yin la /
translated: They are objects to be known by perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin.

original: de rnams de'i tshe spong ba ni ma yin te sngar spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams de'i tshe spong ba ni ma yin te sngar spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But they are not abandoned at that time because they were previously abandoned.

original: de rnams ni sngar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i dus su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni sngar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i dus su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they were previously abandoned at the time of Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin.🔽Those that focus on those objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path that are contaminated focus on wrong view and so on that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.

original: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa yin la de dag kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis🔽bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa yin la de dag kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: They are also subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dag gis yongs su shes la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dag gis yongs su shes la /
translated: Therefore they are fully understood by perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin and by subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin.

original: de rnams de'i tshe spangs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams de'i tshe spangs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not abandoned at that time.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: phyis 'gog pa dang lam la chos dang rjes su shes pa dag gis spong ngo //
analyzed: phyis 'gog pa dang lam la chos dang rjes su shes pa dag gis spong ngo //
translated: They are later abandoned by Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge of the truths of cessation and path.

original: de'i tshe de rnams kyi dmigs pa yongs su shes pa yang ma yin te sngar yongs su shes par byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnams kyi dmigs pa yongs su shes pa yang ma yin te sngar yongs su shes par byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time they are not fully understood since they are already fully understood.

original: de'i phyir de rnams ji ltar spong pa brjod dgos so zhe na dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang / de la dmigs pa yang dag par zad pa dang @175a * //🔽zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams ji ltar spong pa brjod dgos so zhe na dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang / de la dmigs pa yang dag par zad pa dang @175a * // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The root text states, “Through complete knowledge of the focal object and through the complete elimination of that which focuses on it.”

original: rang gi sa la dmigs pa smos pa ni skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //🔽zag pa med pa la dmigs pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi sa la dmigs pa smos pa ni skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba bsal ba'i phyir ro // zag pa med pa la dmigs pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “that focuses on its own level” is stated to exclude the pervasive negative tendencies of different realms.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “that which focuses on the uncontaminated” is stated to exclude those that focus on the contaminated.

original: de la dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rang gi khams la dmigs pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rang gi khams la dmigs pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spong ngo //
translated: Through complete knowledge of the focal object, one abandons those that focus on the desire realm and one’s own realm and those that focus on the suffering and origin that are to be abandoned by seeing in the form and formless realms.

original: de la skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang mthong ba'i sgo nas spong ba yin te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang khams gnyis la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang mthong ba'i sgo nas spong ba yin te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang khams gnyis la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The latter are abandoned by means of comprehending and seeing the object fields of different realms, because they are not free from the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin and because they focus on two realms.

original: de la dmigs pa yang dag par zad pas ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yang dag par zad pas ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “by the complete termination of the object field” means

original: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba gang dag la dmigs pa 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba la dmigs pa de dag ni de dag zad pas spong ngo //
analyzed: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba gang dag la dmigs pa 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba la dmigs pa de dag ni de dag zad pas spong ngo //
translated: that the pervasive negative tendencies of different realms that focus on the afflicted view of the self and extreme view are abandoned by the termination of those views.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: yul bstan par byed pa spangs pa'i phyir skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba rnams spong gi / dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul bstan par byed pa spangs pa'i phyir skal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba rnams spong gi / dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The pervasive negative tendencies of different realms are abandoned by abandoning the object field that is taught, but they are not abandoned by comprehending the object field.

original: yang ji ltar de rnams yul bsten par byed pa nyid du brtag ce na de'i rgyu'i ngo bo las te de ltar yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ji ltar de rnams yul bsten par byed pa nyid du brtag ce na de'i rgyu'i ngo bo las te de ltar yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: How can they be considered to be the support of objects? From the point of view of their nature as causes, they are not like that.

original: rgyu kun tu bcom par brjod de /
analyzed: rgyu kun tu bcom par brjod de /
translated: The cause is said to be completely destroyed.

original: rnam grangs kyis de nyid bshad pas 'di ma 'chol bar bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis de nyid bshad pas 'di ma 'chol bar bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since that is explained by way of synonyms, it should be stated in order to avoid confusion.

original: de dag thams cad phan tshun rgyu can yin pas de'i phyir de la dmigs pa spangs par bshad pas skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba nyid bde blag tu shes so //

translated: Since all of them are mutually causal, therefore, since it is explained that the object of those is abandoned, the pervasions of the realms that are not of the same status are easily understood.

original: de dag gis gzhan la yang ma yin gyi zag pa med pa la dmigs pas de dag la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis gzhan la yang ma yin gyi zag pa med pa la dmigs pas de dag la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: They do not focus on other objects, but they focus on those objects that focus on uncontaminated states.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ni 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ni 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Those that focus on uncontaminated states focus on cessation and the path.

original: log par lta ba dang the tshom dang ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba dang the tshom dang ma rig pa ste /
translated: Wrong view, doubt and ignorance.

original: de dag ni log par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni log par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those are wrong view and so on.

original: de dag ni 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: They are the focal object of attachment and so on that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu yul spangs pas yul can spangs par bshad ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu yul spangs pas yul can spangs par bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it said that the object is abandoned by abandoning the object possessor?

original: ji lar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mngon par rtogs pa ni 'ga' zhig tu @175b spangs pas yul can spang zhing /
analyzed: ji lar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mngon par rtogs pa ni 'ga' zhig tu @175b spangs pas yul can spang zhing /
translated: When one realizes the truths of suffering and origin, the object possessor is abandoned by abandoning the object.

original: ji ltar 'gog pa dang lam mngon par rtogs pa'i chas cig cig spangs kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gog pa dang lam mngon par rtogs pa'i chas cig cig spangs kyang /
translated: When one realizes the truths of cessation and path, the object possessor is not abandoned by abandoning the object.

original: gal te der spangs pa de la spangs pa las 'di spangs par bstan to //
analyzed: gal te der spangs pa de la spangs pa las 'di spangs par bstan to //
translated: If it is said that the object possessor is abandoned by abandoning the object,🔽wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.

original: gang du gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i yul de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul der nyon mongs pa'i stobs dang ldan pa de'i dmigs pa la zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi bya ba 'jug pa de'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug
analyzed: gang du gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i yul de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul der nyon mongs pa'i stobs dang ldan pa de'i dmigs pa la zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi bya ba 'jug pa de'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug
translated: Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.🔽Wherever the object of a specific affliction is abandoned, the object possessor is also abandoned there.

original: bsngal dang kun 'byung dag rtogs pa na skal ba mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsngal dang kun 'byung dag rtogs pa na skal ba mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: When one comprehends suffering and origin, the powerful object field is the realm of the same status.

original: 'gog pa dang lam mngon par rtogs pa na zag pa med pa med pas de spangs pa'i phyir cig shos bstan par rigs so //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam mngon par rtogs pa na zag pa med pa med pas de spangs pa'i phyir cig shos bstan par rigs so //
translated: When one comprehends cessation and the path, one does not have the uncontaminated object field. Therefore, it is reasonable to teach the other object field in order to abandon that.

original: gal te de'i tshe phra rgyas kyi dmigs pa 'ga' zhig shes rab kyis mthong bas ni phra rgyas thams cad spong bar byed do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe phra rgyas kyi dmigs pa 'ga' zhig shes rab kyis mthong bas ni phra rgyas thams cad spong bar byed do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If at that time, one sees with wisdom some object field of the proclivities, one abandons all proclivities.

original: de lta na dmigs pa yongs su shes pa kho nas phra rgyas spangs par khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: de lta na dmigs pa yongs su shes pa kho nas phra rgyas spangs par khas blangs dgos so //
translated: If that were so, one would have to accept that one abandons the proclivities by merely comprehending the object field.

original: phra rgyas rnam pa gnyis shes rab gcig gis spong bar byed pa ni de'i yul ni tha dad pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir 'di nges par bshad do //
analyzed: phra rgyas rnam pa gnyis shes rab gcig gis spong bar byed pa ni de'i yul ni tha dad pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir 'di nges par bshad do //
translated: One abandons the two types of proclivities by means of a single wisdom. This is explained because the object field of that wisdom is different.

original: rnam pa gang gis phra rgyas kyi phra rgyas la dmigs pa shes rab kyis mthong zhing dmigs pa gzhan yang de'i tshe spang ngo zhes bya ba 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis phra rgyas kyi phra rgyas la dmigs pa shes rab kyis mthong zhing dmigs pa gzhan yang de'i tshe spang ngo zhes bya ba 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: It is correct to say that when one sees and focuses on the subtle roots of the subtle roots of the negative tendencies by means of wisdom, one abandons the other focal objects at that time.

original: spong ba'i thabs su ma gsungs pa la gnyen po skyes pas zad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spong ba'i thabs su ma gsungs pa la gnyen po skyes pas zad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “they are exhausted through the arising of the antidote” is not a method of abandonment.

original: dmigs pa yongs su shes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs su shes pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not complete knowledge of the focal object.

original: de la dmigs pa zad pas ma yin zhing dmigs pa spangs pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zad pas ma yin zhing dmigs pa spangs pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not through the exhaustion of the focal object, nor is it through the abandonment of the focal object.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: gnyen po skyes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnyen po skyes pa kho na'o //
translated: It is merely the arising of the antidote.

original: 'o na mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang gnyen po skyes pa kho nas spong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang gnyen po skyes pa kho nas spong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it the case that objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are also abandoned merely through the arising of the antidote?

original: de dag kyang nyon mongs pa gang dang gang gi gnyen po de dang de skyes pas spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang nyon mongs pa gang dang gang gi gnyen po de dang de skyes pas spong ba yin no //
translated: They are abandoned through the arising of the antidote to each affliction.

original: brjod par bya ba 'di yod de 'on kyang bsgom pas spang ba khams gsum pa rnams kyi gnyen po nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir gnyen po skyes pas spang ngo zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba 'di yod de 'on kyang bsgom pas spang ba khams gsum pa rnams kyi gnyen po nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir gnyen po skyes pas spang ngo zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the case, but it is said that they are abandoned by the antidote that is the path of meditation, in order to show that the path of meditation is the antidote to the defilements of the three realms.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ba nyid kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen por nges pas ni spang ba'i phyir gnyen po'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ba nyid kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen por nges pas ni spang ba'i phyir gnyen po'o //
translated: The path of seeing is the antidote to the defilements of the summit of existence because it is certain that they are abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: yang na 'dis nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pas na spang ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dis nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pas na spang ba ste /
translated: Or else, they are abandoned by this, thus they are the antidote.

original: spong ba kho na gnyen po yin pas spang ba gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spong ba kho na gnyen po yin pas spang ba gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The abandonment itself is the antidote.

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnams gcod par byed pa ste /🔽de yang bar @176a * //
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnams gcod par byed pa ste / de yang bar @176a * //
translated: The abandonment is the path of liberation, by which the possession of the defilements is cut off.

original: chad med pa'i lam thams cad yin no //
analyzed: chad med pa'i lam thams cad yin no //
translated: And that is all the paths of liberation.

original: gzhi'i gnyen po ni gang dang lhan cig bral ba'i thob pa skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi'i gnyen po ni gang dang lhan cig bral ba'i thob pa skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The basic antidote is that by which the acquisition of the disconnection from the defilements is generated.🔽The basic antidote is the path of liberation.

original: de yang rnam par grol ba'i lam thams cad do zhes kha cig go / de nyid kyi phyir de yan chad kyi bar chad med pa'i lam gang yin pa'o zhes smras te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par grol ba'i lam thams cad do zhes kha cig go / de nyid kyi phyir de yan chad kyi bar chad med pa'i lam gang yin pa'o zhes smras te /
translated: Some say: All liberated paths.🔽Therefore it is said: It is any uninterrupted path above that.

original: gang gis de spangs pa'i thob pa kun tu 'dzin pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spangs pa'i thob pa dang bral ba 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: gang gis de spangs pa'i thob pa kun tu 'dzin pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spangs pa'i thob pa dang bral ba 'dzin par byed do //
translated: It is the uninterrupted path that seizes obtainment of the abandonment of that and it is the liberated path that seizes freedom from the obtainment of the abandonment of that.

original: thob pa de'i gnas med pa'i phyir slar yang nyon mongs pa'i thob ba mi skye'o //
analyzed: thob pa de'i gnas med pa'i phyir slar yang nyon mongs pa'i thob ba mi skye'o //
translated: Because there is no basis for that obtainment, the obtainment of affliction does not arise again.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: de yan chad ces bya ba ni ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam ma gtogs pa lhag ma mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig rnams te /
analyzed: de yan chad ces bya ba ni ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam ma gtogs pa lhag ma mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig rnams te /
translated: Above that means that all moments of the path of seeing except for the uninterrupted path of the truth of suffering are the liberated path.

original: thams cad kyis 'dir de dag gi bral ba'i thob pa 'dzin cing de'i thob pa gcod pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyis 'dir de dag gi bral ba'i thob pa 'dzin cing de'i thob pa gcod pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they seize the obtainment of freedom from that and they sever the obtainment of that.

original: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The antidote that is a distant antidote.

original: 'dis thag bsring ba'i ngo bo byed pas na thag bsring ba'i ngo bo ste de nyid gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'dis thag bsring ba'i ngo bo byed pas na thag bsring ba'i ngo bo ste de nyid gnyen po'o //
translated: Since it acts as a remote antecedent, it is a remote antecedent; it is the counteragent.🔽The path of preparation is the remote antecedent of the path of liberation, because it is the path that is the remote antecedent of the path of liberation.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa'i thob pa bcad pa gang yin pa de thag bsring bar byed pa ste /🔽de yang khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa'i thob pa bcad pa gang yin pa de thag bsring bar byed pa ste / de yang khyad par gyi lam mo //

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam yan chad ces gsungs so //🔽gzhan dag ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam yan chad ces gsungs so // gzhan dag ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam yin la /
translated: The path of liberation is the immediate antecedent of the path of liberation, because it is the path that is the immediate antecedent of the path of liberation.

original: de yan chad kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam de thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yan chad kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam de thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The path of liberation is the immediate antecedent of the path of liberation, because it is the path that is the immediate antecedent of the path of liberation.

original: 'dir rnam par grol ba'i lam yang gzung ngo //🔽gzhan dag na re rnam par grol ba'i lam yang yin te zhes bya ba ni /🔽'di dag gis ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang po yang thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po'o zhes smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par grol ba'i lam yang gzung ngo //🔽gzhan dag na re rnam par grol ba'i lam yang yin te zhes bya ba ni /🔽'di dag gis ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang po yang thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po'o zhes smra ba ste /
translated: The path of liberation is the immediate

original: kun tu spyod pa'i thob pa de 'gags pa'i thob pa rgyud la rgyas par thag bsring bar byed pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa'i thob pa de 'gags pa'i thob pa rgyud la rgyas par thag bsring bar byed pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The obtainment of the path of complete attainment is the obtainment of the cessation of that which is to be abandoned by the path of complete attainment, and it increases in the mindstream over a long period of time.

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni lam gang gis khams dang sa la skyon rnam pa du ma mthong ba'i phyir rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni lam gang gis khams dang sa la skyon rnam pa du ma mthong ba'i phyir rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa ste /
translated: The antidote of thorough disgust is the path by which one thoroughly disgusts oneself with the realms and levels because one sees their many faults.

original: mi sdug par lta bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi sdug par lta bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the view of repulsiveness.

original: de yang nges par 'byung bar yid la byed pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de yang nges par 'byung bar yid la byed pa thams cad de /
translated: Moreover, it is all mental attention that is directed toward renunciation.

original: de'i dbang gis rnam par 'gyur ba mthong nas de la mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis rnam par 'gyur ba mthong nas de la mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
translated: Through its power, one sees the faults and becomes disgusted with the realms and levels and does not become attached to them.

original: 'di ni phal cher sbyor ba'i lam gyi rdzas bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam gyi yang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa dag go /
analyzed: 'di ni phal cher sbyor ba'i lam gyi rdzas bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam gyi yang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa dag go /
translated: This is the substance of the uninterrupted and liberated paths of the path of preparation and the path of distinction that focuses on the truths of suffering and origin.

original: @176b de'i phyir rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po phal che ba bshad do //
analyzed: @176b de'i phyir rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po phal che ba bshad do //
translated: Therefore it is explained as the antidote of thorough disgust.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir 'di thams cad phyis nas smos pa chos mngon pa rim par rab tu phye ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir 'di thams cad phyis nas smos pa chos mngon pa rim par rab tu phye ba ma yin /
translated: Why are all these not explained in the Abhidharma in order?

original: 'o na mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba ci zhe na /
translated: If they are not explained in order, why are they explained by way of their characteristics?

original: kha cig 'di klan ka ma yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig 'di klan ka ma yin zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: This is not a fault.

original: yang na ma nges pa'i phyir ji ltar bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mjug thogs su rnam par grol ba'i lam dang nges pa des mjug thogs su khyad par gyi lam ste /
analyzed: yang na ma nges pa'i phyir ji ltar bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mjug thogs su rnam par grol ba'i lam dang nges pa des mjug thogs su khyad par gyi lam ste /
translated: Or, because it is not definite, just as the liberated path arises immediately after the uninterrupted path and the special path arises immediately after the definite path,

original: de ltar sbyor ba'i lam la nges pa de yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyi nas nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba'i lam la nges pa de yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyi nas nges pa'o //
translated: the path of preparation is not definite in that way, so it is explained after the others.

original: kha cig tu ji ltar 'os par bdag nyid thob cing gcig tu mang po ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu ji ltar 'os par bdag nyid thob cing gcig tu mang po ste /
translated: In some cases, it obtains its own state in whatever way is appropriate and in some cases it is many,

original: cig shos la ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos la ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but in other cases it is not like that.

original: ma nges pa shes par bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi phyis bshad do zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni 'dir rim pa legs pa yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa shes par bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi phyis bshad do zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni 'dir rim pa legs pa yin te /
translated: In order to understand the indefinite, it is explained after all the others. This is the proper order here.

original: snga ma snga ma rnams phyi ma phyi ma la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma rnams phyi ma phyi ma la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latter are based on the former.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they focus on suffering and origin

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos su sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos su sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they directly counteract contaminated entities through aspects such as impermanence.

original: sbyor ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The path of preparation

original: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa yod pas khyad par du phyogs te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa yod pas khyad par du phyogs te /
translated: is the uninterrupted and liberated paths that are distinguished from the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: sbyor ba'i lam zhes bya ba thams cad bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam zhes bya ba thams cad bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of preparation is the uninterrupted path.

original: snga ma ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: snga ma ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The former is the uninterrupted path.

original: rten gnyen po thag bsring pa'i ngo bo'i gnyen por yang bshad do //
analyzed: rten gnyen po thag bsring pa'i ngo bo'i gnyen por yang bshad do //
translated: It is also explained as the antidote that is the counteragent, the antidote that is the removal of the object, and the antidote that is the distancing of the object.

original: de'i phyir thams cad ces smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad ces smos te /
translated: Therefore, the term all is stated.

original: de ltar na rnam par grol ba'i lam dang khyad par gyi lam yang thams cad cis bya ba skabs dang sbyar te rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par grol ba'i lam dang khyad par gyi lam yang thams cad cis bya ba skabs dang sbyar te rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the path of liberation and the distinctive path should be understood in all cases as the path of preparation.🔽When afflictions are abandoned, from what are they abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba na gang las spang bar bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni /🔽ci rigs pa las sam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba na gang las spang bar bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni / ci rigs pa las sam /
translated: From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?

original: mtshungs par ldan pa las sam /🔽rang bzhin las yin zhes thams cad la skyon mthong nas 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa las sam / rang bzhin las yin zhes thams cad la skyon mthong nas 'dri ba'o //
translated: From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?🔽From what is it abandoned?

original: nyon mongs pa spong @177a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong @177a * //
translated: Abandon the afflictions.🔽🔽

original: bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: One is not able to abandon the afflictions.

original: rang bzhin las kyang 'di dag spong bar mi rigs te rang bzhin yongs su btang ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin las kyang 'di dag spong bar mi rigs te rang bzhin yongs su btang ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical that they are abandoned by intrinsic nature, because it is impossible to relinquish intrinsic nature.

original: spong bar byed pa ni chos kyi rang bzhin 'dor ba med do //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa ni chos kyi rang bzhin 'dor ba med do //
translated: And one who abandons does not relinquish the intrinsic nature of things.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar nyon mongs pa spang bar bya zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar nyon mongs pa spang bar bya zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be analyzed how the afflictions are abandoned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa ni spang byar 'dod ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa ni spang byar 'dod ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said that the afflictions are asserted to be abandoned by the object.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: From the associated, etc.

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la slar yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin par bya bar nus pa med do //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la slar yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin par bya bar nus pa med do //
translated: Since they are not mutually dependent, the afflictions cannot be abandoned by the associated. For, if the afflictions were abandoned by the associated, then the afflictions would not arise again in a defiled mind, because of the absence of non-arising.

original: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: First, the future, etc.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni gang gis dmigs pa de mi skye ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni gang gis dmigs pa de mi skye ste /
translated: The future does not arise from that which is the object, because it has not yet arisen.

original: de ni de la dmigs te mi skye bas rnam par dbye bar bya nus shing /
analyzed: de ni de la dmigs te mi skye bas rnam par dbye bar bya nus shing /
translated: Because it is possible to separate them by observing them,

original: de la dmigs te mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs te mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not arise by observing them.🔽How is it possible to separate past objects from the afflictions that observe them?🔽Afflictions are abandoned by observing them and by not observing them.

original: 'das pa ni ci ltar dmigs pa las rnam par dbye bar nus de la dmigs te mi skye ba'i phyir dang dmigs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spang bar bya zhing de dag mi dmigs par bya'o zhe na 'di ni 'di'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa ni ci ltar dmigs pa las rnam par dbye bar nus de la dmigs te mi skye ba'i phyir dang dmigs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spang bar bya zhing de dag mi dmigs par bya'o zhe na 'di ni 'di'i don ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the meaning of this treatise.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is the meaning?

original: dmigs pa yongs su shes pas spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di 'di'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs su shes pas spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are abandoned by thoroughly understanding their objects.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rang gi khams la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyi dmigs pa shes rab kyis mthong ba'i sgo nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba de thams cad spong bar
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rang gi khams la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyi dmigs pa shes rab kyis mthong ba'i sgo nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba de thams cad spong bar
translated: The meaning of this treatise is that all the negative tendencies of the desire realm that focus on the desire realm and are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin are abandoned by the wisdom that sees the objects of those negative tendencies.

original: byed do // gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba de thams cad kyi dmigs pa shes rab kyis mthong ba'i sgo nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba de thams cad spong bar byed do //
analyzed: byed do // gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba de thams cad kyi dmigs pa shes rab kyis mthong ba'i sgo nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba de thams cad spong bar byed do //
translated: All objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that are concomitant with the mental faculty in the desire realm are abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽All objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that are concomitant with the mental faculty in the form and formless realms are abandoned by the path of seeing.🔽All objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that are concomitant with the mental faculty in the desire realm are abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa med pa la dmigs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa yang shes rab kyis mthong ba'i sgo nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba de dag thams cad spong bar byed do //🔽yang ji snyed spong bar byed pa de thams cad kyi dmigs pa shes rab kyis mthong ba ma yin no //🔽phra rgyas rnams kyi dmigs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
