original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i dngos po dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i dngos po dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: All objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that are concomitant with the mental faculty in the form and formless realms are abandoned by the path of seeing.🔽All objects to be abandoned by the path

original: de la mtshungs par ldan pa'i dngos po ni yul rnams kyi phra rgyas rnams @177b te de ni phra rgyas kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa de'i yul rnams kyang gang zag gi rgyud la thob pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems ma chad par 'jug go /
analyzed: de la mtshungs par ldan pa'i dngos po ni yul rnams kyi phra rgyas rnams @177b te de ni phra rgyas kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa de'i yul rnams kyang gang zag gi rgyud la thob pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems ma chad par 'jug go /
translated: The object of the possession of the object is the object-fields of the negative tendencies, because the object-fields are obtained in the mindstream of a person through the power of the negative tendencies and they are not severed as long as the afflicted mind is operating.

original: de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i dngos po ni ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i yul rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i dngos po ni ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i yul rnams te /
translated: Similarly, the object of the possession of the nonobject is the object-fields that are the cause and result of past and future afflictions.

original: yul 'di nyon mongs pa'i rjes su kun tu spyod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yul 'di nyon mongs pa'i rjes su kun tu spyod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because this object is the object-field of the engagement of the secondary afflictions, it should be known as the possession of the afflictions.

original: de ni ma 'ongs pa rnams bskyed pa la rkyen du gyur ba'i phyir rgyur gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni ma 'ongs pa rnams bskyed pa la rkyen du gyur ba'i phyir rgyur gyur pa yin la /
translated: Because it is the condition for generating future afflictions, it is the cause.

original: 'das pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'bras bur gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'bras bur gyur pa nyid do //
translated: Because it is the object that is the natural outcome of past afflictions, it is the result.

original: de yang spong ba gnyen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i thob pa mnyam par 'jog par mi 'gal lo //🔽de nyon mongs pa rnams kyi kun tu 'dzin pa de'i phyir gang gi dmigs pas nyon mongs pa bskyed pa phan tshun dmigs pa rnams kyis kyang nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug go / de la dmigs pa spang ba gnyen po'i rgyu mthun pa bskyed pa'i nyon mongs pa
analyzed: de yang spong ba gnyen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i thob pa mnyam par 'jog par mi 'gal lo // de nyon mongs pa rnams kyi kun tu 'dzin pa de'i phyir gang gi dmigs pas nyon mongs pa bskyed pa phan tshun dmigs pa rnams kyis kyang nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug go / de la dmigs pa spang ba gnyen po'i rgyu mthun pa bskyed pa'i nyon mongs pa
translated: Moreover, the obtainment of the homogeneous cause of the antidote that abandons is not incompatible with equipoise.🔽Because of the complete apprehension of those, the afflictions engage through mutual observation, by means of which the afflictions are generated.

original: rnams la de'i thob pa mi ldan no //
analyzed: rnams la de'i thob pa mi ldan no //
translated: The obtainment of the afflictions that generate the homogeneous cause of the abandonment of those objects of observation does not exist.

original: de la dmigs pa rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'pho ba yod pa ma yin pas spang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'pho ba yod pa ma yin pas spang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And those that observe that are also called abandoned, because there is no transference of cause and effect.

original: gang gi phyir de yongs su mi shes pas de la nyon mongs pa'i yul dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyi yul de rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i stobs kyis thob pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yongs su mi shes pas de la nyon mongs pa'i yul dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyi yul de rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i stobs kyis thob pa ste /
translated: Because that is not thoroughly known, the objects of the afflictions and the objects of the afflictions exist by the power of the afflictions.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa rgyud la rab tu 'jug go / ji ltar dngos po yongs su shes pas mi 'jug pa de'i phyir dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa rgyud la rab tu 'jug go / ji ltar dngos po yongs su shes pas mi 'jug pa de'i phyir dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes
translated: Since one does not engage in them through fully understanding things, it is not the case that afflictions are to be abandoned from the object.

original: bya bar mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: bya bar mngon par 'dod do //
translated: This is what they clearly assert.

original: de yang ma nges te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang ma nges te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is not definite.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam pa bzhi sa zad par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam pa bzhi sa zad par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Because the afflictions are exhausted in four ways:

original: dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang / de la dmigs pa yang dag par zad ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang / de la dmigs pa yang dag par zad ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: through fully understanding the object, through the complete abandonment of that which is based on it, and so on.

original: gzugs thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All forms means

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang sems can dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang sems can dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral, sentient and non-sentient.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang bcas pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gzugs can ma yin pa rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa rnams de dag la dmigs pa'i @178a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang bcas pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gzugs can ma yin pa rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa rnams de dag la dmigs pa'i @178a * //
translated: The phrase “non-defiled dharmas” refers to the wholesome and unobscured-indeterminate dharmas that exist in one’s own and others’ mental continuums and are not physical.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang nyon mongs pa can gyi chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang nyon mongs pa can gyi chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “that are objects of the five consciousnesses” refers to form and defiled dharmas.

original: nyon mongs pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa spangs pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa spangs pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “by abandoning the afflictions that exist in one’s own mental continuum”

original: gang kho na de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa de kho na spangs pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed de /
analyzed: gang kho na de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa de kho na spangs pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed de /
translated: teaches that the abandonment of the afflictions that have those as their objects is the abandonment of those objects, but not the abandonment of other objects.

original: bar ma chad du 'gags pa skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa ni de ltar bas mchod pa'i phyir ring ba nyid du mi 'gyur te de yang rnam par shes pa lnga'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar ma chad du 'gags pa skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa ni de ltar bas mchod pa'i phyir ring ba nyid du mi 'gyur te de yang rnam par shes pa lnga'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “because they are not distant” teaches that the five consciousnesses are not distant from their objects because they arise immediately after the cessation of their objects and because they are directed toward their objects.

original: kha cig tu drug yang yin no //
analyzed: kha cig tu drug yang yin no //
translated: They are also the objects of the five consciousnesses.

original: gzhan dag ring ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ring ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The other is distant.

original: de bzhin du 'dus ma byas la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus ma byas la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The same holds for the unconditioned.

original: da ltar ba yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ltar ba yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The present is like the past and the future.

original: ji ltar da ltar ba las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag de bzhin du ring ba de rnams su gyur na /
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar ba las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag de bzhin du ring ba de rnams su gyur na /
translated: If the past and the future were distant in the same way that they are distant from the present,

original: da ltar ba yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lhar ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lhar ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the present would be distant from the past and the future.

original: 'dus ma byas ji ltar na nye ba nyid du grub ce na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ji ltar na nye ba nyid du grub ce na /
translated: How can the unconditioned be near?

original: 'di ni chos mngon pa las te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos mngon pa las te /
translated: The Abhidharma teaches that🔽the unconditioned is near.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: In fact, the Abhidharma teaches:

original: chos ring po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: chos ring po gang dag ce na /
translated: What are distant factors?

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag go / nye ba gang dag ce na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag go / nye ba gang dag ce na /
translated: Past and future factors. What are near factors?

original: da ltar byung ba dang 'dus ma byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang 'dus ma byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Present factors and the unconditioned.

original: dus gsum gyi bya ba rnam par gzhag pa las 'dus ma byas ni dus thams cad du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi bya ba rnam par gzhag pa las 'dus ma byas ni dus thams cad du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unconditioned is near because it is not distributed in time periods, for the unconditioned is not susceptible to the activity of arising.

original: kha cig na re bya ba med pa la yang ring pa nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re bya ba med pa la yang ring pa nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It follows that what does not have action also does not have distance.

original: bya ba shin tu med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i chos bzhin 'dus ma byas ring ba nyid du rnam par dpyad par mi nus so //
analyzed: bya ba shin tu med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i chos bzhin 'dus ma byas ring ba nyid du rnam par dpyad par mi nus so //
translated: Because action is completely nonexistent, like unarisen phenomena, unconditioned phenomena cannot be analyzed as being distant.

original: de thams cad du thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba 'dus ma byas ni yul dang dus kyi nges pa med par thob pa de'i phyir de nye bar zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de thams cad du thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba 'dus ma byas ni yul dang dus kyi nges pa med par thob pa de'i phyir de nye bar zhes brjod do //
translated: Because it is obtained everywhere, that is, because unconditioned virtue is obtained without regard to place or time, it is called near.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The past and future would also be near,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar thob pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang nya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar thob pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang nya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the past and future and the absorptions and so on are obtained in the same way, it follows that the past and future would also be near.

original: nam mkha' yang ji ltar na nye ba yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang ji ltar na nye ba yin /
translated: How is space near?

original: de thob pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not obtained.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: nam mkha' ni thams cad du de'i mtshan nyid ma thogs pa'i phyir nye ba yin zhing so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang 'bad pa med par thams cad kyi thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe dmigs pa'i phyir nye ba yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni thams cad du de'i mtshan nyid ma thogs pa'i phyir nye ba yin zhing so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang 'bad pa med par thams cad kyi thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe dmigs pa'i phyir nye ba yin no //
translated: always without effort.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang mngon par sbyor bas yang dag par zhugs pa la gang du kla tsa n'a shu /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang mngon par sbyor bas yang dag par zhugs pa la gang du kla tsa n'a shu /
translated: Some say that cessation attained through cultivation is also near because🔽it is observed everywhere and always without distinction by one who has🔽entered it through application.🔽Some say that it is not observed at all, because it is not observed without

original: thams cad @178b kyi thams cad du khyad par med par dmigs pa'i phyir nye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thams cad @178b kyi thams cad du khyad par med par dmigs pa'i phyir nye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: distinction everywhere and always.🔽In the same way, the same consequence would apply to the past and the

original: de bzhin du gang bshad pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de aa pa bhaddham /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang bshad pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de aa pa bhaddham /
translated: future, as explained.🔽Some say that it is not observed at all, because it is not observed without

original: kha cig kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du khyad par med par ma dmigs pas /
analyzed: kha cig kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du khyad par med par ma dmigs pas /
translated: distinction everywhere and always.

original: thams cad du de thob pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la thal bar bshad pa de 'di'i lan du mi sbyar ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thams cad du de thob pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la thal bar bshad pa de 'di'i lan du mi sbyar ro zhes zer ro //
translated: But this is not the response to the objection that the past and future would be present because they would obtain everywhere.

original: de lta ma yin na so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang thams cad kyi ma yin pa dang thams cad du ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang thams cad kyi ma yin pa dang thams cad du ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then analytical cessation would not be all things and would not be everywhere.

original: de bzhin du so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa la yang ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa la yang ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, nonanalytical cessation should be explained as appropriate.

original: gnyi gar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /🔽ji ltar da ltar byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang nye ba'i phyir dang gzhan gyis mchod pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba dag kyang nye bar bshad pa de ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang gzhan gyis mchod pa'i phyir
analyzed: gnyi gar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni / ji ltar da ltar byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang nye ba'i phyir dang gzhan gyis mchod pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba dag kyang nye bar bshad pa de ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang gzhan gyis mchod pa'i phyir
translated: Both is possible means🔽just as the present is explained as near because it is near to the past and future and is worshipped by them, so too the past and future are near the present because they are worshipped by it.

original: da ltar byung ba dang nye bar 'gyur la ;
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang nye bar 'gyur la ;
translated: The past and future are near the present because they are worshipped by it.

original: da ltar byung bas chod pa'i phyir phan tshun gyi sgo nas ring ba nyid de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyi gar 'gyur ba'o //🔽ring ba'am nye ba zhes bya ba la 'di skad du rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung bas chod pa'i phyir phan tshun gyi sgo nas ring ba nyid de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyi gar 'gyur ba'o // ring ba'am nye ba zhes bya ba la 'di skad du rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are obstructed by the present, they are distant in terms of mutual exclusion, and they are both past and future.

original: slob dpon gyi ste /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi ste /
translated: The master says, “It should be understood that they are distant or near in this way.”

original: ma 'ongs pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob la /
translated: The future does not obtain its intrinsic identity,

original: 'das pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid btang ba'i phyir de dag ring ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid btang ba'i phyir de dag ring ba'o //
translated: and the past relinquishes its intrinsic identity.

original: gzhan dag na re rang bzhin med pa la ring ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di yang mi 'thad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rang bzhin med pa la ring ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di yang mi 'thad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that this is untenable because distance is untenable for that which lacks intrinsic reality.

original: de las gzhan pa'i ring ba ni re zhig 'di ltar gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag da ltar byung ba bzhin rang bzhin gyis yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ring ba ni re zhig 'di ltar gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag da ltar byung ba bzhin rang bzhin gyis yod par 'dod na /
translated: Distance from that which is other is as follows: If the past and future existed essentially as the present does,

original: de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: then they would not be past and future,

original: da ltar byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba bzhin no //
translated: like the present.

original: shar dang nub kyi rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: shar dang nub kyi rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang ma nges pa'o //
translated: The eastern and western oceans, etc., are not determined.

original: gnyen po skyes pas zad pa zhes bya ba bshad la /
analyzed: gnyen po skyes pas zad pa zhes bya ba bshad la /
translated: It is said that the abandonment of the object to be abandoned is due to the arising of the antidote.

original: ci lam khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi lam dang ldan pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu bsdus pa'i lam kun tu spyod par mthong ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba'i yang 'bras bu nyid lhan cig 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi lam thob pas 'bras bu'i lam shin tu
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi lam dang ldan pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu bsdus pa'i lam kun tu spyod par mthong ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba'i yang 'bras bu nyid lhan cig 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi lam thob pas 'bras bu'i lam shin tu
translated: Because one who possesses the path that is distinguished by its result fully engages the path subsumed by its result in a gradual manner, it is seen that one who is previously freed from attachment also obtains the path that is distinguished by its result, which is the result of that path.

original: spyod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it would follow that one would fully engage the path that is its result.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo pa med de mthong pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po gnas pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po thob pa la kha cig tu skyes pa yod do //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo pa med de mthong pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po gnas pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po thob pa la kha cig tu skyes pa yod do //
translated: There is no one who is born in the summit of existence who obtains the antidote to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, because there is no one who is born in the desire realm who obtains the antidote to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi lam thob pa'i gnyen po yang ji ltar rigs par 'jig rten pa'i lam thob pas 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa la kun rdzob shes pa yang ma 'ongs pa goms par byed do
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi lam thob pa'i gnyen po yang ji ltar rigs par 'jig rten pa'i lam thob pas 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa la kun rdzob shes pa yang ma 'ongs pa goms par byed do
translated: The future state of familiarity with conventional knowledge is also similar.

original: // nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po 'dra ba nyid kyis de'i gegs dang bral ba yang 'dra bas /
analyzed: // nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po 'dra ba nyid kyis de'i gegs dang bral ba yang 'dra bas /
translated: Since the antidote to affliction is similar, freedom from the obstruction to that is similar.

original: de'i phyir bral ba'i thob pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di ni legs par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bral ba'i thob pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di ni legs par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this aspect of the obtainment of freedom and so on is well established.🔽Knowledge parijna is uncontaminated knowledge.

original: de la ye shes kyis yongs su shes pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas ji srid dgra bcom pa'i bar du thob pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes kyis yongs su shes pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas ji srid dgra bcom pa'i bar du thob pa med pa'o //
translated: This is because the result of stream entry and so on is not obtained by contaminated wisdom.

original: dbang po dgu rnams kyis rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis zag pa dang bcas pa yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dgu rnams kyis rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis zag pa dang bcas pa yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Thus it is uncontaminated wisdom that fully knows contaminated states.

original: gzhan dag na re lhag par mos pa yid la byed pa dang tha dad med pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yongs su shes pa chos kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su gcod cing 'dzin pa thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lhag par mos pa yid la byed pa dang tha dad med pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yongs su shes pa chos kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su gcod cing 'dzin pa thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba
translated: Others say: It is mundane fully knowing that is not differentiated from attention that is resolute belief, which is the discernment and comprehension of the nature of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena that arises from hearing, contemplation and meditation.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos mchog la sogs pa rnams su yongs su shes pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos mchog la sogs pa rnams su yongs su shes pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: It is fully knowing that occurs in the stages of heat, peak, patience, the supreme mundane state and so on.

original: gang gi phyir chos gcig kyang mngon par ma shes par sdug bsngal mthar phyin par nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs pas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad yongs su shes pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos gcig kyang mngon par ma shes par sdug bsngal mthar phyin par nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs pas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad yongs su shes pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you ask, since it is said, I do not say that suffering is terminated without directly knowing one phenomenon, then is it not the case that uncontaminated wisdom fully knows all phenomena?

original: chos gang dag ma shes pa sdug bsngal zad pa'i @184a * //
analyzed: chos gang dag ma shes pa sdug bsngal zad pa'i @184a * //
translated: Those phenomena that are not understood are the origin of suffering.🔽

original: gegs su 'gyur bas de la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: gegs su 'gyur bas de la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault, because the Buddha spoke with the intention that one not understand those things that would obstruct the termination of suffering.

original: spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa ni spangs pa kho na ste nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa ni spangs pa kho na ste nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The complete knowledge that is abandonment is just the abandonment itself, i.e., freedom from the defilements.

original: yongs su shes pa nyid yongs su shes pa ma yin nam zhe na de la 'di ni shes pa'i rnam grangs nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa nyid yongs su shes pa ma yin nam zhe na de la 'di ni shes pa'i rnam grangs nyid do //
translated: Isn't complete knowledge just knowledge? It is a synonym for knowledge.

original: ci ltar dmigs pa med pa spangs pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar dmigs pa med pa spangs pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How can the nonexistence of an object be called the complete knowledge of abandonment?

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyur btags pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyur btags pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, because the result is figuratively designated as the cause.

original: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu la 'dir yongs su shes pa'i sgras bshad de /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu la 'dir yongs su shes pa'i sgras bshad de /
translated: Here, the result of complete knowledge is called complete knowledge.

original: dper na reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, “These six bases of contact should be known as past karma.”

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the antidotes to the objects to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are different.

original: ji ltar gzugs na spyod pa'i phung po bdag med pa de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyang ste /🔽yod pa'i dngos po can thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams gnyen po 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs na spyod pa'i phung po bdag med pa de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyang ste / yod pa'i dngos po can thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams gnyen po 'dra ba ma yin no //

original: ji ltar gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mchog yin pa de ltar gzugs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ma yin pas yod pa'i dngos po can no //🔽bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams te chos tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po can rnams so //🔽gnyen po mi 'dra ba'i phyir tha dad pa de spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mchog yin pa de ltar gzugs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ma yin pas yod pa'i dngos po can no //🔽bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams te chos tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po can rnams so //🔽gnyen po mi 'dra ba'i phyir tha dad pa de spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The formless realm is not the antidote to the view of the self, because it is not a homogeneous cause of the view of the self, since it is not a homogeneous cause of the aggregates of the form realm.🔽The formless realm is not the antidote to the view of the self, because it is not a homogeneous cause of the view of the self, since it is not a homogeneous cause of the aggregates

original: yang ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kho na spangs pa yongs su shes pa'i ming thob pa de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kho na spangs pa yongs su shes pa'i ming thob pa de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams yin nam zhe na /
translated: Just as the path of seeing is called perfect knowledge because it abandons objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, so too, is the path of meditation called perfect knowledge because it abandons objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation?

original: gcig na re bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams nyid gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gcig na re bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams nyid gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: One says: The perfect knowledge that is the exhaustion of attachment to the form realm is the objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation alone.

original: 'dir de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs kyang gtso bo yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags smras so //
analyzed: 'dir de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs kyang gtso bo yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags smras so //
translated: Here, although other afflictions are abandoned, attachment is mentioned because it is the chief.

original: gnyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: gnyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang par bya ba dag go //
translated: Two are objects to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: cig shos ni ma yin te 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa spang pa ni tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa'i yongs su shes par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin te 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa spang pa ni tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa'i yongs su shes par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The other is not, because the abandonment of the afflicted view of the self and so on is posited as the perfect knowledge that abandons that which is associated with the lower level.

original: zag pa thams cad spangs pa yang ste /
analyzed: zag pa thams cad spangs pa yang ste /
translated: It is also the abandonment of all contaminants.

original: @184b kun tu spyod pa thams cad yongs su gtugs pa'i yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @184b kun tu spyod pa thams cad yongs su gtugs pa'i yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called thorough knowledge that completely exhausts all conduct.

original: 'di ltar rnam par grol pa'i lam la dgong sa nas 'bri ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par grol pa'i lam la dgong sa nas 'bri ba ni /
translated: Thus, the path of liberation is called the fruit of perseverance.

original: ji ltar yongs su shes pa bzod pa'i 'bras bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su shes pa bzod pa'i 'bras bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is thorough knowledge the fruit of perseverance?

original: shes pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su shes pa zhes bshad de ;
analyzed: shes pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su shes pa zhes bshad de ;
translated: Thorough knowledge is explained as the fruit of knowledge,

original: de'i phyir bzod pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su shes pa ma yin no //🔽rigs par brjod par 'dod pas bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor can yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzod pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su shes pa ma yin no // rigs par brjod par 'dod pas bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor can yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: but it is not the fruit of perseverance.🔽One who wishes to state a logical reason says, because perseverance is the retinue of knowledge.

original: bzod pas byas pa ni spangs pa ste shes pas zhes sems so //
analyzed: bzod pas byas pa ni spangs pa ste shes pas zhes sems so //
translated: Abandonment is accomplished by perseverance, but it is thought to be by knowledge.

original: rgyal po'i gnas lta bu ni 'dir shes pa dang bzod pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i gnas lta bu ni 'dir shes pa dang bzod pa rnams so //
translated: Knowledge and perseverance are like a king and his abode.

original: 'khor du gyur pas na rgyal po'i pho brang ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor du gyur pas na rgyal po'i pho brang ba ste /
translated: Because they become the retinue, they are the king’s abode.

original: gla rngan gyis byas pa bzhin no zhes bye brag smra ba rnams zer ro //
analyzed: gla rngan gyis byas pa bzhin no zhes bye brag smra ba rnams zer ro //
translated: They are like those who are paid wages.

original: shes pa dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rnam par grol ba'i lam la yang spang ba'i bya ba yod de spangs pa de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rnam par grol ba'i lam la yang spang ba'i bya ba yod de spangs pa de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the path of liberation has the action of abandoning because it seizes that which is abandoned.

original: yang kun tu spyod pa thob par mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: yang kun tu spyod pa thob par mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: Moreover, it is untenable that one obtains complete knowledge.

original: mi shes pa'i 'bras bu nyid med pas de spangs pa'o zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i 'bras bu nyid med pas de spangs pa'o zhes ston par byed do //
translated: It is taught that the result of non-knowledge does not exist, therefore it is abandoned.

original: 'di yang de lta bu ma yin par brjod par byed de /
analyzed: 'di yang de lta bu ma yin par brjod par byed de /
translated: But this is not so, it is said.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kho na'i bral ba ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kho na'i bral ba ni thob pa'o //
translated: The separation obtained by the uninterrupted paths alone is the result of the path of liberation.

original: skyes bu byed pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ye shes kyis sngar spangs pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i bral ba ni thob pa'o //🔽bsdam pa'i phyir bzod pa'i 'bras bu yang yin la shes pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ye shes kyis sngar spangs pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i bral ba ni thob pa'o //🔽bsdam pa'i phyir bzod pa'i 'bras bu yang yin la shes pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is the result of the action of an existent being, the separation of the uncontaminated state of previously abandoned objects by the transcendent wisdom concomitant with the vajra like samadhi is the result of the path of liberation.🔽In order to demonstrate that it is the result of the action of an existent being, the separation of the uncontaminated state of previously abandoned objects by the transcendent wisdom concomitant with the vajra like samadhi is the result of the path of liberation.🔽In order to demonstrate that it is the result of the action of an existent being, the separation of the uncontaminated state of previously abandoned objects by the transcendent wisdom concomitant with the vajra like samadhi is the result of the path of liberation.

original: mthar gyis pa'i yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba de nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa yang shes pa'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba de nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa yang shes pa'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod do //
translated: The result of the knowledge of the truths is also asserted to be the abandonment of the factors associated with the lower realms such as the afflicted view of the self,

original: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba /
translated: because it is said:

original: lhag ma rnams ni shes pa yi //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni shes pa yi //
translated: The remaining are knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba dang / mi lcogs med 'bras thams cad do //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / mi lcogs med 'bras thams cad do // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: And: The result of unrestricted access concentration is all.

original: de la brten nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is tenable that all afflictions are abandoned in dependence on that.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: They are the nature of the abandonment of afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.
